story:
Appalachian Quidditch wants to go to our regional tournament so we can qualify for the World Cup!

But we're looking at a lot of costs (hotel, bus, meals, IQA fees), and, being poor college kids, it's going to be rough on our already empty wallets.

So we're looking to you - our fans, our players' relatives and friends, our supporters - to help us get to Leesburg, Va. so we can have a shot at making it to the World Cup this spring.

Any amount benefits us greatly, and we appreciate every penny. 

And, if you have any spare change left over, make sure you also check out our sister team's (UNC Greensboro) Indiegogo campaign. We'll be sharing a bus and booking hotels with them.

Thank you so much for your support,

-Courtney Colwell & Abbi Pittman
Appalachian Quidditch Commissioners

story:
Our Story

My name is Heather Richey.  I grew up in Chesterton, Indiana, a small town in the Midwest where family is the foundation of life.  I have always wanted a family of my own, and know that I would give a child so much unconditional love. 
My Husband, Adam, and I have been together for over 12 years and started trying to have a family in 2007.  I never imagined 4 years later we would still be childless.  But we are.  We have been through a gamut of testing including blood tests, sperm analyses, an HSG, and everything our doctors can think of to try and diagnosis us or shed some light.  I have been on clomid and have had 2 failed IUIs.  I have tried acupuncture, Chinese herbs, maya massage, standing on my head, ovulation prediction kits, basal body temperature charting, eating better, exercising more, exercising less, yoga, meditation, and more! All to no availâ€¦  I have watched countless friends have children (some even 2), and yet still we remain stuck in the boat of unexplained infertility.  Month after month I try to remain hopeful while mourning the loss of the thing I never had.  Itâ€™s a lot to handle and it is incredibly consuming. 
In an effort to leave no stone unturned, Adam and I are at our last resort: IVF.  Itâ€™s a place no couple ever dreams of being, yet here we are.  Faced with the brutal reality that we may never have a child, we have decided to take the plunge, empty what little savings we have, and gamble that medicine can give us the boost we need.  We only have one shot at this, so we are doing everything we can to try and make it the best shot possible.  My eggs are not getting any younger.  Time is not on our side so we need to get this show on the road.

I was referred to the CNY in New York by my midwife in Colorado.  She suggested that they work with couples who are struggling with infertility but who have limited financial resources.    Our plan is to do 1 IVF cycle in February of 2012. 

The Impact

We are humbly asking for help.  Given 2 mortgages, my husbandâ€™s inconsistent work in the construction industry, we have not been able to save as much as we would have liked.  In preparing for IVF it became clear that we can't afford it alone.  But it also became clear that there are others, just like us, who are struggling immensely to afford this procedure, and who dream day after day of holding a child in their arms.  It is such a defeating place to be when youâ€™re told you canâ€™t have the one thing you wish for the most. Money should be no object in obtaining life.  Yet it is an undeniable object. People say you can't put a price on life, right? Wrong....and unfortunately it's more than a lot of us can handle.  Insurance companies tell us that infertility is not a medical necessity and therefore assisted reproduction is not covered.  Not a medical necessity? Tell that to any couple who has struggled to conceive, and they will laugh at you through their frustrated tears. If you've ever had an empty place in your life and your heart you cannot fill, and that you unwillingly have to accept, then you have a whiff of what it's like to struggle with infertility. 

So we came here.  In raising funds for our own procedure we are also hoping to help others in need.  We know that this is just the beginning, that children cost money, hospital bills are expensive, not to mention all the needs that a child has.  But if you can't conceive then you can't get to those places.  I would happily worry about all of those next steps if we could just be blessed with a child.  And I know so many other women who feel the same way. We desire the morning sickness, the stretch marks, the sleepless nights, the pickles and ice cream cravings!  We long to look at a little one and have our hearts melt.  We just need a jumpstart financially to give us renewed hope and a better chance at pregnancy.  Therefore, I'm hoping that the impact of this campaign will be far-reaching.  It will make something priceless possible that would otherwise be impossible: life.   



What We Need & What You Get

The entire procedure will cost us approximately $15K including air fare, medication, hotel, and time off work.  We are prepared to contribute everything we have so are asking for a minimum of $6000 to get us started.  However, I would also love to be able to give funds to others in need who are also struggling to afford their procedures.  To that end, I am working on establishing an account with either the clinic who is making this procedure possible for us or through another center for reproductive medicine to assist couples in need.  

Therefore, we have come up with the following structure of funds received to be able to give to others as well as fund our own cycle:

 
If we receive $6,500-$7,000 then we will give 10%, if we receive $7,001-$8,000 then we will give 20%, if we receive $8,001-$9,000 then we will give 25% and anything over $10,000 we will donate 30% of the funds received.  If we receive over $15K, then in addition to the percentage, every penny over it will go to other families.  We would love to give back as much as possible and help others' with their dreams, while realizing we could greatly use as much as possible towards our own.  The sky is the limit!  We would love to double our goal or even triple it... IVF is expensive and there is a great need total among struggling couples. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially, the next best way to help is to share this page. Help me spread the word!

story:
Short Summary

To outperform the competition in today’s data driven business environment, companies need the ability to effectively analyze acquired data.  inFlo has developed a beta software that enables a company to achieve competency in the organization and management of applicable “big data.” Although inFlo has already developed a successful client-verified prototype software version of the product, MultiGraph, the program needs to be modified for commercial release and user manuals need to be created. MultiGraph allows companies to analyze their data more efficiently. By increasing the efficiency of analysis, it minimizes the lag time between data ingestion and business adaptation. 

inFlo needs your support through this campaign to upgrade its software in order to make the product ready for public release. Funds raised through this campaign will also be used to pay for costs associated with the protection of intellectual property derived from MultiGraph. Any contribution that you can make is crucial and very appreciated for the growth of inFlo.

The co-founders of inFlo, Andrew Koff and Sean Scott, are students at Duke University who are dedicated to developing high quality software management products at unbeatable costs.  They believe that there is a void in the current business environment for software capable of processing and analyzing large datasets in a cost-efficient manner.  MultiGraph will fill this void and allow companies to extract value from “big data” at affordable rates. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise at least $2000 from this campaign to purchase much needed software upgrades along with the expense for the preparation and filing of both copyrights and patents. Currently, inFlo's development of a commercially available version of MultiGraph is limited by the free-trial software we are using to create the product. An upgrade would greatly improve our production capabilities. Also, we have intellectual property that needs to be protected prior to launch and the funds will help secure patents and source code copyrights. 

The perks below are a way to help grow our product to its full potential. Please join our data revolution by making a donation of any size! 

The Impact

MultiGraph is an all-in-one data solution that will significantly improve large-scale analysis. The campaign will serve as a step towards making this product the trusted data solution for all applications. Your help will allow us to achieve our goal!

Thank you.

story:
Zoe is an 11-year-old girl who suffers from both Ehlers Danlos Sundrome (EDS) and Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS), two rare and painful incurable disorders. EDS targets the connective tissues in the body, leading to issues such as joint dislocations, hypermobility, and chronic pain, while CRPS is a malfunction of the nervous system generally brought on by injury, minor or major, although it may have no precipitating event.

Zoe's prognosis is not clear, since EDS can also affect her internal organs and nervous system. And she needs a lot of things that aren't covered by her family's health care to have a more accessible and independent life. She needs renovations to her family's bathroom so that she can fit in there with her wheelchair, along with a specialized stair lift since her leg does not bend. 

Her family also needs an accessible vehicle to take her to school and her many doctor's appointments, which is hopefully where you come in! We've managed to raise $34,000 of the $40,000 we need to get that van for Zoe (take a look at the quote below!), but we still need another $6,000 to make this van and real mobility for Zoe a reality. So dig around in your couch and see if you can find some money you weren't using anyway! We'll give you great stuff! And you'll get a warm fuzzy feeling in your heart that cash in the sofa can't give you.

story:
About My Illness!

Hi my name is Rick. I was born with a form of Cerebral Palsy (CP) called Spastic Diplegia.  Spastic Diplegia is a neuromuscular condition of hypertonia and spasticity in the muscles of the lower extremities of the human body, usually those of the legs, hips and pelvis.  Spastic diplegia's particular type of brain damage inhibits the proper development of upper motor neuron function, impacting the motor cortex, the basal ganglia and the corticospinal tract. Nerve receptors in the spine leading to affected muscles become unable to properly absorb gamma amino butyric acid (GABA), the amino acid that regulates muscle tone in humans. Without GABA absorption to those particular nerve rootlets, affected nerves (in this case, the ones controlling the legs) perpetually fire the message for their corresponding muscles to permanently, rigidly contract, and the muscles become permanently hypertonic.

The abnormally high muscle tone that results creates lifelong difficulty with all voluntary and passive movement in the legs, and generally creates stress over time â€” depending on the severity of the condition in the individual, the constant spasticity ultimately produces pain, muscle/joint breakdown including tendinitis and arthritis, premature physical exhaustion (i.e., becoming physically exhausted even when you internally know that you have more energy than you are able to use), contractures, spasms, and progressively worse deformities/mis-alignments of bone structure around areas of the tightened musculature as the person's years progress.

About Me!

In 2000 I started to have less control of my body. Each day daily tasks become much more difficult for me to accomplish such as brushing my teeth, getting dressed, taking a shower, cleaning and cooking.

In July of 2009 over a 3 day period I went from walking with a cane to being paralyzed and unable to do anything for myself, I couldnâ€™t even speak to communicate what was wrong with me.  I was in the hospital for 3 months and then moved to a rehabilitation center for 4 months. 

What I need!

I estimate that my ultimate financial need will be around $10,000. This will pay for the treatments that are not covered by insurance such as:

Â·         Amen Clinics, Inc. (ACI), in Virginia, has amassed the worldâ€™s largest databases of functional brain (SPECT) scans. In his experience scans were clinically helpful in understanding ADHD, anxiety, depression, autism, Aspergers Syndrome, learning disabilities, dyslexia, traumatic brain injuries, dementia, Alzheimerâ€™s, addictions, substance abuse, violence, suicidal behavior, marital conflicts, work problems, behavior disorders, schizophrenia, bipolar and other brain related diseases.

Â·         Wheel chair will enable me to get around the hospitals for my treatment.

              Physical therapy to get me back to the state I was prior to the 2000 episode.

Â·         Over $10,000 in past due medical bills not covered by insurance.

 

Other Ways You Can Help!

The biggest way you can help beyond monetary donations is to SPREAD THE WORD.

Please see the buttons above and help share this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, or other social media sites of your choice!

Thank you VERY MUCH for helping me out through this difficult time!

Rick

story:
Julie has an appointment on September 15th at 2:15pm to see Dr. Di Julio (a Neurologist) in Long Beach to follow-up on a CT scan she had at the Long Beach Hospital last month. 

WE DO NOT HAVE HEALTH INSURANCE AND DO NOT HAVE MONEY TO PAY FOR THE VISIT!
That's where this campaign comes into the equation.
We believe in the power of the internet, and more importantly... the power of people who care! 
I met my husband on the internet.
I found friendship and emotional support on the internet.
I have to believe that we will find help and hope here, too! 


If you are fortunate enough to have insurance...
we ask that you donate the cost of ONE COPAY.

(Standard copays are usually $10-15.  Specialist copays are usually $25-50)
Thank you to Laura L. for this great idea.
______________________________________________________________

As you can see from the photo, the scan shows a brain tumor (probably a benign meningioma). 
Julie has been having severe headaches, blurred and double vision, as well as intense pain and tremors/twitching.  We've been unable to get her to a Neurologist through the county system, and we have no insurance. 

The Neurologist office is demanding payment upfront, or they will turn us away. 
We need your help!




This first step will help us understand what we're dealing with and what we will have to do in the coming months to make sure that Julie gets better and can get back to dancing, performing, taking pictures and being her normal creative amazing self.

We'll be preparing a longer/larger campaign in the coming week... where lots of cool perks will be available (photography prints and burlesque-y prizes) for you helping Julie.  We know that she will need an MRI and to see a Neurosurgeon for a consult... but, that will come later.  Right now, we need your help making sure she DOES NOT MISS THIS APPOINTMENT! 

The goal is actually more than we need (but it was the minimum for the site).  We just need to raise $350 to make this possible and pay IdieGogo their fees.

You can also make direct contributions to JulieADugan@Gmail.com (through Paypal).
Any/All help is greatly appreciated.

story:
This year, approximately six hundred thousand Americans, and more than 7 million humans around the world, will die of cancer. In the United States, one in three women and one in two men will develop cancer during their lifetime. A quarter of all American deaths, and about 15 percent of all deaths worldwide, will be attributed to cancer. In some nations, cancer will surpass heart disease to become the most common cause of death.” (from The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer, by S. Mukherjee.

A unique and very unsual disovery was made at Wake Forest University.  The discovery was that of innate (or natural) cancer immunity in a Wild Type Balb-C mouse. This cancer resistancy has been named Cancer Killing Activity or (CKA).

In one of the first experiments dealing with the discovery of the CKA in 1999, a group of mice were injected with mouse sarcoma cancer cells, a highly lethal form of mouse soft tissue cancer cells, with an expectation that all the injected mice should develop cancerous ascites or liquid tumors and die.  However, one male mouse, unlike all others, failed to develop these chemical tumors and remained healthy after repeated challenges with these lethal cancer cells. After subsequent re-testing to rule out possibilities of technical error, it was realized that this unexpected mouse possessed the innate ability to resist even the most lethal injections of cancerous cells.

 Can this innate cancer immunity be transferred innate cancer immunity (or CKA) be transferred from one mouse to the next?  Studies have proven that it can.

Also are there humans that exist with this type of cancer immunity?  The answer is also yes. 

One apparent question is then whether cancer-resistant humans as donors can be found to test a similar cancer treatment via allogenic white cell transfer.  Using a newly developed in vitro assay to measure white cell’s ability to kill various target cancer cell lines, we surveyed human volunteers and found a significant number of healthy humans having the CKA very similar to that of cancer-resistant mice.  There is a bell-shaped distribution of CKA in the population of healthy humans.  The CKA average seems to be lower in older human population and to be even lower in human cancer patients. The CKA can also be abolished by stress and change of seasons.  Based on these findings and the ability to screen for cancer-resistant humans as allogenic, white blood cell donors, we proposed a new cancer treatment strategy, termed “G.I.F.T.”(Granulocyte InFusion Therapy.

The newly designed G.I.F.T. offers a completely new concept for cancer treatment via transfusion of granulocytes that contain the vast majority of CKA in peripheral white blood cells from cancer-resistant donors to cancer patients.  The transferred donor granulocytes with high CKA are capable of tracking down cancer cells and lesions for specific destruction without harming normal cells.  GIFT is based on exceptional success in preclinical testing. 

Currently Munogenics, Inc. is starting a Phase II (a) clinical trial utilizing this concept of transfusing leukocytes with high cancer killing activity into 22 cancer patients with various solid tumors.

The donor screening was very successful.  It has been established that a high percentage of prospective donors, that have been screened to date, have a significant amount of cancer killing activity and are suitable donors for advanced cancer patients.

Munogenics is now starting the treatment portion of this clinical trial.  Twenty-two patients with advanced cancer are to be treated with the unique G.I.F.T. treatment.   Munogenics is needing $1,500,000 to complete this clinical trial. 

It is felt that this is the most signficant and relevant cancer clinical trial in history.  If this concept of treating cancer patients is as successful in humans as it was in the mice, we could be on the verge of eliminating the dreaded disease of cancer in our life time.  We can also spare the cancer victims of very invasive surgery, toxic chemotherapies and harsh radiation treatments.

In these tough economic times, with decreased cancer funding capabilities, we are now coming to you for help. Now you can help to develop the pathway of eliminating the dreaded disease of cancer. 

With your donation, it will help us to start the clinical phase of this project to bring this treatment to the forefront of full development. 

 Won’t you please help with your donations to this noble cause?

Please help us in this quest to combat this horrible disease.  Your donation and support is greatly appreciated!
story_txt:
This year, approximately six hundred thousand Americans, and more than 7 million humans around the world, will die of cancer. In the United States, one in three women and one in two men will develop cancer during their lifetime. A quarter of all American deaths, and about 15 percent of all deaths worldwide, will be attributed to cancer. In some nations, cancer will surpass heart disease to become the most common cause of death.” (from The Emperor of All Maladies: A Biography of Cancer, by S. Mukherjee.
A unique and very unsual disovery was made at Wake Forest University.  The discovery was that of innate (or natural) cancer immunity in a Wild Type Balb-C mouse. This cancer resistancy has been named Cancer Killing Activity or (CKA).
In one of the first experiments dealing with the discovery of the CKA in 1999, a group of mice were injected with mouse sarcoma cancer cells, a highly lethal form of mouse soft tissue cancer cells, with an expectation that all the injected mice should develop cancerous ascites or liquid tumors and die.  However, one male mouse, unlike all others, failed to develop these chemical tumors and remained healthy after repeated challenges with these lethal cancer cells. After subsequent re-testing to rule out possibilities of technical error, it was realized that this unexpected mouse possessed the innate ability to resist even the most lethal injections of cancerous cells.
 Can this innate cancer immunity be transferred innate cancer immunity (or CKA) be transferred from one mouse to the next?  Studies have proven that it can.
Also are there humans that exist with this type of cancer immunity?  The answer is also yes. 
One apparent question is then whether cancer-resistant humans as donors can be found to test a similar cancer treatment via allogenic white cell transfer.  Using a newly developed in vitro assay to measure white cell’s ability to kill various target cancer cell lines, we surveyed human volunteers and found a significant number of healthy humans having the CKA very similar to that of cancer-resistant mice.  There is a bell-shaped distribution of CKA in the population of healthy humans.  The CKA average seems to be lower in older human population and to be even lower in human cancer patients. Munogenics is now starting the treatment portion of this clinical trial.  Twenty-two patients with advanced cancer are to be treated with the unique G.I.F.T. treatment.   Munogenics is needing $1,500,000 to complete this clinical trial. 
It is felt that this is the most signficant and relevant cancer clinical trial in history.  If this concept of treating cancer patients is as successful in humans as it was in the mice, we could be on the verge of eliminating the dreaded disease of cancer in our life time.  We can also spare the cancer victims of very invasive surgery, toxic chemotherapies and harsh radiation treatments.

Please help us in this quest to combat this horrible disease.  Your donation and support is greatly appreciated!

story:
I cannot begin to express my gratitude for your contributions.

Even though we have accomplished our first goal of $5,000 please continue to read and share my story.

I set my goal low due to limitations of this campaign, as I never expected to reach my goal and this website discourages unrealistic goals.

My actual medical costs are much closer to $20,000.

I truly thought that $5,000 was unattainable, and I am overwhelmed that we have surpassed it. I would just like to remind everyone to please – even though my goal is “fulfilled” at $5,000 this campaign allows us to exceed that amount. Please read my story, and continue to share and contribute if you possibly can.

**********************************************************************************************************

Hello! My name is Jessica, and that's me before part of my head was shaved and I lost almost 40 pounds. But let me back up just a little bit. In early February 2013 I was stricken with a disease called Chiari Malformation. It’s not like cancer or most of the diseases that every one knows about or can personally relate to, so let me give you a little background info...

During skull development, the area that contains the back part of my brain didn’t grow as large as necessary. So once my brain finished growing, it ended up being too big for my skull. Since the skull isn’t the most flexible thing in the body, the only place for the cerebellum to go is into the spinal canal. This puts pressure on the brainstem, spine, and in turn, the cerebellum. This causes debilitating neurological signs such as paralyzing head and neck pain, dizziness and balance issues, loss of sensation in the arms, loss of fine motor control, vision problems, difficulty swallowing, nausea, etc. which only get progressively worse without treatment.

Although it's a condition I was born with, symptoms often do not present until the late 20s. That's exactly when it hit me hard and fast and my only option was immediate surgery to remove a portion of my skull and spinal vertebrae to make room for my giant brain. The cost of that alone would have been quite a hardship, but my story doesn’t end there.

A few weeks after surgery, I began leaking spinal fluid and was admitted to the hospital with bacterial meningitis and underwent a second brain surgery. Almost everything that could go wrong did. I developed severe infections and a wound that stil to this day, just won’t heal. My eye was also damaged in surgery due to an anesthetic complication which caused pain and decreased vision. I developed esophageal thrush and couldn’t eat for weeks. After an extended hospital stay, I was released into home healthcare where I am now receiveing intensive IV therapy 4 times daily along with physical therapy and wound care.

When this occurred, I was just barely into my first year as a new veterinarian. I was already drowning in student loan debt just trying to follow my dream. Who knew a veterinary education could cost upwards of a quarter of a million dollars and leave you with 12% interest rates? I guess I did, but I wasn't about to give up on a dream I’ve had since kindergarten. I was never in it for the money and I was barely squeaking by, but still I was very happy with my life and my job. Now I know it’s a little harder to say money doesn’t matter when you have none. I had no savings, no money leftover after my monthy bills, and no backup plan, so this hit me and my family hard.

I have health insurance (not the greatest, but still very grateful for it), but the cost of living, the student loans, the medical bills – it’s overwhelming to say the least. It's incredibly difficult for me to overcome my pride and post this. I’m not the type to ask for a hand out and have always been extremely independent, probably to a fault, but these past few months have taught me to depend on the kindness of others. This situation is no longer affecting just me, but also my dear parents who should be enjoying retirement instead of trying to keep debt collectors from destroying my credit before I even get started, all because I just don't have enough money. They now have the burden of physically and finacially taking care of both my autistic older sister and I. So much for the kids moving out at 18. Since we've learned with my sister that disability is a huge joke, there just simply is no money and no way that I have found so far to get it.

I know some of you might not know me, but now you know my story. If you have the money to spare, I can’t even explain the difference it would make. I’m a strong believer in paying it forward. Prior to my medical setbacks I was a regular supporter of Susan G. Komen, SPCA, Special Olympics, a frequent animal rescuer and animal foster parent, and did veterinary pro-bono – I fully continue to support these causes one day when I get back on my feet. I thank you so much for even reading this and if you are able to contribute, my heart goes out to you in gratitude..

If you can't contribute, get the word out! Share my story. Post me on your Facebook account! Twitter, YouTube, even Google+ or MySpace (I think 1 or 2 people might still be using it?). Social media can be very powerful and I've seen it do great things for those who need it :)

And learn about Chiari Malformation. It effects 1 in 1000 (possibly more since it's only diagnosed by MRI). Educate yourself and others. I fully intend to contribute to Chiari Awareness and help others like myself once I'm medically and finacially able to rejoin the world.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnold%E2%80%93Chi...

If you are able to contribute, even a very small amout - I will forever be greatful for your kindness. Every little bit helps more than you know.

*Anyone who isn't comfortable with sending money online but would like to contribute, please just message me for my address (if you don't already have it)*

Much love, Jessica

Much love, Jessica

story:
I am a mother of one and currently 37 weeks pregnant. I have been receiving prenatal care in Statesville, NC which is a 1hr 15min drive from where I live. I have been offered an opportunity by my former midwife who birthed my son to return to the birth center in Fort Mill, SC. Surprisingly, this center is only about 30mins away. This is a big difference because it would alleviate any concerns of complications that could arise during travel time. Typically, providers do not accept patients after 32 weeks, but this midwife is willing to accept me as a repeat client. The timing is urgent because I need to schedule my first appointment immediately, but I must have the total amount in order to begin my care since I am so far along in my pregnancy. The midwife is requesting I schedule an appointment for Friday March 7th. I also have to get my records released by then- another time sensitive task. I am trying to make the best decisions for my baby and the safest delivery possible. I am asking my community and those connected to them for help bringing this new life into the world. 


To learn more about who I am:

  http://acousticallure.wordpress.com/

 http://kindredmission.weebly.com/about-tameeka.html


In order to birth at this particular center the total amount of funds required is $2, 600. This amount covers the entire facility fee, prenatal care, labor/birth (water birth) and postpartum care. (The rest is the fee I am being charged to create this campaign.) The opportunity is a blessing because it will allow me to birth in familiar territory with the same labor and delivery team. Having familiarity during a time like this is very imperative to a woman's mental and emotional health- both very necessary for such a tremendous task. These women understand the spirituality of birth and the rights of the mother. They are compassionate about the freedom the mother needs to have the most peaceful and healthy experience possible. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to make a monetary contribution, I welcome your support by sharing this cause with your community- other women, mothers, birth care professionals and all other persons who understand the mental health necessary for the birthing process. Thank you so much in advance!

I am offering some perks, please contact me directly if you are interesting in receiving any of them. 

meekvision@gmail.com 

(336) 253-9677

story:
Breaking the Cycle of Violence

Following the recent massacre of school children, the limited access to effective mental health services has emerged as a glaring problem. Many of us feel upset and helpless, and wish there was something we could do. We can do something now, that matters, that will make a difference.

One of the best ways to break the cycle of violence is to get traumatized kids the effective therapy they need. Then they heal from the trauma, have better lives, and are much less likely to hurt others. Progressive Counting (PC) is on track to make trauma therapy better, quicker, and more accessible -- pending further research. This project will move the research a major step forward.

The two leading trauma treatments for children are TF-CBT (trauma-focused cognitive-behavioral therapy) and EMDR (eye movement desensitization & reprocessing). TF-CBT is good, but slow: it can take from several to a dozen therapy sessions just to heal from a single trauma memory, and some children can't tolerate going through one trauma memory after another for months on end. EMDR is more efficient (typically only 1-3 sessions per trauma memory) but it's complicated and hard to get good at, so the training is long and expensive. Many therapists who want EMDR training can't afford it, and many who get the training don't use it properly.

PC combines the best features of each. It's as easy to learn as TF-CBT, and in the first comparison study (with adults), PC was as efficient and effective as EMDR. PC has been used successfully with many children and teens, but has not yet been directly compared to another child trauma treatment. If the research confirms PC as effective, efficient, and easy to learn, it will represent a significant advance in child trauma treatment. Then more therapists will learn and use PC, and more children will get the help they need.

This controlled comparison of PC and TF-CBT for children and teens is of high scientific quality, featuring randomization, blind/independent assessment, large N (60 kids in each group), large number (30) of participating therapists, etc. Normally this type of study would cost hundreds of thousands of dollars, but we're using the regular therapists and clients in a busy clinic, so the largest cost -- the actual therapy -- is already covered. (IRB-approved; research design and citations provided upon request.)

So why crowd-fund this instead of applying for a normal research grant? Because:

  • The project is low-budget and crowd-fundable.
  • It's hard to get grant funding; but this study will open the door to grant funding for subsequent PC research
  • It can easily take a couple of years from applying for grant funding to starting the project. We can't wait, because children can't wait.

Where Your Money Goes

It'll cost about $3,000 in travel (airfare, parking, hotel, etc.) to get three trainers out to Californa for three days to train the agency's 30 therapists. Another $4,500 to pay the trainers. The host agency, also a nonprofit, needs $4,500 to cover the lost income for the time the staff will be learning PC. There's the $12K we're looking for. Some costs (materials, assessments, data entry) will be taken care of by the host agency.

If we get the $12K we'll do it. If we get less, we'll find some way to do it anyway. And if we're over-funded, don't worry -- there will be substantial additional costs for analyzing the data and writing it up for publication.

This budget is peanuts, considering the scope of the study. In other words, a very good bang for the buck. Your donation goes to my nonprofit org, Child Trauma Institute, so it's tax-deductible. Please do what you can!

What We're Going to Accomplish

We'll run the study for about a year to get the targeted number of participants. Then we'll analyze the data, write it up, and publish the paper in a professional journal. If PC does poorly, that's the end of it. But if it does well -- which we believe it will, based on research and clinical observations so far -- then this published study makes a big splash. Therapists get PC training, more studies get done, more therapists get PC training... This is how new treatments become established.

The promise of PC is that it is:

  • well tolerated by clients; even kids can do it
  • easily mastered by therapists, so training is relatively quick and inexpensive, and therapists will be likely to (a) get the training, and (b) do it properly
  • efficient, so client suffering is ended more quickly, as is overall treatment
  • economical in training and treatment, making it more likely for children to be able to access effective trauma therapy

A good therapist heals the world, one person at a time. Good research creates a higher standard of practice, so that the whole community of therapists becomes more efficient and effective. That's what we're going for here. The world's children need a whole lot of healing, and if we can do it quicker, better, and less expensively, we'lll be able to get the healing to a lot more kids.

This may sound grandiose but you're betting on someone with a track record here. I was one of the pioneers in developing and disseminating EMDR for children; I published some of the first studies, provided much of the early training, mentored other trainers, and published the first treatment manual 6 years before the books came out. By now there are more EMDR/child experts than you can shake a stick at, and many thousands of children every year are treated with EMDR. With PC's advantages, PC should do even better, and I'm determined that it will.

If you believe that traumatized children should get the help they need, please support this project. Whatever you can offer is just right; of course more is better, but even the small donations help to generate momentum and make this a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether or not you're able to put money down, please spread the word! You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools, sending a note out to your own e-mail list, telling your mother, etc.

Finally, if you happen to have enough frequent flier miles to cover one or more of the trips, wow, that would save us a lot of $! If this is you, please let me know. That would get you a $500-level perk.

I was one of the pioneers in developing and disseminating EMDR for children; I published some of the first studies, provided much of the early training, mentored other trainers, and published the first treatment manual 6 years before the books came out. By now there are more EMDR/child experts than you can shake a stick at, and many thousands of children every year are treated with EMDR. With PC's advantages, PC should do even better, and I'm determined that it will.
If you believe that traumatized children should get the help they need, please support this project. Whatever you can offer is just right; of course more is better, but even the small donations help to generate momentum and make this a success.
Other Ways You Can Help
Whether or not you're able to put money down, please spread the word! You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools, sending a note out to your own e-mail list, telling your mother, etc.
Finally, if you happen to have enough frequent flier miles to cover one or more of the trips, wow, that would save us a lot of $! If this is you, please let me know. That would get you a $500-level perk.

story:
HOLD onto your seat! Your Pain Is Now Optional

@ Innovative, Quickest Immediate Pain Relief in a SNAP Clinic

 

 Paradigm shift for Humanity regarding pain relief is finally HERE!

 

What would you pay to have the best method to stop pain right now?

 Or ... why are YOU being asked to contribute to fund this big project to end pain

1) because ALL U.S. VETERANS will receive FREE treatment for their pain at this facility, without any payment from the government, nor long line at the VA!

2) because this is the PREMIERE of the NEWEST, FASTEST, MOST EFFECTIVE method on the planet that will help ALL human beings with their pain! Yes, it is that BIG. The pain Paradigm shifts to "PAIN is now OPTIONAL!!" You won't need a doctor's note to get rid of your pain at this clinic, as walk-ins are welcome. For severe situation, your pain cannot be taken away by this new method, therefore, you will need to see your doctor.

 3) because something this unique and BIG -- the end to humanity's search for pain treatment -- needs everyone's investment and financial support!

 

 

HOW CAN I KNOW THIS PAIN RELIEF TREATMENT REALLY WORK?

The pain will be reduced within minutes!! You will know, because you can feel the pain subsiding! It's quite miraculous to experience this each and every time!

 "What if I don't believe this works?"

It doesn't take your belief to make this work!!! (Placebo effect?! Ha! When something works over 50% curative rate, it shouldn't be call a PLACEBO!!) TRY IT, DON'T DENY IT! (The Weight Loss With Ear Beads would be a good start for you!)

 

 

BENEFITS for YOUR INVOLVMENT NOW

For your generosity in funding this clinic from the start, there will be a huge reduction in pricing to the average Americans of 99% discount off $10,000 per treatment to the 99%! Because of YOUR help today, know that your action will help those in pain in the future too.

("The Internal Revenue Service did report that the wealthiest 1% of taxpayers had an Adjusted Gross Income of $380,000 in 2010. So one way to define the top 1% would be those making more than $400,000." Okay, let's be generous to the 1%, and forgive one million dollar in assets. So, for those who have 1.4 millions in total asset, including salary, investments, etc., you will not qualify for the 99% discount.)

 

LONGTERM:

It's also a training facility to Special Healthcare Professionals to spread Immediate Pain Relief nationwide within a few years! COMING SOON TO A CITY NEAR YOU!

(My 6-year journey with quickly training someone to take over the Tucson, Denver, Puerto Vallarta, MX. practices failed miserably and made me realize these Professionals need on-going teaching/structural/financial loan support! Holding a seminar is not enough. I need this facility to better train them and nurture their professional growth over time in order to serve Humanity with pain seccession.)

 

 

What Would the $400,000 be Used For?

  • The money helps offset the FREE PAIN CARE for VETERANS year round!

  • Rental space in NYC for a street level (wheel chair accessible) clinic so that people in pain don't have to travel much further

  • Supplies and advertisement costs

  • Pay the salary of 5 full Time Staff Members ranging from $40k to $85k to operate the clinic 7 days a week

(What would we do with all our profits once the clinic starts? We will HIRE more people, be JOB CREATOR, help open more CLINICS every where, fund Retirement and Bonuses for our Staff, while the CEO will only make $150k a year. All profits will go back into the company and/or spread evenly among the Staff!)

 

  **** 

In addition to Massage, Services Available at our Clinic are:

Miracle #1 = Weight Loss with Ear Beads

Miracle #2 = Anti Stress Bead(s)

Miracle #3 = Immediate Pain Relief (any type of pain)

Miracle #4 = Ultimate Calm (great for PTSD too)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please SHARE this campaign by using Indiegogo Share amongsts your friends, family, co-workers, Facebook, Twitter, etc., as the deadline for raising capitals for this amazing pain relief clinic!

 

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT IN HELPING VETERANS GET FREE PTSD TX & PAIN CARE!

story:
This is all about helping out my Dad (Pops). He went from walking fine and dancing, to being bed ridden. After surgery he is slowly getting a little better but still needs another surgery in the coming months.

What We Need & What You Get:

Pops would never ask for anything and will be mad at me when he finds out about this, but I don't care. He needs some help with all the medical bills and ongoing prescriptions.

What do you get? Well, we have nothing to give but our heart to you saying thank you so much and we are so grateful to you for even giving a penny. 

The amount we are asking for is just a drop in the bucket to what the bills are, but they will make sure he gets all the medications he needs and will sure help pay for food.

How else can you help?

If you would, please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word. 

Thank you so much! 
Eddie

story:
Short Summary

When Hofstra's Flying Dutchmen Quidditch team was established three years ago no one could have predicted that it would rise from obscurity to one of the top teams in the world and the number one team in New York. We've placed 3rd in the Fall 2012 Northeast Regionals and 2nd in the 2013 Shellshocking Spectular hosted by UMD.  We are a young team this year but we have come such a long way since September.  Now we're ready to tackle one of our biggest tournaments yet, the seventh annual World Cup being held in North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina on April 5th and 6th 2013. But the trip is expensive and we need your help to make it! Even the smallest donations are appreciated and will help us get one step closer to making our third World Cup appearance!

What We Need & What You Get

All funds raised will go directly to helping the Flying Dutchmen reach South Carolina. We're looking for at least $3500 to help cover the costs of airfare, hotels and transportation once we're in North Myrtle Beach. We have a variety of perks in return for your generous support, including quidditch-style wristbands and shirts, personalized wands and hand-knitted hats (made by Flying Dutchmen team members!), and even a date with your favorite Dutchman!

**If you donate at any increments above $30 you will receive your designated gift in addition to a team bracelet, thank you card and digital shout out from Hofstra Quidditch!

The Impact

I think it's safe to say that every person who's ever heard of "muggle" quidditch is a little apprehensive at first. Running around on brooms, you say? Calling dodgeballs "bludgers" and volleyballs "quaffles"? But the impact quidditch has had on the Flying Dutchmen has been enormous. We came together as strangers and ended up forming our own quirky family. We've been challenged at every practice and tournament to be the best that we can be, not only for ourselves but for our teammates. We've battled through rain, sleet and snow to prove to the quidditch world that we are a force to be reckoned with.  We may be a young team this year but reaching World Cup VII will be the ultimate testament to our determination, our dedication and to what Hofstra Quidditch can bring to the pitch.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can make a donation at this time, but there are still ways to support the team! Spread the word, reach out to your friends and family and share our cause on social networks!

story:
I’m sending this out to the world on behalf of my friend and co-worker Debbie Printz. In 2010, Debbie was diagnosed with second stage breast cancer. She under went Mastectomy and a grueling round of chemotherapy. Cancer is a rough road for anyone; Debbie was especially sick and had to be hospitalized. After which she was forced to stay home missing a lot of work. Naturally this depleted her savings and also her leave from work.

Deb is a fighter she fought hard and was told she was cancer free. Still many of us couldn’t help but notice Debbie constantly holding her chest. When asked she described it as pain. Her local doctors in our rural area treated her complaint with an abundance of pain medications; by taking those medications it made it nearly impossibly for her to work or function. Whatever was ailing her was clearly getting worse. Fortunately one of our very savvy co-workers insisted on driving Debbie to the Mayo Clinic in Phoenix, Arizona.

After days of testing and weaning her off the multitudes of pain medication; which had dangerously slowed her heartbeat forcing the Mayo staff to insert an internal heartbeat monitor to locate her heartbeat. Next a cat scan was preformed which resulted in another biopsy after which we had a big part of the answer. Two weeks ago Debbie was again diagnosed with breast cancer only this time it is stage four. Now there is a large mass in the center of her chest which doctors believe is the cause of her pain. There are also three spots on her right lung. Shortly, Debbie will be undergoing a pet scan to discover if the cancer has metastasized to her brain. The news came as a harsh blow especially since she has already walked this path once before.

Debbie is young at only 47, the mother of three and a good friend. Many of her treatments will be in Phoenix which is a three and a half to four hour drive one way from Kingman, Arizona. Facing cancer is tough enough but the financial worries make it far worse. Deb has an older vehicle; a 1991, Ford Ranger which is in disrepair. It is in serious need of work and the tires are bald. Worse yet, the additional gas expenses aren’t in her tight budget yet are desperately needed to get her back and forth to Phoenix. Our hope is that with the kindness of others we might be able to help Debbie by having her truck worked on, replacing the tires and hopefully funding the gas expense for her trips to and from Phoenix. If we can make this happen it would be an amazing relief, taking some of the worry away from her already stressful situation. If in sharing Debbie’s story we could raise $3000.00 it could make a world of difference to her, her life and her recovery. Thank you.

story:
Suppose you could relieve back and neck tension (while also improving your posture)? What if you didn’t have to do anything - you could just have your chair do it for you? Now you can, we're so excited to introduce Posture Keeper. 

Do you feel neck, shoulder or back pain at the end of the workday? The cause is simple: you’re leaning forward and/or hunching over your keyboard, unaware of the cumulative injury that your poor posture is causing in your body each day. 

On average, you're likely to be sitting more than 7 hours a day. Combine constant sitting with prolonged poor posture and it’s no wonder you’re in pain. Pain makes it impossible to concentrate at work and you’re filled with dread knowing tomorrow it’s all going to start again.   

 

Now you can end that cycle of pain. Posture Keeper will help you sit upright and support your lower back while you work. The unique design eases lower back pain, making you more productive. It will take your mind off your back and let you finally focus on your work.

Leaning Forward is the Problem 

Leaning forward and hunching over the computer is the number one cause of persistent neck and back pain in the workplace, according to our research. 

Current posture trainer products in the market address some issues, but miss the root cause. They rely on your ability to be aware that you are leaning forward. Most people are unaware that they are hunching over and/or slouching. 

When you lean forward, it causes Forward Head Posture. 

Posture Keeper focuses on reducing Forward Head Posture (FHP) which is becoming a major health issue in a work world filled with smartphones, laptops and computer monitors.

When you use Posture Keeper, the straps gently rest on your shoulders. the moment you start to lean forward, you will know right away, which then allows you to self-correct and avoid the painful effects of prolonged poor posture.

Most people are not aware that they are slouching or leaning forward.

 

The Posture Keeper is designed to make you feel comfortable. You adjust and secure the lumbar support to the exact position that’s right for you. You only have to do this once. Simply snap the Posture Keeper in place and begin working.

 

Posture Keeper was designed to fit a wide range of chairs. It can be installed on almost any chair with a back height of 18” to 33”. Use it anywhere you have to sit for long periods of time at home or at work

 

Posture Keeper Helps The Root Causes of Neck, Back, and Shoulder Pain

 

About 1 out of 3 working adults experience some form of back pain at work. It is the most common job-related disability and the leading reason why employees miss work days.   

Years of slouching wear away at your spine, making it more fragile and prone to injury, in addition to creating other health concerns.

Nearly 70% of American are taking prescription drugs to help with chronic aches and pains. Taking medication over a long period of time is not good for your body. Posture Keep is a drug-free solution that you can set up in less than 30 seconds. Prevention is the key. If you can prevent the poor sitting posture, then you won't have to take unnecessary medication.

 

Rounded shoulders and the rounding of the upper back seriously affects the health of your neck. Leaning your body forward puts considerable pressure on your spine, which affects other parts of your body, like your lower back, neck, shoulders, wrist and other joints.  

 

Most people don't realize that poor sitting posture also affects their standing posture. Left unchecked, poor posture leads to Thoracic Kyphosis, as well as, Forward Head Posture (FHP). Both are detrimental to your health and well-being.

 

Posture Keeper is for all ages.

Do you find yourself nagging your kids to sit up straight or to stop slouching? What kid even knows what posture is. or remembers it even if you teach them? Heck, it's hard enough for adults to be aware. Posture Keeper helps your kids sit upright, whether they are on the computer doing their homework or playing computer games. 

 

There is overwhelming evidence that having proper posture, whether you're sitting or standing, is good for your health. 

Having the proper posture helps you look healthier, taller and, overall, more confident.

 

In the morning, you're pumped and raring to go. But, as the day wanes on, you start to slouch and hunch forward to your computer screen, putting tremendous stress on your spine. Before you know it, your neck, shoulders and back are killing you. When you feel tired, your body stops being able to hold itself upright. That’s because your muscles are fatigued. It’s not your fault that you start slouching.    

Other times, you might get so engrossed in your work that you're not even aware you're practically kissing your computer monitor. The more you concentrate, the more likely you will hunch. Everyone does it. But, doing this for long periods of time is detrimental to your body and to your health..

Posture Keeper won't let you lean forward

Unlike other posture corrector or trainers, Posture Keeper stays on your chair. You only have to set it up once. You can slip on the straps easily. 

Because it's on the chair, you won't forget to use it. AND when you're not using the straps, you can move it to the back of the chair and use the comfortable lumbar support.

 

Dozens of beta testers give their thumbs up to Posture Keeper. 

 
 
I had chronic back pain for over 10 years and sought treatment after treatment. I've been seen by over 10 different doctors, ranging from Orthopedic surgeons to Chiropractors and Physical Therapist.  
 
My pain was so bad, that I nearly lost all hope for a normal life. I was cranky, sleep-deprived and constantly tired. Being in pain is horrible and it can suck the life out of you.  
 
One day, at the chiropractor's office, my doctor said, “You need to stop being on the computer.” I said, “No...can't do that.” Then he said, “Stop leaning forward. It's pinching your nerves. There is technically nothing wrong with you except you’re in pain. You’ve done every test there is do… all negative. So, the only logical culprit is your posture. You’re sitting badly.”  
 
When I came home that day, my son was throwing out his backpack and, suddenly, the light bulb turned on. I wondered, “If I had something that held me back, would that solve the leaning forward issue that was the root cause of my back and neck pain?” So, I tore the backpack apart, attached the needed pieces and tried it for 2 weeks straight. Sure enough, over that period of time, the radiating sensation of pain subsided, my chest walls, usually tight, loosened up; I was even able to raise both my hands to the ceiling, which was something that was difficult for me to do. I was blown away! That's when I knew a product like this could help other people improve their posture and reduce their pain.  
 
I am sharing, here, some photos of the journey I took to bring Posture Keeper to a Kickstarter launch

I broke my husband’s old sewing machine and had to get another one. I also got a crash course on how to install a bobbin. Prior to that, I never sewed before. Luckily, I was able to sew up a good enough prototype to send to the factory for them to improve upon. There were also numerous trips to the office supply store to make sure that Posture Keeper fits most chairs in the marketplace. Interestingly enough, no one came over to ask me what I was doing. They probably thought I was crazy or something. 

 

Why we need your help 

Our mission is simple. We believe that people should be able to do their work effectively without experiencing pain. With your help, we can profoundly improve people's health and, thereby, productivity in the workplace.  
 
Please back Posture Keeper today. We need your help to meet the factory minimum requirements, so we can get the products at the lowest cost and be able to subsidize the shipping cost.
 

  It's super quick and easy to pledge  

1. Select the rewards you want and add your credit card. 

2. When the campaign ends, Indiegogo will notify you and collect your pledge  

3. When its time to ship your order, we will send you a survey to confirm your shipping information.  

You will be the very first group of people who will receive this patent-pending device. We will keep you update via email as well as this Indiegogo campaign page

 

This journey has not been an easy road to travel. What keeps me moving forward is knowing, in my heart of hearts, that Posture Keeper can truly help people improve their posture and help those living with pain, due to prolonged sitting, find tremendous relief.

There were so many people who helped me along the way. It all started with the encouragement of my good friend Perry Belcher, co-founder of Digital Marketer, who insisted that I discuss the Posture Keeper idea with Kevin Harrington, one of the original Shark Tank Investors. After seeing my drawings and video, Kevin encouraged me to pursue my concept. Then there is my team: Macy Tan, Declan Dunn, Amor Traceski, and Ken Lin who have been there for me and the project, every step of the way. 

To all my friends and family who put up with my non-stop chatter and relentless pestering for them to try on and test-drive the different version of Posture Keeper.

To Sal Briggman of Crowdcrux, whose mentorship gave me a crash course in understanding how Crowdfunding works.

Special thank you to Don Schnure and Perry Belcher for their help with the video script. They both truly are copywriting geniuses.

Special thanks to Dr. Christopher Colgin, who believed in the Posture Keeper mission and for his unwavering support. You can reach out to him here: drcolgin@drchriscolgin.com

Special thanks to Climb Real Estate and Eugene Pak for letting me shoot our video at their beautiful office in San Francisco.

Special thanks to Giles Dawe with Hyperstarter for helping us with our prelaunch strategy and ongoing marketing efforts.

 

1. Will I look silly with this Posture Keeper on?

If your back is killing you, you shouldn’t worry about looking silly.

2. Will Posture Keeper fit my chair?

Posture Keeper fits most chairs. Ideal back of the chair height is between 18”H to 33”H. For chairs that are less than 18”H, it may be difficult to adjust, as the top of the Posture Keeper will tend to bend backwards which, long-term, will damage the memory foam material that the Lumbar Support is made of. For chairs that are more than 33”H, the Middle Strap may not be long enough to reach the Connectors that it needs to be attached to.

3.  Is the Posture Keeper’s Lumbar Support adjustable? 

The Lumbar Support is adjustable in that you can raise it up and down the chair to your desired position. To make sure that you have the proper form with the Posture Keeper’s lumbar support, you must align it with the natural curvature of your back/spine when you sit. The straps can also be adjusted to fit most body types.

4. How do I clean the Posture Keeper? 

Spot clean, as needed, using a soft damp cloth. Do NOT use anything abrasive, such as a brush, especially on the cover’s surface. The material is breathable and, actually, has little, tiny holes that could get punctured and accidentally enlarged, if not cleaned properly. You can remove the memory foam and take the cover to be dry cleaned.

5. How long should I use Posture Keeper during the day?

We recommended that Posture Keeper is used in a snug (not tight) position for no more than four (4) hours a day. We strongly advise that you keep hydrated at all times and get up, at least, once every hour to stretch your legs and take a brief walk. You can use Posture Keeper for longer than four (4) hours, as long as you either have the straps fastened very loosely on your body or you put away the straps and use only the lumbar support to lean back on.

6. I frequently get up from my chair. Will Posture Keeper still help me? 

Yes, as long as you plan your work activity. Organize all the tasks that require you to frequently get up from your chair. During this time period, don't use the Posture Keeper. When you know that you will be sitting for a while, e.g. more than 30 minutes, then you should use Posture Keeper to keep you from leaning forward.

7. Can I use Posture Keeper in my car? 

No. We do not recommend using Posture Keeper in any moving vehicle or airplane.  There are laws and regulations that affect passenger safety.  Posture Keeper was designed to be used on an office chair and/or dining room chair. 

Disclaimer: Posture Keeper is not a medical device and no medical claims are being made. It is designed as a lumbar support device with straps that are provided to hold a person upright and to prevent the forward-leaning behavior. Should you have a medical condition, please consult with your doctor prior to using Posture Keeper.

 

 

A huge THANK YOU for taking the time to check our project out! If you are not able to support us with a pledge, we would appreciate your help in sharing our project with everyone you know on social media. Like, Follow or Tweet Us.    

                   

  For Media Contact: Shirley Tan, shirley@posturekeeper.com
story_txt:
Suppose you could relieve back and neck tension (while also improving your posture)? What if you didn’t have to do anything - you could just have your chair do it for you? Now you can, we're so excited to introduce Posture Keeper. 
 Image showing C Shaped Spine when hunched over.Do you feel neck, shoulder or back pain at the end of the workday? The cause is simple: you’re leaning forward and/or hunching over your keyboard, unaware of the cumulative injury that your poor posture is causing in your body each day. On average, you're likely to be sitting more than 7 hours a day. Combine constant sitting with prolonged poor posture and it’s no wonder you’re in pain. Pain makes it impossible to concentrate at work and you’re filled with dread knowing tomorrow it’s all going to start again.   A prolonged period in the hunched position results in back pain.
 
 Now you can end that cycle of pain. Posture Keeper will help you sit upright and support your lower back while you work. The unique design eases lower back pain, making you more productive. It will take your mind off your back and let you finally focus on your work.Leaning Forward is the Problem Leaning forward and hunching over the computer is the number one cause of persistent neck and back pain in the workplace, according to our research. Current posture trainer products in the market address some issues, but miss the root cause. They rely on your ability to be aware that you are leaning forward. Most people are unaware that they are hunching over and/or slouching. When you lean forward, it causes Forward Head Posture. Posture Keeper focuses on reducing Forward Head Posture (FHP) which is becoming a major health issue in a work world filled with smartphones, laptops and computer monitors.When you use Posture Keeper, the straps gently rest on your shoulders. the moment you start to lean forward, you will know right away, which then allows you to self-correct and avoid the painful effects of prolonged poor posture.
Most people are not aware that they are slouching or leaning forward.

 
The Posture Keeper is designed to make you feel comfortable. You adjust and secure the lumbar support to the exact position that’s right for you. You only have to do this once. Simply snap the Posture Keeper in place and begin working.


 
Posture Keeper was designed to fit a wide range of chairs. It can be installed on almost any chair with a back height of 18” to 33”. Use it anywhere you have to sit for long periods of time at home or at work

 
Posture Keeper Helps The Root Causes of Neck, Back, and Shoulder Pain

 

 


 

 
About 1 out of 3 working adults experience some form of back pain at work. It is the most common job-related disability and the leading reason why employees miss work days.   


Years of slouching wear away at your spine, making it more fragile and prone to injury, in addition to creating other health concerns.

 Play

 
Replay with sound


 
Play withsound



00:00


00:00
 
 
 




 
 
 
 

 



 


Nearly 70% of American are taking prescription drugs to help with chronic aches and pains. Taking medication over a long period of time is not good for your body. Posture Keep is a drug-free solution that you can set up in less than 30 seconds. Prevention is the key. If you can prevent the poor sitting posture, then you won't have to take unnecessary medication.

 

 
Rounded shoulders and the rounding of the upper back seriously affects the health of your neck. Leaning your body forward puts considerable pressure on your spine, which affects other parts of your body, like your lower back, neck, shoulders, wrist and other joints.  

 
Most people don't realize that poor sitting posture also affects their standing posture. Left unchecked, poor posture leads to Thoracic Kyphosis, as well as, Forward Head Posture (FHP). Both are detrimental to your health and well-being.


 
Posture Keeper is for all ages.
Do you find yourself nagging your kids to sit up straight or to stop slouching? What kid even knows what posture is. or remembers it even if you teach them? Heck, it's hard enough for adults to be aware. Posture Keeper helps your kids sit upright, whether they are on the computer doing their homework or playing computer games. 

 
There is overwhelming evidence that having proper posture, whether you're sitting or standing, is good for your health. 

Having the proper posture helps you look healthier, taller and, overall, more confident.
 

In the morning, you're pumped and raring to go. But, as the day wanes on, you start to slouch and hunch forward to your computer screen, putting tremendous stress on your spine. Before you know it, your neck, shoulders and back are killing you. When you feel tired, your body stops being able to hold itself upright. That’s because your muscles are fatigued. It’s not your fault that you start slouching.    
Other times, you might get so engrossed in your work that you're not even aware you're practically kissing your computer monitor. The more you concentrate, the more likely you will hunch. Everyone does it. But, doing this for long periods of time is detrimental to your body and to your health..

 
Posture Keeper won't let you lean forward

 

 

Unlike other posture corrector or trainers, Posture Keeper stays on your chair. You only have to set it up once. You can slip on the straps easily. 
Because it's on the chair, you won't forget to use it. AND when you're not using the straps, you can move it to the back of the chair and use the comfortable lumbar support.
 
 
 

 

 


 


 

Tested on over 20+ office chairs + 2 dining room chairs. Here are a few of them.
 



 


 Play

 
Replay with sound


 
Play withsound



00:00


00:00
 
 
 




 
 
 
 

 


 



 

 



 

Dozens of beta testers give their thumbs up to Posture Keeper. 

 
 



 

 

 
I had chronic back pain for over 10 years and sought treatment after treatment. I've been seen by over 10 different doctors, ranging from Orthopedic surgeons to Chiropractors and Physical Therapist.  
 
My pain was so bad, that I nearly lost all hope for a normal life. I was cranky, sleep-deprived and constantly tired. Being in pain is horrible and it can suck the life out of you.  
 
One day, at the chiropractor's office, my doctor said, “You need to stop being on the computer.” I said, “No...can't do that.” Then he said, “Stop leaning forward. It's pinching your nerves. There is technically nothing wrong with you except you’re in pain. You’ve done every test there is do… all negative. So, the only logical culprit is your posture. You’re sitting badly.”  
 
When I came home that day, my son was throwing out his backpack and, suddenly, the light bulb turned on. I wondered, “If I had something that held me back, would that solve the leaning forward issue that was the root cause of my back and neck pain?” So, I tore the backpack apart, attached the needed pieces and tried it for 2 weeks straight. Sure enough, over that period of time, the radiating sensation of pain subsided, my chest walls, usually tight, loosened up; I was even able to raise both my hands to the ceiling, which was something that was difficult for me to do. I was blown away! That's when I knew a product like this could help other people improve their posture and reduce their pain.  
 
I am sharing, here, some photos of the journey I took to bring Posture Keeper to a Kickstarter launch
I broke my husband’s old sewing machine and had to get another one. I also got a crash course on how to install a bobbin. Prior to that, I never sewed before. Luckily, I was able to sew up a good enough prototype to send to the factory for them to improve upon. There were also numerous trips to the office supply store to make sure that Posture Keeper fits most chairs in the marketplace. Interestingly enough, no one came over to ask me what I was doing. They probably thought I was crazy or something. 

 

 

 
 
 

Timeline
 
 
Why we need your help Our mission is simple. We believe that people should be able to do their work effectively without experiencing pain. With your help, we can profoundly improve people's health and, thereby, productivity in the workplace.  
 

Please back Posture Keeper today. We need your help to meet the factory minimum requirements, so we can get the products at the lowest cost and be able to subsidize the shipping cost.
 

 


  It's super quick and easy to pledge  
1. Select the rewards you want and add your credit card. 
2. When the campaign ends, Indiegogo will notify you and collect your pledge  
3. When its time to ship your order, we will send you a survey to confirm your shipping information.  
You will be the very first group of people who will receive this patent-pending device. We will keep you update via email as well as this Indiegogo campaign page
 

 
This journey has not been an easy road to travel. What keeps me moving forward is knowing, in my heart of hearts, that Posture Keeper can truly help people improve their posture and help those living with pain, due to prolonged sitting, find tremendous relief.
There were so many people who helped me along the way. It all started with the encouragement of my good friend Perry Belcher, co-founder of Digital Marketer, who insisted that I discuss the Posture Keeper idea with Kevin Harrington, one of the original Shark Tank Investors. After seeing my drawings and video, Kevin encouraged me to pursue my concept. Then there is my team: Macy Tan, Declan Dunn, Amor Traceski, and Ken Lin who have been there for me and the project, every step of the way. 
To all my friends and family who put up with my non-stop chatter and relentless pestering for them to try on and test-drive the different version of Posture Keeper.
To Sal Briggman of Crowdcrux, whose mentorship gave me a crash course in understanding how Crowdfunding works.
Special thank you to Don Schnure and Perry Belcher for their help with the video script. They both truly are copywriting geniuses.
Special thanks to Dr. Christopher Colgin, who believed in the Posture Keeper mission and for his unwavering support. You can reach out to him here: drcolgin@drchriscolgin.com
Special thanks to Climb Real Estate and Eugene Pak for letting me shoot our video at their beautiful office in San Francisco.
Special thanks to Giles Dawe with Hyperstarter for helping us with our prelaunch strategy and ongoing marketing efforts.
 



 
1. Will I look silly with this Posture Keeper on?
If your back is killing you, you shouldn’t worry about looking silly.
2. Will Posture Keeper fit my chair?
Posture Keeper fits most chairs. Ideal back of the chair height is between 18”H to 33”H. For chairs that are less than 18”H, it may be difficult to adjust, as the top of the Posture Keeper will tend to bend backwards which, long-term, will damage the memory foam material that the Lumbar Support is made of. For chairs that are more than 33”H, the Middle Strap may not be long enough to reach the Connectors that it needs to be attached to.
3.  Is the Posture Keeper’s Lumbar Support adjustable? 
The Lumbar Support is adjustable in that you can raise it up and down the chair to your desired position. To make sure that you have the proper form with the Posture Keeper’s lumbar support, you must align it with the natural curvature of your back/spine when you sit. The straps can also be adjusted to fit most body types.
4. How do I clean the Posture Keeper? 
Spot clean, as needed, using a soft damp cloth. Do NOT use anything abrasive, such as a brush, especially on the cover’s surface. The material is breathable and, actually, has little, tiny holes that could get punctured and accidentally enlarged, if not cleaned properly. You can remove the memory foam and take the cover to be dry cleaned.
5. How long should I use Posture Keeper during the day?
We recommended that Posture Keeper is used in a snug (not tight) position for no more than four (4) hours a day. We strongly advise that you keep hydrated at all times and get up, at least, once every hour to stretch your legs and take a brief walk. You can use Posture Keeper for longer than four (4) hours, as long as you either have the straps fastened very loosely on your body or you put away the straps and use only the lumbar support to lean back on.
6. I frequently get up from my chair. Will Posture Keeper still help me? 
Yes, as long as you plan your work activity. Organize all the tasks that require you to frequently get up from your chair. During this time period, don't use the Posture Keeper. When you know that you will be sitting for a while, e.g. more than 30 minutes, then you should use Posture Keeper to keep you from leaning forward.
7. Can I use Posture Keeper in my car? 
No. We do not recommend using Posture Keeper in any moving vehicle or airplane.  There are laws and regulations that affect passenger safety.  Posture Keeper was designed to be used on an office chair and/or dining room chair. 
Disclaimer: Posture Keeper is not a medical device and no medical claims are being made. It is designed as a lumbar support device with straps that are provided to hold a person upright and to prevent the forward-leaning behavior. Should you have a medical condition, please consult with your doctor prior to using Posture Keeper.

 
 
 
 
Posture Keeper, Chiropractor Recommended
 

 
A huge THANK YOU for taking the time to check our project out! If you are not able to support us with a pledge, we would appreciate your help in sharing our project with everyone you know on social media. Like, Follow or Tweet Us.    
 
 
 
                     For Media Contact: Shirley Tan, shirley@posturekeeper.com

story:
What happened



In the fall of 2013 I was positioning a much needed supportive beam in the kitchen of my home. While leveraging this beam in place, the end opposite slipped off of its post and fell to the floor. Unfortunately, one end of this 14 foot wooden beam was still in my right hand. The reverberative  impact was absorbed by palm and wrist, resulting in serious damage to my median nerve and also causing a misalignment of my thumb joint resulting in bone spur growth. These injuries have drastically diminished my ability to use this hand. Simple actions such as turnng the key to a lock, making a bed or opening a bottle of water, now present as complex actions.  Since the accident I have given myself plenty of rest and in attempts to alleviate pain and discomfort, received cortisone injections in the joint and the nerve. The injections have given minimal relief and it now transpires that the nerve damage has been too severe to be improved by rest alone.

I have been scheduled for a carpel tunnel release surgery in  late August. If effective, the nerves will be free from any stress and will be allowed to heal, returning strength and dexterity to my hand.  After the surgery there will between one and three month period of enforced rest followed by a very gradual return to normal movement and use of the hand. I will have been unable to earn money for eight months by the time I am projected to return to full strength. I am an artist and a self-employed contractor - I work with my hands. Without effective use of my right hand I have not been able to earn what we need to buy fuel for the winter ahead and and to pay for home upkeep. I am not eligible for any state or federal assistance and am asking for donations to help pay for my surgery and to keep our home out of debt this Winter.




What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $8,800.  I generally am able to make this money in the spring and summer, however, this year we have diminished the small savings we had, which is why we are reaching out to you for assistance. 
First and foremost are  the Surgical costs estimated at around $1200.                    We also have our fuel costs for the winter, coming in at around $2800                Living on a modest budget, I can squeak through the upcoming months of rehabilitation with about $2000
This totals to $6000
In an ideal world, we would  raise an additional $2000 for some minor upkeep of our home during  the winter. Our basement desperately needs to be insulated and there is a massive, unhealthy tree looming over the south east side of our house, which needs to be taken down. 
 The remaining costs would cover the percentage given to Indegogo for use of their crowdfunding platform.
My wife Sophie is a new resident to the United States and has actively been seeking and accepting various employment opportunities, however, since I was unable to generate any substantial income this year, our finances are stretched thin and we are starting to slide behind on some of our bills.  
For those of you who do not know us, 
We are artists currently living in New Haven, Connecticut. We live a modest lifestyle, in a house which has best been described as a potential fixer upper.  

I am offering original artwork for donations - Please take a look at the selection of prints, drawings and paintings available in return for your generous donation! Examples can be found in the gallery section.

Thank you for helping me to get through this frustrating and painful period.
