story:
We have made sustainable skin care our mission. YUN's probiotherapy combats the harmful bacteria that cause skin concerns in a natural way. Love your bacteria. We do.

We've all been there...

Our skin is our largest organ. It is covered by a layer of friendly bacteria, called the microbiome, that protects your skin against the elements. Just like any other part of the body, your skin can suffer from all sorts of annoying problems caused by bacterial imbalances. Spots and blemishes, acne, athlete’s foot, vaginal infections and more; we’ve all been there. 

 

HOW DOES YUN PROBIOTHERAPY WORK?

 

Traditionally we've tended to treat skin concerns, caused by bacterial imbalances with antibacterial soaps, antifungal sprays, even antibiotics, which strip away both the harmful bacteria as well as our protective ones. Why kill the good along with the bad? There's absolutely no need. In fact, we're much better off being kind to our friendly bacteria as they help keep us safe and healthy.

 

IT'S SIMPLE REALLY!

 

 

We have a range of washes and creams that are safe for our microbiome. These contain a unique formula of emulsifiers and preservatives that are kind to our skin and our microbiome.

Next to that we have a range of sprays and creams to treat common skin concerns. Instead of using harsh treatments, that weaken our natural microbiome even more, we add friendly bacteria to your skin, that fight off the problem-causing bacteria and restore balance to your natural microbiome.

YUN Probiotherapy is natural skin care that is gentle, yet effective.

 

WHICH THERAPIES DOES YUN OFFER?

ACN for teenage spots

Spots, blackheads and other blemishes are part of life as a teenager as your body is undergoing massive hormonal changes. YUN's ACN facial wash and cream are the first treatment to relieve and prevent acne that is kind to your skin and won't cause embarrassing dry patches and redness. 

  • ACN Wash is a soft wash that cleans your skin without harming your skin's protective microbiome.

• ACN Cream contains friendly bacteria that will fight off the acne causing bacteria.

   

ACN+ for adult spots

Much as we'd all love to have radiantly clear skin, some of us are simply more likely to suffer from spots and breakouts. YUN's ACN+ facial wash and cream have been clinically developed to help adults overcome spots, blemishes and dry patches, whilst moisturising mature skin.

 

• ACN+ Wash is a soft facial wash that cleans your skin without harming your skin's protective microbiome. 

• ACN+ Cream is a hydrating face cream that contains friendly bacteria to restore a balanced skin microbiome.

 

FNG for athlete's foot

Microorganisms love nothing more than a warm and moist environment, so it comes as little surprise that so many of us suffer from problematic skin conditions such as eczema and athlete’s foot. Causing itchiness, irritation and flaky skin (even smelly feet) fungal and bacterial infections are an annoying problem that you could do without.

• FNG Spray is a spray that contains friendly bacteria to fight off problem causing fungi and bacteria on the feet and other skin areas. 

  

VGN for vaginal care

Most intimate soaps maintain a balanced vaginal pH, but still harm our vaginal flora by preservatives and emulsifiers. An unbalanced flora leads to yeast infections, vaginal dryness, itchiness or irritation. YUN’s VGN soothing wash contains a unique formula of emulsifiers and preservatives that are kind to our skin as well as our vaginal flora.

YUN’s VGN probiotherapy wash can safely be used on a day-to-day basis for natural, sustainable feminine care.

• VGN Wash is a soft intimate wash that maintains a balanced vaginal microbiome.

 

SKN for sensitive skin

Whether you’re sensitive to certain products or are simply looking for a kinder way to treat your face and body, probiotherapy plays an important role in keeping your skin healthy. Sensitive skin is actually skin that is easily unbalanced. Our patented microbiome-friendly face cream, body lotion and body wash safeguard that all-important bacterial balance for softer, smoother skin that is less prone to breakouts, flare-ups, dry patches and redness.

• SKN Wash is a soft microbiome-friendly body and facial wash

• SKN Face Cream is a soft microbiome-friendly facial cream

• SKN Body Cream is a soft microbiome-friendly body cream

    

HOW TO USE

 

 

 

 

WHAT'S THE SCIENCE BEHIND YUN?

 

YUN Probiotherapy is the result of over 10 years of research and development by some of Europe’s foremost experts in pharmaceutical technology, biopharmacy and microbiology at the University of Antwerp.

 

3 ground-breaking innovations

 

1/ Our first scientific challenge was to find the most effective bacteria to fight the bad bacteria and fungi that cause skin problems. Our patented YUN bacteria have been proven to be strong enough to fight off problem-causing bacteria on your skin. 

2/ Next, we came up with a revolutionary system to keep our bacteria alive in a skin cream: our bacteria are kept in a sleep-like state in tiny microcapsules. Once you apply them to your skin, the microcapsules pop and our good bacteria start fighting the bad organisms. 

3/ Finally, we came up with washes and creams that contain preservatives and emulsifiers that do not harm your skin's microbiome and maintain your protective layer of friendly bacteria.

 

Clinical studies

We are finalizing our clinical studies in collaboration with the University Hospital of Antwerp and more are currently taking place. We stand by our products and know you'll love them as much as we do. Should you have specific questions, then please get in touch with us - we'd love to hear from you!

    

REWARDS

 

As if rebalancing your skin's biome and treating any upsetting skin problems you may have wasn't enough by itself, we've also got some amazing rewards lined up for you!

Be among the first to receive our amazing YUN Probiotherapy and start reducing the need for antibiotics, antibacterial wipes and antifungal creams: they're really not doing us any good at all. Even the World Health Organisation are campaigning against the overuse of antibiotics, so it's time to start being kinder to ourselves.

Our rewards packages include some pretty amazing pre-sale discounts.

 

 

TIMELINE

 

ABOUT YUN

 

YUN Ltd loves the power of bacteria and is committed to delivering proven solutions that restore and maintain your skin’s natural biome. A privately owned European biotech company, YUN carries out pioneering research and development in probiotherapy for the commercial market.

YUN works closely with some of Europe’s foremost experts on probiotherapy to bring you groundbreaking products that transform the traditional into visionary. Thanks to them YUN Probiotherapy is able to offer a safe solution against a wide variety of daily concerns. Together we can start reducing the problematic amounts of antibiotics, antibacterials and antimycotics in use today. 

YUN Probiotherapy is the result of over 10 years of research and development by the pharmaceutical technology, biopharmacy and microbiology departments from the University of Antwerp, the University Hospital of Antwerp, and grants by the IWT (Agency for Innovation through Science and Technology) as well as Flanders’ Innovation & Entrepreneurship department.

Watch our first television performance here!

 

       

 

Follow & Share Our Story

 

Like what you’re seeing? Great! Don’t be shy about sharing YUN Probiotherapy with your friends. We’ve made it super easy. Just hit one of the buttons below. The more people who know about YUN Probiotherapy, the larger our community will become! And the larger our community becomes, the more we can do together to make YUN Probiotherapy absolutely amazing!

Please join us! We can’t do this without you.

Causing itchiness, irritation and flaky skin (even smelly feet) fungal and bacterial infections are an annoying problem that you could do without.• FNG Spray is a spray that contains friendly bacteria to fight off problem causing fungi and bacteria on the feet and other skin areas.   VGN for vaginal careMost intimate soaps maintain a balanced vaginal pH, but still harm our vaginal flora by preservatives and emulsifiers. An unbalanced flora leads to yeast infections, vaginal dryness, itchiness or irritation. YUN’s VGN soothing wash contains a unique formula of emulsifiers and preservatives that are kind to our skin as well as our vaginal flora.YUN’s VGN probiotherapy wash can safely be used on a day-to-day basis for natural, sustainable feminine care.• VGN Wash is a soft intimate wash that maintains a balanced vaginal microbiome. SKN for sensitive skinWhether you’re sensitive to certain products or are simply looking for a kinder way to treat your face and body, probiotherapy plays an important role in keeping your skin healthy. Sensitive skin is actually skin that is easily unbalanced. Our patented microbiome-friendly face cream, body lotion and body wash safeguard that all-important bacterial balance for softer, smoother skin that is less prone to breakouts, flare-ups, dry patches and redness.• SKN Wash is a soft microbiome-friendly body and facial wash• SKN Face Cream is a soft microbiome-friendly facial cream• SKN Body Cream is a soft microbiome-friendly body cream    HOW TO USE    WHAT'S THE SCIENCE BEHIND YUN? YUN Probiotherapy is the result of over 10 years of research and development by some of Europe’s foremost experts in pharmaceutical technology, biopharmacy and microbiology at the University of Antwerp. 3 ground-breaking innovations 1/ Our first scientific challenge was to find the most effective bacteria to fight the bad bacteria and fungi that cause skin problems. Our patented YUN bacteria have been proven to be strong enough to fight off problem-causing bacteria on your skin. 2/ Next, we came up with a revolutionary system to keep our bacteria alive in a skin cream: our bacteria are kept in a sleep-like state in tiny microcapsules. Once you apply them to your skin, the microcapsules pop and our good bacteria start fighting the bad organisms. 3/ Finally, we came up with washes and creams that contain preservatives and emulsifiers that do not harm your skin's microbiome and maintain your protective layer of friendly bacteria. Clinical studiesWe are finalizing our clinical studies in collaboration with the University Hospital of Antwerp and more are currently taking place. We stand by our products and know you'll love them as much as we do. Should you have specific questions, then please get in touch with us - we'd love to hear from you!    REWARDS As if rebalancing your skin's biome and treating any upsetting skin problems you may have wasn't enough by itself, we've also got some amazing rewards lined up for you!Be among the first to receive our amazing YUN Probiotherapy and start reducing the need for antibiotics, antibacterial wipes and antifungal creams: they're really not doing us any good at all. Even the World Health Organisation are campaigning against the overuse of antibiotics, so it's time to start being kinder to ourselves.Our rewards packages include some pretty amazing pre-sale discounts.  TIMELINE ABOUT YUN YUN Ltd loves the power of bacteria and is committed to delivering proven solutions that restore and maintain your skin’s natural biome. A privately owned European biotech company, YUN carries out pioneering research and development in probiotherapy for the commercial market.YUN works closely with some of Europe’s foremost experts on probiotherapy to bring you groundbreaking products that transform the traditional into visionary. Thanks to them YUN Probiotherapy is able to offer a safe solution against a wide variety of daily concerns. Together we can start reducing the problematic amounts of antibiotics, antibacterials and antimycotics in use today. YUN Probiotherapy is the result of over 10 years of research and development by the pharmaceutical technology, biopharmacy and microbiology departments from the University of Antwerp, the University Hospital of Antwerp, and grants by the IWT (Agency for Innovation through Science and Technology) as well as Flanders’ Innovation & Entrepreneurship department.Watch our first television performance here!         Follow & Share Our Story Like what you’re seeing? Great! Don’t be shy about sharing YUN Probiotherapy with your friends. We’ve made it super easy. Just hit one of the buttons below. The more people who know about YUN Probiotherapy, the larger our community will become! And the larger our community becomes, the more we can do together to make YUN Probiotherapy absolutely amazing!Please join us! We can’t do this without you.

story:
Imagine, without warning, your doctor tells you that you have late-stage kidney disease. He says you'll need dialysis or a transplant. Kidney disease takes years to progress and you have regular checkups and bloodwork. Why has no doctor ever mentioned your kidneys until now?

Unfortunately, unidentified chronic kidney disease (CKD) is prevalent, especially among high risk populations. As Nephrologist Dr. Uptal Patel would tell you, he's heard the phrase "Why didn't anyone tell me sooner?" all too often in his clinic.

Millions of people across the country have unidentified and preventable illnesses that could be slowed or stopped if we had a simple way to bring health record data and predictive models together. Unfortunately, implementing these models is extremely complex, time-consuming, and expensive.

After designing an enterprise-grade solution for Duke's Accountable Care Organization, we realized we could pack all the power needed to identify kidney failure risk in a simple desktop app we call StopCKD. With our current prototype, any care provider can identify patients with a drag-and-drop.

StopCKD in Action

 

 

Sample Report

 


We want to bring StopCKD across the country. For every five thousand dollars we raise, we'll be able to pilot at a new site and help save patients from the surprise of kidney failure. Whether you're a private practice, group of clinics, small health system, or organization that wants to improve chronic disease management, we want to partner with you!

We're also looking to expand our offering beyond CKD. We have already started working on diabetes, heart failure, and sepsis. There are so many other diseases to conquer and with your help, we can make that happen!


Mark Sendak has a BS in Math from UCLA, an MPP from Duke, and will be completing his MD at Duke in May 2017. He has spent three years using EHR data to support clinical operations at Duke Health and is one of the first medical students ever to work on initiatives at health system level. Since October 2014, he has worked as a data scientist and project manager for the Duke Institute for Health Innovation. He hopes to improve how health systems use data to manage vulnerable populations.

Lance Co Ting Keh has a BS and MEng from Duke University. He is currently a Sr. Software Engineer and a technical lead of Data Engineering at Box. Lance is an academic at heart who is currently interested in distributed systems that can support large scale ML and data processing. His seven papers and patents span the fields of sports science, nonlinear dynamics, fault tolerant computing and energy absorbing materials.

Faraz Yashar left Duke during his sophomore year to join Athletes Research Institute as Senior Engineer and later its CTO. During his tenure, Faraz developed the health analytics software used by the US Women’s National Team in their 2015 World Cup training and win. That software is currently used by college and professional teams in the US and internationally, including at Duke. Afterwards, Faraz provided the technical leadership to launch several products in the venture capital and charity spaces.

Lance and Faraz have been building software products together for 6 years. They have released a number of products together as managing partners of Ephori. Lance and Mark met in a machine learning class at Duke in the Fall of 2014 and have been working on this idea since.

To Leslie Pierce for her lovely illustrations and Kevin MacLeod for the music we used in the video!

story:
Crestwood Christian Church Project: Clean Water


Who we are:
We are from Crestwood Christian Church in Lincoln, Nebraska.  Our mission and vision as a congregation is to care for one another and minister to people in need as we travel together through our life's journey.  We have been worshiping in Lincoln for over 50 years.
Our cause:
Many of us take access to clean drinking water very much for granted.  Every day we use clean water; we cook with it, clean with it, bathe in it, play in it, we even use it to flush our toilets!  And most importantly we drink it.  
However, 2.5 billion people in this world don't even have the luxury of taking a drink of clean pure water; let alone cooking, cleaning, bathing or playing in it and many have no access to a toilet.
What we are going to do about it:
Our project team is on a mission to make a difference.  We are 9 adults and 2 youth strong and have a can do attitude!  In June 2015 we will travel to the Dominican Republic to work with Wine to Water to provide relief for the poor there.  
Part of our project will be to construct water filters at a facility and then distribute them to poor families so they will have clean water to drink and cook with.  We are also raising funds to install a well to provide clean water to 300 people.  This well will operate for the next ten years and provide much needed clean water; any extra funds we raise above our funding goal will be used to fund additional wells.
How you can help:

 Cost:  Here is the breakdown of costs to support the 11 people planning to travel to the Dominican Republic:

Cost Per Person:  $1000  (covers: lodging, transportation in country, food and 25% goes towards the work we will be doing while there; which is constructing water filters and distributing them)

Airfare:  $500 (Each person traveling will be covering this cost out of pocket.

Money for the well.  We need to raise $1,500 to fund the well.

What's in it for you:

In addition to the awesome feeling that always comes with doing good for others we want to thank you for your donation as well:

$10 - We will post your name (first name last initial) on our website and our Facebook page as proof of your support of this worthy cause.

$50 - We will post your name and send you a personalized handwritten post card thanking you for your awesomeness.

$100 - Your name posted, a handwritten postcard and your name will be listed as a contributor in a commemorative book documenting our trip.

$250 - All of the above and a signed picture of the mission team in the Dominican Republic.

$500 - All of the above and a slideshow from the trip delivered electronically.

$1000 - All of the above and a small gift from the Dominican Republic.

$2500 - All of the above and a photo book with stories and experiences from the trip.

story:
Our Gift Cards – the perfect present for expecting parents.

Looking for a baby shower, birth or Christmas present? Have a look at our Good Night Charly Gift Cards – the perfect present for expecting parents. 

The Good Night Charly Gift Cards are not only a great present, they will also save you $25 in our online store. The store launches as soon as the IndieGoGo campaign ends and will offer the Good Night Charly Device, our Good Night Charly Cam and some baby gimmicks like a romper suit.

So - what are you waiting for?


As seen on



Help us make dreams come true

Hi, we are Good Night Charly. A team of loving parents, aunts & uncles who want to give your little treasure the most comfortable way of falling asleep and you as a parent the safe and warm feeling of knowing that your child is dreaming well.

Our team has been developing products together for more than 10 years. We are now on IndieGoGo because we need your help and support to finish this project. We want to produce Good Night Charly for parents and their little treasures all around the world in order to make dreams a little warmer and safer.

Thanks to you all!

Your Good Night Charly team



How it works

Just connect your smartphone via bluetooth or wifi to the Good Night Charly device and open the app.


The hardware



The app


Songs

Choose your babies favourite lullabies from our song list. The tunes range from classics to our own composed lullabies by great indie bands and musicians.  

Sounds

Your child needs to hear a fan or the washing machine to fall asleep? No problem. We also integrated a wide variety of sounds.

Spotify & iTunes

Of course you can connect Good Night Charly to Spotify & iTunes and stream your playlists.

Own recordings

Record your voice or your own songs and play it to your baby whenever it wants to hear it.


Restart & timer

Restart all of the above with your app or simply set a timer.



Baby monitor

Set the noise sensibility and get alerts whenever your babies crying for you. You can also press to talk and say some comfortable words to it.


Comfort control

Good Night Charly constantly measures the temperature and humidity levels of your child's nursery. Customise the settings to define when you want to get notified directly on your smartphone.


Individual

You don’t like our black app layout? No problem. Configure your own color. If you want to you can also name your Good Night Charly after your baby and name it for example Good Night Lara.


Android

Of course we will provide the Good Night Charly app with the same functions for Android.



The perks

Our referral contest

Refer as many people as you can and when their contributions total at least $400, you’ll get a Good Night Charly White Silver Edition for free!

Maybe someone you know is having a baby shower soon? Or you know a friend who needs a gift because their family is expecting a new member? Your best friend is pregnant? Just spread the word and win!

How it works:

Start referring, share the campaign link (below the video) and get your network to contribute. Make sure you use that link to track your referrals. When their contributions total at least $400, we will send you Good Night Charly for free!




For musicians

Music is one of the most important elements of Good Night Charly. If you are a musician and want to be part of this project we would be very excited to feature your composed lullabies on our app and device. Feel free to contact us at (mail@goodnightcharly.com) and we can talk a little.

We are excited to hear from you!


For developer

We will use an Open API to allow app developers around the globe to create other great apps for Good Night Charly on any device. If you choose to back us with the developer kit, we will send you Good Night Charly as soon as it arrives and will provide you with full support to help you realise your ideas.

Any questions? Feel free to send us an Email. We would love to hear from you.

developers@goodnightcharly.com



The future

At this very moment we are working on the concept and design for an HD camera for Good Night Charly. The cam will be an add-on device which you can stick to your baby crib and connect wirelessly to the Good Night Charly box & app. It will feature night vision so you can have a quick look on your baby with our app from anywhere at anytime.

Why is it an add on you ask? There are three reasons. 

1. To have the best possible sound, the microphone of Good Night Charly should be as close as possible to the baby. Well, put a camera that close to your kid and no matter how cute your baby is the image will be horrible.

2. Not every parent wants a camera in their baby room. Even though we will put safety first on our flag we can understand that feeling. That's why we want to give you, the customers the possibility to choose.

3.We want to be the first ones to separate the camera from the baby monitor ;)

Anyway, like we said: we will use an Open API. So in case you want to connect cams to the Good Night Charly box and provide an app for all the people around there – we would buy you a T-shirt that says: "You are awesome!".


Who we are




Tech specs

Estimated Size: 80mm x 70mm

Product Certification: CE & ROHS

Batterie: 3000mA/h

Charging Time: about 4 hours

Running Time in Battery by 2/3 Volume: 9 hours in full throttle / 40hrs playing time

CPU: STM32

Network: XLW-210S

Internal Memory: 128K RAM,1024K FLASH

Flashcard: 4GB

Audio: MP3, AAC

Speaker: 4ohm/3W

Microphone: Capacitive 4015 package，all direction

Bluetooth: CSR

Bluetooth version: 4.0

Chip Processor: STM32F205 120MHz

Wifi: RT5350

Wireless Network: IEEE 802.11n


How can you help?

Well of course by preordering as we have a minimum purchase to make Good Night Charly happen. But it would be just as great if you could share this campaign with your friends and family.

Maybe someone you know is having a baby shower soon? Or you know a friend who needs a gift because their family is expecting a new member? No matter what - we would be very very thankful!  


Risks and challenges

We are trying to minimize the risk as much as possible and the moment this campaign is funded we can immediately start manufacturing the devices. One challenge we might face is that suppliers may not meet their projected lead-times for selected components of the device. Most of our suppliers have already made volume and lead-time commitments, but there is always the chance of unexpected factors arising, resulting in shipment delays.


FAQ

Any questions left? Feel free to email us at hello@goodnightcharly.com.

We would love to get in touch with you and will answer immediately.

Bluetooth: CSR

Bluetooth version: 4.0

Chip Processor: STM32F205 120MHz

Wifi: RT5350

Wireless Network: IEEE 802.11n


How can you help?

Well of course by preordering as we have a minimum purchase to make Good Night Charly happen. But it would be just as great if you could share this campaign with your friends and family.
Maybe someone you know is having a baby shower soon? Or you know a friend who needs a gift because their family is expecting a new member? No matter what - we would be very very thankful!  


Risks and challenges


We are trying to minimize the risk as much as possible and the moment this campaign is funded we can immediately start manufacturing the devices. One challenge we might face is that suppliers may not meet their projected lead-times for selected components of the device. Most of our suppliers have already made volume and lead-time commitments, but there is always the chance of unexpected factors arising, resulting in shipment delays.


FAQ

Any questions left? Feel free to email us at hello@goodnightcharly.com.
We would love to get in touch with you and will answer immediately.

story:
Breakthrough Treatment for Degenerative Diseases


  • We have an experimental drug that may prevent or cure over 30 cureless, devastating diseases, including Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, Huntington’s, Lou Gehrig’s, type-2 diabetes, and many others that have a common underlying mechanism.
  • The drug has shown improvement in 7 different disease models without side effects!
  • We are a team of scientists led by Gal Bitan, Ph.D., an Associate professor at UCLA with 15 years of experience in studying degenerative diseases, and 30 collaborating research groups around the world.
  • The basic research has been funded by foundation and government grants supporting Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, and ALS research. We now need a considerable amount of money that will allow us to  initiate clinical trials.
  • Please make a contribution as small or large as you can, and forward our plea to your network. You never know who might have a relative or a friend who may be affected by one of these horrible diseases.
  • We are asking for your money so that we can work even harder to find a cure that will benefit all of humanity.
  • If everyone who has been affected by these diseases, contributes one dollar, we will have what we need to move forward quickly towards clinical trials.

According to the Alzheimer’s Association, Alzheimer’s disease is the 6th leading cause of death in the US, and while the top 5 causes are declining, including breast cancer, prostate cancer, heart disease, stroke, and HIV, Alzheimer’s numbers are steadily rising and have increased by 68% between 2000–2010. In fact, a recent study suggests that the number of deaths associated with Alzheimer’s is much larger than previously thought and the disease may be the 3rd leading cause of death.

The list includes more than 30 diseases and many additional conditions, including HIV infection, spinal cord injury, traumatic brain injury, and certain cancers. To know if any of these affect you or someone close to your heart, see our Comprehensive List of Amyloidoses and Conditions Affected by Abnormal Protein Aggregation.

Our drug, called a "molecular tweezer," is the first of its kind for which we know exactly how and why it works.

If you want to learn more, check out where the molecular tweezers came from and the news items about their action on Parkinson’s and Alzheimer’s. You can also find many of our scientific publications on Dr. Bitan’s website.

The challenge is that the molecular tweezers work in a way that is entirely different from any drug developed before. Innovative ideas often are met with resistance. It is hard to believe today, but there were times in which people wrote scientific articles “proving” that a machine will never be able to carry its own weight in the air. This has nothing to do with how smart or experienced the person is. As put so eloquently by Tolstoy:

“The most difficult subjects can be explained to the most slow-witted man if he has not formed any idea of them already; but the simplest thing cannot be made clear to the most intelligent man if he is firmly persuaded that he knows already, without a shadow of doubt, what is laid before him.”

— Leo Tolstoy 1897

If everyone who knows someone affected by these diseases contributes one dollar, we will have what we need to move forward as quickly as possible towards clinical trials!

THANK YOU
story_txt:

diseases, including Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, Huntington’s, Lou Gehrig’s,

We are a team of scientists led by Gal
Bitan, Ph.D., an Associate professor at UCLA with 15 years of experience in studying degenerative diseases, and 30 collaborating research groups around the world.


The basic research has been
funded by foundation and government grants supporting Alzheimer’s,
Parkinson’s, and ALS research. We now need a considerable amount of money that
will allow us to  initiate clinical trials.


Please make a contribution as small or
large as you can, and forward our plea to your network. You
never know who might have a relative or a friend who may be affected by one of
these horrible diseases.


We are asking
for your money so that we can work even harder to find a cure that will benefit
all of humanity.

If everyone who has been affected by these diseases, contributes one dollar, we will have what we need to move forward quickly towards clinical trials.
According to the
Alzheimer’s Association, Alzheimer’s disease is the 6th leading
cause of death in the US, and while the top 5 causes are declining, including
breast cancer, prostate cancer, heart disease, stroke, and HIV, Alzheimer’s
numbers are steadily rising and have increased by 68% between 2000–2010. In
fact, a recent study suggests that the number of deaths associated with
Alzheimer’s is much larger than previously thought and the disease may be the 3rd
leading cause of death.
The list includes more than 30 diseases and many additional conditions, including HIV
infection, spinal cord injury, traumatic brain injury, and certain cancers. To
know if any of these affect you or someone close to your heart, see our Comprehensive List of Amyloidoses and Conditions Affected by Abnormal Protein Aggregation.
Our drug, called a "molecular tweezer," is the first of its kind for which we know exactly how and why it works.
If
you want to learn more, check out where the molecular tweezers came from and the news items about their action on Parkinson’s
and Alzheimer’s. You can also find many of our scientific publications on Dr.
Bitan’s website.
The challenge
is that the molecular tweezers work in a way that is entirely different from
any drug developed before. Innovative ideas often are met with resistance. It is
hard to believe today, but there were times in which people wrote scientific articles “proving” that a
machine will never be able to carry its own weight in the air. This has nothing
to do with how smart or experienced the person is. As put so eloquently by
Tolstoy:
“The most
difficult subjects can be explained to the most slow-witted man if he has not
formed any idea of them already; but the simplest thing cannot be made clear to
the most intelligent man if he is firmly persuaded that he knows already,
without a shadow of doubt, what is laid before him.”
— Leo Tolstoy 1897
If everyone
who knows someone affected by these diseases contributes one dollar, we will have what
we need to move forward as quickly as possible towards clinical trials!THANK YOU

story:
The SURVIVEiT® Cancer COPiLOT™

When patients receive a cancer diagnosis, most feel overwhelmed. They hear “it’s cancer” and then wonder “what should I do first? And next?” Many patients want to advocate for themselves, but they don’t know how. That is about to change.

Up to this point, there has been limited innovation in patient advocacy. Most resources stop at education and awareness. As survivors helping patients, we understand the value of informed decision-making and taking action when we can. This tool equips patients and caregivers like never before. 

The Cancer COPiLOT™ (*patent pending) will provide patients and caregivers with the guidance, knowledge and support to advocate for themselves; replacing the guess-work with simple, actionable steps for their entire cancer journey.

 

The Impact of the Cancer COPiLOT™

 

The Cancer COPiLOT™ is the ultimate cancer navigation tool, arming people with the most current and comprehensive intel on cancer treatment and management so patients with every type of cancer at every stage of their cancer can have confidence in the decisions they will make.

From the moment of diagnosis, cancer patients are faced with choices. The SURVIVEiT® Cancer COPiLOT™ equips patients so they can anticipate, prepare and make informed decisions as they plot their course.

The Cancer COPiLOT™ is the first comprehensive 5-step personal cancer management tool, created by a team of survivors. To develop the Cancer COPiLOT™, we spent several years exploring the needs of people facing a diagnosis across 29 tumor types. After learning of the gaps and hearing the needs, we built a first-of-its-kind innovative patient interface that addresses them, and delivers peace of mind, ease and manageability in one convenient digital tool.

When equipped with this tool, patients can gain a sense of control and hope.

Backing the Cancer COPiLOT™ will enable us to ensure this new patient interface reaches the millions of people diagnosed and managing cancer every day, giving them the tool they have been seeking to navigate their cancer journey.

Join us in changing the course of cancer for millions of people.

 

 

Guidance Every Step of the Way

The Cancer COPiLOT™ directly addresses five key challenges in the cancer continuum - testing, verifying, treating, supporting and living - providing actionable solutions and giving patients peace of mind in the direction they choose.

 

1. TESTiT

Thanks to research and advancements, a cancer diagnosis goes well beyond where they found the cancer in your body. It’s the first step towards science-based answers. You want the best treatment available today? It starts here. We’ll show you how to get started. What you do first matters.

2. VERIFYiT

We know from experience, getting a qualified second opinion can be the difference between life and death, 5 months and 5 years, and wondering if this is really it or getting some peace of mind. We’ve done the research. All you need to do is set up the appointment - in-person or remote, whichever is best for you.

 

3. MATCHiT

Giving you the chance to identify your goals - both treatment and quality of life. A short list of important questions, posed by people who have been in your exact shoes, our Survivor Advisory Council. 

 

4. SUPPORTiT

Patients who have access to Supportive Care and adequate resources during treatment typically respond better and have fewer treatment interruptions. It’s proven.

 

5. LIVEiT

Your very own survivor-vetted resource library for managing the disease. From nutrition, to news, to financial assistance, and more - we’ve got the best of what’s currently available whenever you’re ready to seek help.

 

Why Now?

With the rapid advances in research and technology on the provider side, we are providing a digital solution for patients and caregivers to manage and access the best care possible in a way that aligns with their goals.

Since March 2020, COVID-19 has had an unprecedented impact on cancer diagnosis, treatment, trials and management. We are now seeking to advance the Cancer COPiLOT™ to enable patients to access information as early as possible, chart their course and be prepared to take new turns that they may encounter.

It is our ultimate goal to help patients achieve their goals in managing their disease and to do so fearlessly.

 

What Problem Are We Solving?

There is no single source patients and caregivers can go to to track, manage, and plan during their journey. Despite many organizations working to aid in a specific area of the journey, patients are left to research and manage options and supportive services best they can. As survivors, we have simplified steps and vetted resources so patients and caregivers can access better care options and support resources in a more efficient manner.
 

Your Role

We invite you to help ease the cancer experience for millions of people by enabling us to deliver the Cancer COPiLOT™ so they can better and more confidently navigate their cancer journey.

Join us in funding the Cancer COPiLOT™. With your tax-deductible donation, you will be offering those facing cancer peace of mind, a sense of control, and access to the best cancer care possible.

 

About SURVIVEiT®

At SURVIVEiT®, our mission is to empower cancer patients to define their own journey and face cancer on their own terms.

Our vision is a world free from the fear of cancer.

Cancer is scary. The decision making should not be.

Our team of cancer survivors and medical professionals have been committed to providing cancer patients with resources to help them advocate for themselves. With this new personalized tool, we’re giving cancer patients and caregivers even more.

story:
OSTRICH PILLOW GO is a stylish travel pillow that adapts to your neck and provides top quality comfort and unparalleled headrest.

 

OSTRICH PILLOW GO is the ultimate stylish travel pillow for people on the Go! 

Designed to provide maximum comfort and support for all neck sizes, with minimum product weight and volume. It definitely is the perfect travel companion.

 

 

 

 

With OSTRICH PILLOW GO we want to make sure that not a single person is excluded because of his or her neck proportions.

 

To use OSTRICH PILLOW GO, simply place it around your neck and fix it without fuss thanks to its hidden magnetic buttons.

Its three different positions guarantee a perfect fit and adaptation to your neck whatever its size. Then you're set to go and enjoy comfy dreams.

 

The secret behind OSTRICH PILLOW GO's unique comfort lies inside. The viscoelastic core of the pillow is made out of high-sensitivity memory foam. The foam core has a protective cotton fabric layer around it. The outermost layer is a removable and washable sleeve made out of skin-friendly stretchable fabric.

Our team has worked hard to find a universal shape that would provide optimal headrest for different neck types. 

 

OSTRICH PILLOW GO's carefully chosen materials are able to reduce dramatic in volume, which is extremely convenient for travelling.

We've spent months testing hundreds of foam samples until we got to the nap-perfect consistency that guarantees dream-level comfort and compact transport for hardcore travellers. 

  

 

 

 

OSTRICH PILLOW GO is the latest in the OSTRICH PILLOW saga of napping classics.

We are Studio Banana Things, the design studio behind the idea. We first launched the OSTRICH PILLOW ORIGINAL in Kickstarter in 2012 and the campaign was a total success that went viral on global media. Since then we've created the commute-friendly LIGHT and the discreet MINI versions, also to great public and Kickstarter acclaim.

Earlier this year we thought that the next member of the OSTRICH PILLOW family should focus on providing perfect neck support and be super compact for diehard travellers. Our design team has spent the last few months studying the anatomy of the neck, analysing emerging travel habits, researching materials and patterns, visiting manufacturers and restlessly improving the design until we got to a really satisfactory point.

We're super excited to bring OSTRICH PILLOW GO to you and can't wait to press the button GO at the factory thanks to your support.

 

 

Designing OSTRICH PILLOW GO we have leveraged on all our knowledge on napping pillows accumulated over the years. We have done our homework and in parallel to working on the design of the product we have identified the different suppliers and manufacturers that are in a capacity to produce the product from the get-go (no pun intended).

A particular aspect about memory foam is that it needs to be injected in a mould for manufacturing. The great news is that we have already made that initial investment and we have the mould ready at the factory.

The supply of the special lining fabric is another critical aspect and we are happy to inform you that we have the material ready to be ordered. If our campaign goes well we'll be proposing as stretch goals different fabric patterns so get ready to make your choice!

The final key aspect is packaging. The design is very advanced and we're finalising the manufacturing details. You'll surely get news from us about this aspect during the campaign.

 

Many in the Kickstarter community may already know about us, Studio Banana Things. We are a passionate group of designers who love to imagine new worlds and develop fun and functional solutions for people on the go.

We are best known for the OSTRICH PILLOW family, which has turned heads internationally for the last 3 years. We are also recognised for other award-winning designs which have been exhibited in places such as the Museum of Modern Art New York.

Kickstarter, with its smart and active community of backers, is the perfect platform for us to explore our latest ideas. We are keen to listen and learn from you during this campaign and need you every step of the way.

story:
My Story

Hi! My name is Kat and sometime in 2009 I was bitten by a tick. I would soon find that ticks are very powerful parasites: They have the ability to make you forget your name or phone number, say "lettuce" instead of "gasoline", cause debilitating pain and fatigue, make your facial muscles twitch uncontrollably, isolate you from your friends and family and leave you depressed, alone and broke. The cost of treatment for this highly controversial disease is in the tens of thousands...if you're lucky enough to be insured. 


The Impact

By helping raise the money I need to pay for the treatments for Late Stage Chronic/Neurological Lyme Disease, you're helping a 28 year old girl have a shot at a normal life again. You're helping a girl go back to her life of adventure and activism. I want to inspire the world to be active in their life and the world around them whether it be philanthropic, social activism, socially responsible media or creative business ventures like TOM's Shoes. Since I've gotten sick, I haven't been able to volunteer, fund-raise or pursue any other avenue of social responsibility. My wish is that I will soon be able to return to this. 


What You Can Do

The funds raised will go towards the cost of medical treatment for Late Stage Chronic Lyme Disease. Current treatments cost upwards of $1800 per month. My Dr has warned me of the possible necessity of a Port or PICC Line in order to administer daily IV infusions of Rocephin, which will increase the monthly cost of treatment by $1000. There is also roughly $5000 in lab bills, which I will scan copies of. The money I raise through this will go to medical expenses ONLY, NOT personal living expenses. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Instead of offering "perks", I've created a Cafe Press shop where you can buy Lyme Awareness products. There are T-shirts, tote bags, water bottles...even iPhone cases! As with this fundraiser, all proceeds go towards my medical treatment. 

Please share this with your social network. No contribution is too small! Sharing my page on Facebook, Twitter or even email is simple, thanks to the share tools IndieGoGo has implemented!


About Lyme

The above trailer is for the film "Under our Skin". I am not involved with this film whatsoever. I chose to use it in my campaign because I feel it eloquently highlights the struggle of Lyme Disease. 

For more information on Lyme Disease, please visit:

www.lymenet.org

www.lymedisease.org

story:
The Reason Why

I have been working in the medical field for 10 years. And it never fails. I always hear how clients from Routine Doctor Appointments, Dialysis Centers, Rehabilitation Centers, Hospital Discharges and disabled veterans complain about the transportation services and there experience. My partner and I came up with the brilliant idea to make a difference and create our own NEMT (Non-Emergency Medical Transportation) company. We want Blue Angel Medical Transport to provide the best care to our clients by treating each individual person like one of our own family members. We want to strive to over exceed expectations with quality service as our primary goal. We want to provide nothing less than an exceptional transportation service. Our main goal would be to get you or your loved ones where they need to be in a safe timely matter, when they need to get there. It is difficult for a family member to take on the challenges of transporting a loved one that may be temporarily or permanently disabled. We need your help and support. Give us a chance and help us turn this dream into reality.

 

Easier Said Than Done

Starting a NEMT business is not as easy as it looks. We need the right amount of funding to start off on the right path. Our goal is to raise 55k. We broke it down for you to personally see how and where we will use the funding.

  • Legal/Small business fees
  • 2 full size conversion vans (1 wheelchair van with lift, 1 stretcher van)
  • General Liability Insurance (full coverage)
  • Auto Insurance (full coverage)
  • Workers Comp
  • Advertising (TV, web, print)
  • Office expenses (first 6 months)
  • Uniforms
  • Certifications and background checks for employees

Don’t worry, if we don’t completely reach our goal your funding will still go to good use. Whether that means doing an follow-up campaign, applying for loans and grants or reaching out to possible investors. We strive to get Blue Angel off the ground; you will not be let down

 

The Impact

My Partner and I wants to make a difference in Non-Emergency Medical Transportation. Our mission is for Blue Angel to be completely based on a customer focused NEMT company providing in good time, courteous transportation with outstanding customer service to the patients, facilities and communities in which we will serve. We aim to provide the highest quality of service with a direct focus on our client’s wishes and requirements.

 

What You Get

Contributions of any size are a huge help and appreciated, but as added perks, Blue Angel is offering some special incentives for larger gifts like free keychains, polo shirts, baseball caps and advertising. If you’re not interested or concerned about receiving your perks, then we’ll gladly donate 10% to the AARP Foundation and send you a copy of the confirmation/receipt so you’ll know that it’s in good hands.

 

Make Noise And Tell The World

We all know it requires money to launch an awesome business. So if you are unable to donate, then please help by spreading the word. To make things even easier, share this page on your Facebook and Twitter. This is our dream and anything you can do to help makes a difference!  I also hope to see you when we cut the red ribbon on opening day and also be an satisfied customer once our business starts.

story:
Who am I?

An avid lacrosse player, teacher in America, and adventurer.  My name is Patrick Verdun and I am 24 years old.  I am the youngest of seven children and just received my masters degree in teaching in hopes of becoming a teacher and lacrosse coach.

Unlike most lacrosse enthusiasts I came to learn the medicine game after coming to college at Southern Oregon University.  It was here while pursuing my education I truly found my passion in life.  Lacrosse is unlike all other games and their is a reason Native Americans, founders of the game, call it the medicine game.  Unlike other hobbies of my mine, lacrosse is always a spiritual experience for me whether I am playing by myself or in the biggest game of the season.  Lacrosse is with me now till I die.  This game has provided me more life opportunities, friends, family, and life experiences then almost any other facet of my life.  This game heals my soul, mends my heart, brings peace to my mind, and brings me closer to God.  That is why I want to so badly go on this trip with USAAI.

USAAi, which is described below, has offered me the opportunity to travel to Melbourne, Australia from June 4th 2013, to June 15th, 2013 and take part in the Down Under Cup Invitational Lacrosse Tournament as part of a lacrosse team representing the USA.  You must be recommended by someone to USAAI before you are even considered for a trip.  The team consists of lacrosse players from all over the United States.  However, as it stands I am the only attendee from a west coast college, the state of Oregon, and a school without a varsity lacrosse program.  I might as well have played on an NCAA level lacrosse team with the amount of work, dedication, and time I have put in and still do even after finishing college.  Currently, I help out with the college team at Southern Oregon University while teaching and also working at an alternative school.  Wherever I go, I bring my excitement for lacrosse with me as all of my students will tell you.  This enriching experience will definitely add to that and help me to grow the game even more.

USAAI, or USA Athletes International, Inc. is a non-profit organization dedicated to giving amateur athletes and coaches the opportunity to participate in international Olympic-style sporting events throughout the world, while also allowing them to broaden their educational and cultural knowledge of the world through the experience.  With over 20 years experience of international sports tournament travel.  We currently are represented with over 900 athletes in 7 sports that travel around the world to over 14 countries.

It is an honor to be able to participate on one of these adventures and represent the USA at the international lacrosse level.  A dream of mine is to play this game where ever I can and till the day I die.  This trip will be keeping that dream alive.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The base fee for this trip is $5,000.  This doesn't include a fuel surcharge to Australia or my connecting flights to and from our designated meeting location.  These funds pay for travel to Australia, room and board, team uniforms, and team expeditions.  All funds will be used for the sole purpose of this USAAI trip.

The Impact

It is hard for me to put the impact this trip will have in words.  I will be having the opportunity to play lacrosse, which is always exciting for me.  I will be part of an international team competing at a very high level and representing the USA.  What an opportunity!  Not to mention all the wonderful people I will meet on the team and on my travels.  This trip also provides me with the opportunity to see another part of the world.  I will be exposed to new people, new culture, and new ways of life. An experience that will only help me to develop more global knowledge and allow me to share it with my students and players back home.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a financial donation at this time or simply do not want to, that is totally ok!  Please, however, share this with someone else or anyone who might take an interest in supporting my cause.  I greatly appreciate your time and thank you.

story: New Skool Wrestling was started on July 4th 2012. Now on its second birthday it has become a non-profit organization. From the beginning we have always helped important organizations raise funds and awareness through our unique brand of entertainment.  So far we have helped The Wounded Warrior Project, Autism Speaks, The Insight Center, Billy Hall and The Bennett College JMS Department. We have done all of this on a very small budget that we barely scrape by with. We are asking for help from the community so that we can continue to give back to organizations that need our support. Anything will help us, we have so many fans, friends and family that if everyone gave $5 we would reach our goal very quickly. The reason for the funding is to be able to buy our own equipment and not have to rent it anymore. We would also be able to produce our DVDs professionally and get our training center up and running. All donations are tax deductable and we will provide you with our EIN # if you would like.

story:
I'm embarking on a learning journey to discover how the healthcare industry can collaborate to build new technologies to make the provision of health and care in the future more sustainable. I need your help and can offer you help in return. 

Summary

I’m Sarah Mathieson and I’ve been selected to be a Saltire Fellow for 2014/2015. The Satire Foundation offers a transformational opportunity to study at Babson College, in Boston, the world’s #1 school for entrepreneurial studies and return equipped with the tools and mindset to take on a leadership role in a Scottish business. A start-up enthusiast and Chartered Marketer, I’ve always enjoyed my work, no matter what project I’ve been involved in developing, but I’ve come to the realisation that I need the work that I do to have a more significant impact; it has got to mean something to someone. Specifically, I want to be creating products and services that impact people’s lives in a meaningful way – and I plan to do this within the growing digital health industry. It’s an exciting sector with a playing field of evangelists, entrepreneurs, start-up accelerators and incubators, crowd funding platforms, and collaborative hubs involving academia, industry, health and care partners and the third sector. Government agencies and healthcare professionals around the world are in desperate need of innovative technologies and support mechanisms that work towards alleviating the stratospheric cost increases estimated for health and care delivery. I want to make a contribution to the way that innovations can improve access to care, reduce inefficiencies and drive down cost and so I’ll be working on a blueprint for collaboration success.

The Saltire Fellowship programme will enable me to transition into a role that allows me to achieve these aims. It’s a big commitment - I’m leaving my husband, daughter Tiggy who is 6 and son Alexander who is 8 back home in Scotland for four months - but I think it will be worth it. And they do too!

What I Need 

I have already managed to raise a significant amount of funding (£35,466.10) towards the programme fees and associated costs and I am extremely grateful to The Satire Foundation, The Fulbright Commission, Highlands and Islands Enterprise (HIE) and my local education trust for this support. I now need to raise a further £14,000 to cover the following  

Programme fees and associated costs   £3,912.90

Maintenance whilst in US  £1,950.00

UK based maintenance costs  £8,137.10

& What You Get

Following requests to share some of my learning and insights, I have created a range of packages that enable you to join me, at least in part, on this exciting journey. If effective collaboration is founded on generosity, sharing, and giving, then I hope that we can do that together. 

Everyone can keep up to date on my progress in the US by following my brand new blog. I hope that some of you will use this to track what I am up to and keep in touch.

The Impact

The Saltire Fellowship programme is hugely exciting. It combines teaching at Babson College with hands-on project based experience in US global companies alongside emersion in a culture of entrepreneurship. A 13 week period of study in Boston is followed by two learning journeys of 1 week in Silicon Valley followed by 12 days in China. As the HIE Saltire Fellow I also have access to MIT through HIE’s Industrial Liaison Programme membership and support from the HIE life sciences team who I’ll be working on a project for whilst in the US. The programme offers a unique opportunity to explore business challenges from a global perspective and whilst in the US I will be looking closely at what successful collaboration looks like.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone is in a position to contribute to this campaign, but perhaps you could help by telling others about what I am doing and how they might benefit from getting involved (see The Perks). Please share info about my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools. 

Thank you!

story:
My Story

My name is Mike O’Keefe, I am the Managing Director of OMG Creative - an integrated brand and digital agency in Melbourne - and I have a passion and love of riding.

I recently read an article in the Melbourne Age about Team Rwanda, Rwanda’s national cycling team, that both inspired and saddened myself and our staff.  

Their home is The Africa Rising Cycling Centre. It also serves as a training facility for all countries on the African continent, making it a cycling hub for Africa. But residents and visitors to the centre are unable to drink the tap water due to the threat of common diseases such as diarrhoea, arsenicosis, cholera, fluorosis, intestinal worms, schistosomiasis, trachoma and typhoid.

What we in Australia expect as a basic need (fresh water) is a luxury to Team Rwanda.

They are trying to raise US$25,000 to purchase a water filtration system so that the riders, their staff and guests can drink fresh water, when they want.

I researched more information on Rwanda, the team and sporting heroes of Rwanda.

For several days I couldn’t get the images of horror from the genocide out of my mind. The team has a participant in the Glasgow Commonwealth Games, Adrien Niyonshuti, whose six brothers were brutally slaughtered during Rwanda’s 100 day Genocide. Perhaps he is the first cycling hero from Rwanda. Except for several soccer players, there appears to be few Rwandan sporting heroes to act as role models for their youth.

I decided I would donate via indiegogo.com for the Water Filtration Fundraiser, but further, I decided to use our business skills and networks to try and raise the full US$25,000 they require.

Why is this important to me? Every person has a right to clean water, and every child deserves to have a hero to aspire to. If we can play a small part to help Africa create some cycling sporting heroes for the youth of the continent then that can only be a positive thing.

What We Need & What You Get

Neither my business nor I have any financial or other relationship with Team Rwanda. If we can raise these funds I suspect we will have a lot of happy people in Africa and in Australia.

US$25,000 will buy a water filtration system that will provide proper water pressure, adequate reserves (18,000 litres) and purified water. These will last ten days at full capacity should they experience an interruption in local service, which is a common occurrence.

I expect the greatest incentive we receive for donating is one of satisfaction, however Team Rwanda has numerous incentives based on the amount donated and these are displayed in the side bar.

What will be the impact?

A clean and safe training facility and, I suspect, an increase in support from a proud group of young people.

A better training facility, plus the commitment of the staff and riders, will enable the team to be better prepared, to improve performance and to one day compete on the world stage in individual and team events.

The outcome of this is that the children of Africa and their parents will have heroes to barrack for and to aspire to.

The challenges

The challenges are to generate awareness of the problem and to motivate Australians and cyclists to see the value in supporting this fundraiser.

How you can help

Apart from donating yourself, please pass this information to friends and fellow riders. One day we might be able to cheer on Team Rwanda at the Tour Down Under and potentially the TDF. Thank you on their behalf.

story:
Save Ionie's Heart, Save her Life!!!!

Ionie is a 35 yr old single mother of 4 living in rural Manchester Jamaica, who have been suffering from Cardiac problems for many years. It has gotton worse, and without an open-heart surgery name Mitral Valve Replacement surgery we fear her life will be cut short!!!

Her family, friends,  her local community, and her local church in Jamaica, as well as her aunt and cousin from Toronto Canada, and her uncle from Buffalo New York is trying their best to come up with some of the money for surgery. But more money is still needed.

It will Cost $2450 USD for the Open Heart Kit/Mitral Valve &

It will cost $500,000 JAD ~$6250USD for Hospital Fees &

Unknown amount for rehabitation and taking care of the kids

 

PLEASE GIVE TODAY!!!! ANY CONTRIBUTION IS WELCOME!!!!

story:
My name is Melissa Burt and I have created this campaign to raise money to help my nephew, Angel Burt, who just after turning 19 years old suffered a pulmonary embolism. The money raised will cover medical bills and help with the costs of caring for his baby boy, who is due to be born on July 22nd.

 

The story...

On June 9th, 2012, Angel was rushed to Sarasota Memorial Hospital by ambulance after collapsing at his and his fiancé’s baby shower. Before he reached the hospital his heart stopped and he had to be revived. Upon arriving at the emergency room, his heart stopped and was revived another 2 times. The heart surgeon on staff, and the one who saved Angel’s life, immediately took Angel into surgery. On the way into the operating room and then again on the operating table, Angel’s heart stopped and was revived again, for a total of 5 times.

During surgery, it was found that a 2-foot long blood clot had traveled into Angel’s main artery to his left lung, which stopped the airflow (i.e. pulmonary embolism). He was kept in ICU for 4 days and was given a total of 45 blood transfusions within 72 hours. There were additional, smaller blood clots that were found, so he has been given the blood thinner Coumadin intravenously since being in the hospital. The doctor also inserted a permanent type of screen in his main artery, which will catch any new blood clots that form.

While in recovery, he has also suffered from pancreatitis and reoccurring fluid around the outside of his lungs. On July 5th he had to have a thoracotomy to remove infection and scar tissue build up on his lung.

Thankfully, Angel was strong and survived this ordeal. He has been in the hospital since then, slowly recovering. He has suffered from depression and anxiety that has required medication to help treat, and he speaks daily with a therapist 1-on-1 to help him cope. Brain damage has not been detected to date.

Many of the medical staff at Sarasota Memorial Hospital are calling Angel, ‘the miracle guy.’

 

Before he collapsed…

In early May, Angel noticed he had pain in his left lower leg. He went to the Sarasota County Health Department and had an x-ray taken and was given Tramadol, an opiate pain reliever.

Shortly after, with no reprieve from Tramadol, the pain then moved to his chest. Angel went to the emergency room at Doctors Hospital of Sarasota. He told the doctor that he had pain in his leg that had gone away and now was in his rib area. They took a chest x-ray and told him it was a muscle strain. They sent him home with a prescription for ibuprofen.

Not long after, Angel developed a dry cough, chest pain, and extreme shortness of breath. He went back to the Sarasota County Health Department where they did a heart EKG and gave him a prescription for Amoxicillin, a penicillin-based antibiotic to treat bacterial infections. He is allergic to penicillin (it was stated in his medical records), so he went back to the health department the next day and they gave him a new prescription for Erythromycin, which is used to treat bacterial infections, but without penicillin.

 

Why it happened…

The doctors still do not have an answer as to why he developed the blood clots. He is not an at risk person to develop them, which is most likely why he was not diagnosed previous to his pulmonary embolism. A few of the factors have been ruled out, but they still may never understand why it happened.

 

The future…

Angel just finished high school and turned 19 years old in March. His fiancé is pregnant with their son, who is due to arrive on July 22nd. He only just started working as a Certified Nurse Assistant and was making plans for his new family’s life together. His fiancé, Sammie, only 18 years old, had plans to stay home and take care of their son for at least the first 6 months after Zayden is born.

Since this traumatizing ordeal, not only does Angel experience severe physical pain, he now suffers from severe anxiety and depression as well. At 19 years old, he had something terrible and unexplainable happen to him. Perhaps you remember what it was like for you at that age, just getting your life started? Being young with so many hopes and dreams? Now it’s not only his future he has to think about, but his son’s future as well. How is he going to be able to support himself and his new family?

 

How you can help…

Luckily, Angel and Sammie have a great support network of parents, grandparents, sisters, aunts, uncles, and friends, but a little money to help them along until they can figure out what the future holds would be an incredible blessing at this time. Angel has health insurance, but it will not cover all of his medical bills and he will not be able to work for quite some time.

I am hoping to raise as much money as I can to cover some of the costs for their son Zayden's first year and to cover some of the costs of Angel’s medical bills.

Please contribute whatever you can. Any amount will be extremely appreciated.

 

A personal note…

There is nothing that can ever prepare you too see someone you love so much, be so vulnerable and in such a critical state. The massive swelling of his body, the amount of tubes coming out of him, and the machines helping to keep him alive is something that I will never be able to forget, and never want to see him go through again. I’d like to personally thank Sarasota Memorial Hospital for saving Angel’s life and for helping him recover.

 

Thank you for taking the time to visit this page and for donating to this cause.

 

For more information on pulmonary embolism, please visit the site’s listed below.

http://www.emedicinehealth.com/pulmonary_embolism/article_em.htm

http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/pulmonary-embolism/DS00429

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pulmonary_embolism

The doctor also inserted a permanent type of screen in his main artery, which will catch any new blood clots that form.
While in recovery, he has also suffered from pancreatitis and reoccurring fluid around the outside of his lungs. On July 5th he had to have a thoracotomy to remove infection and scar tissue build up on his lung.
Thankfully, Angel was strong and survived this ordeal. He has been in the hospital since then, slowly recovering. He has suffered from depression and anxiety that has required medication to help treat, and he speaks daily with a therapist 1-on-1 to help him cope. Brain damage has not been detected to date.
Many of the medical staff at Sarasota Memorial Hospital are calling Angel, ‘the miracle guy.’
 
Before he collapsed…
In early May, Angel noticed he had pain in his left lower leg. He went to the Sarasota County Health Department and had an x-ray taken and was given Tramadol, an opiate pain reliever.
Shortly after, with no reprieve from Tramadol, the pain then moved to his chest. Angel went to the emergency room at Doctors Hospital of Sarasota. He told the doctor that he had pain in his leg that had gone away and now was in his rib area. They took a chest x-ray and told him it was a muscle strain. They sent him home with a prescription for ibuprofen.
Not long after, Angel developed a dry cough, chest pain, and extreme shortness of breath. He went back to the Sarasota County Health Department where they did a heart EKG and gave him a prescription for Amoxicillin, a penicillin-based antibiotic to treat bacterial infections. He is allergic to penicillin (it was stated in his medical records), so he went back to the health department the next day and they gave him a new prescription for Erythromycin, which is used to treat bacterial infections, but without penicillin.
 
Why it happened…
The doctors still do not have an answer as to why he developed the blood clots. He is not an at risk person to develop them, which is most likely why he was not diagnosed previous to his pulmonary embolism. A few of the factors have been ruled out, but they still may never understand why it happened.
 
The future…
Angel just finished high school and turned 19 years old in March. His fiancé is pregnant with their son, who is due to arrive on July 22nd. He only just started working as a Certified Nurse Assistant and was making plans for his new family’s life together. His fiancé, Sammie, only 18 years old, had plans to stay home and take care of their son for at least the first 6 months after Zayden is born.
Since this traumatizing ordeal, not only does Angel experience severe physical pain, he now suffers from severe anxiety and depression as well. At 19 years old, he had something terrible and unexplainable happen to him. Perhaps you remember what it was like for you at that age, just getting your life started? Being young with so many hopes and dreams? Now it’s not only his future he has to think about, but his son’s future as well. How is he going to be able to support himself and his new family?
 
How you can help…
Luckily, Angel and Sammie have a great support network of parents, grandparents, sisters, aunts, uncles, and friends, but a little money to help them along until they can figure out what the future holds would be an incredible blessing at this time. Angel has health insurance, but it will not cover all of his medical bills and he will not be able to work for quite some time.
I am hoping to raise as much money as I can to cover some of the costs for their son Zayden's first year and to cover some of the costs of Angel’s medical bills.
Please contribute whatever you can. Any amount will be extremely appreciated.
 

A personal note…

There is nothing that can ever prepare you too see someone you love so much, be so vulnerable and in such a critical state. The massive swelling of his body, the amount of tubes coming out of him, and the machines helping to keep him alive is something that I will never be able to forget, and never want to see him go through again. I’d like to personally thank Sarasota Memorial Hospital for saving Angel’s life and for helping him recover.
 
Thank you for taking the time to visit this page and for donating to this cause.
 
For more information on pulmonary embolism, please visit the site’s listed below.
http://www.emedicinehealth.com/pulmonary_embolism/article_em.htm
http://www.mayoclinic.com/health/pulmonary-embolism/DS00429
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pulmonary_embolism

story:
Summary

Prime is the first scientifically tested and proven supplement that eliminates hangovers. If at least one in four alcoholic drinks you consume throughout your day contains Prime, you will wake up with a significantly reduced to no hangover, and you'll be ready to start the next day. We have developed a one of a kind formula, but now we need help with finalization of flavoring and manufacturing. With your donations to our Indiegogo campaign, together we will revolutionize the way people drink and party! Every donor gets to try it for themselves, even at 5$!

Prime mixed with lemonade and vodka. *Ultra awesome custom bottles not included.

So What is a Hangover?

It’s not just that pounding headache you may get after drinking, but the general discomfort that you feel the day after drinking. The symptoms of a hangover can range from feeling sluggish, loss of appetite, and feeling drowsy. The reason you get hung over is because when you drink your body produces acetaldehyde in your blood stream which depletes Vitamin B1 and can damage your liver. Your liver naturally produces chemicals to keep the level of acetaldehyde toxicity in check, but it reaches a point when it can no longer produce enough fight it. 


How Prime Helps

Prime has the amino acids and biochemicals your liver needs to naturally break down acetaldehyde and prevent it from harming your body. It also has the electrolytes needed to help keep you hydrated and a vitamin B complex to prevent next day headaches. Prime only breaks down the toxic byproducts of alcohol metabolism and not the alcohol itself.


Our goals:

With funding, we'll be able to put Prime in the reach of every potential party goer by delivering Prime in easy to use single serving containers. These small and discreet packages are easy to bring virtually anywhere. 

They can fit in...                                                                                                                     ~Your purse                                                                                                                        ~Your pant pocket                                                                                                                ~Your Fannypack ( but seriously don't )

Your contributions will go towards getting Prime formulated and flavored at a top forementioned laboratory, to setting up a large scale manufacturing system and as stretch goals - advertising and changing the world for the better.


Our Testing Process: 

Prime is the only supplement of its kind that has gone through various tests to prove that it actually reduces the rate of hangover by a quantifiable amount. We would not want to sell people anything that we were not sure worked, so we made sure we tested Prime repeatedly before releasing it into the world.

The tests we used were:

A reagent test to see the levels of acetaldehyde in the test subject before and after heavy drinking. For this test we had people of similar height and weight drink the same amount with Prime introduced into their system. Through this we were able to see a decrease in toxicity but did not have a quantifiable amount.

The second method of chemical testing yielded more precise chemical data, and tested using Headspace Gas Chromatography equipment. We took samples of the subjects' urine and put it through the machine to find the actual level of decrease in toxicity. Through this we found an approximately a 73% reduction in estimated blood concentration levels of hangover-causing acetaldehyde.

The third test was an introspective individual survey. We gave people Prime and got them very very drunk, half of the people had a placebo, the rest were given the actual supplement. The following morning they were asked to complete surveys rating their levels of discomfort from 1-10 (1 being I've never felt better and ten being I feel like I was just hit by a massive truck). The average discomfort reported from the experimental group was 2.6 and the average discomfort from the placebo group was 7.8

We would also like to take this moment to say we are really really sorry for the people we gave hangovers on purpose. It was all in the name of science.


Disclaimer: 

-Prime only prevents hangovers.
- It does not protect people against any of the other damaging effects of drinking alcohol including but not limited to liver damage and alcohol poisoning. 
- It will not keep you from making regrettable decisions or going home with questionable people.
-It will not keep you from throwing up on your roommate's cat.
-It will not allow you to drive after drinking a few beers. 
Please do not drink while pregnant and please enjoy responsibly. Thank you!

About Our Team

The Prime Company was founded in Long Beach by two college students  (Marlo and Walter) with a dream of a future with no hangovers. Andrew (a student at UC Berkeley) joined the team earlier this year.

Walter (a Chemistry major at Cal State Long Beach) developed and tested the formula for our modern miracle. His love of science has gone as far back as he can remember and he has loved every minute of applying his mad science skills to changing the way you party.

Marlo is the resident Marketing and PR girl for Prime. She graduated a semester early from Cal State Fullerton while maintaining a full time job and an internship almost every semester

Andrew is a motivated entrepreneur who has worked with several start ups in the past including his own food delivery company.

(From left to right: Marlo, Walter and Andrew)

Risks and Challenges

This business is a small startup being run by two university students, a recent graduate, and a handful of freelancers. We have had very limited financial resources thus far, but have been able to use scientific resources from the founder's university to effectively prove that our product is functional. So far, the supplement formulation and testing has been run informally on the minimal resources available over a long period of time. Despite these limitations, we have overcome many of the challenges of testing and functional formulation, and we continue to do so.

Upon funding, the last stage of development will begin- the formulation of the flavoring and developing a large-scale manufacturing and distribution process. This process will be done in part by a professional firm with over eight years of industry experience and an expansive portfolio of successful beverages launched. Unless our laboratory in Van Nuys is destroyed by aliens or Russia starts World War III, it is unlikely that the product should fail to be developed.
