story:
Centre Médical Frase.

(Forum de Réflexion pour les Actions Sociales et Estudiantines)

Notre projet consiste à construire une Polyclinique en RD Congo. Avec l'explosion démographique de la zone géographique où nous désirons implanter notre Polyclinique, nous auront pour mission de soigner et d'éduquer les patients abandonnés dans la rue. Cette population n'a pas le budget ni les moyens pour se permettre les soins de première nécessité dans des centre Médicaux.  Les femmes ne sont pas en mesure d'accoucher dans un endroit stérile et convenable. Leur situation financière est précaire.   Comme tout établissement du réseau de la santé et des services sociaux, Frase trouve sa raison d’être dans le fait que chaque personne ou groupe de personnes va requérir au cours de son existence à des soins et des services en vue de maintenir et d’améliorer sa capacité physique, psychique et sociale.

Avec la collecte,nous allons:

1.Bâtir un Centre

2.Achéter l'équipement Médical

3.Reinvestir 

OSBL Frase

Numéro d’identification : 424832-5

21 Derome, Laval Québec

H7N2M4 Canada.

Fraseplus@gmail.com

Tél :514.562.0535  & Tél : 243.853228601

Objectif : Promotion de la santé au Congo

Frase veut dire Forum de Réflexion pour les Actions Sociales et Estudiantine.

Frase est un Organisme à but non lucratif de droit Canado-Congolaise, créée en 2004 qui, au-delà de toute distinction culturelle, ethnique et politique  s’attache à promouvoir la santé de plus démunis. Améliorer la santé des enfants est l'une des nombreuses responsabilités relevant de la lutte contre la pauvreté. Des enfants en bonne santé deviennent des adultes en bonne santé, qui améliorent leurs conditions de vie, ainsi que celles de leurs communautés et de leur pays. Améliorer la santé des enfants du monde est un des objectifs essentiel de Frase.Son but est :

  • Élaboration d’une politique saine de santé

  • Création des milieux favorables pour le développement.

  • Renforcement de l’action communautaire

  • Acquérir des aptitudes individuelles

  • Réorientation de services de santé

  • Évangélisation…

    FICHE SYNOPTIQUE DU PROJET

    Intitulé du projet: "Santé Plus" Projet de construction d’un centre Médical en faveur de la population du Territoire de Tshela et des populations environnantes.

    Responsable exécutif du projet: OSBL Frase

    Réalisation: Mr Lemire-cloutier Dominic, Mr Bakana Samy, Mr Mabuila Christian et Mme Nsingi Claudine. Population cible: Habitants de Tshela, évalués à ± 419.000 habitants.

    Site du projet: Avenue Lukula Numéro 29,cité de Tshela,Quartier Kasa-Vubu

    Nombre d’emploi généré: 25 emplois permanents

    Durée du projet: Période indéterminée -- Coût du projet: 750.000$

 Un partenariat avec l’église sera fait en but de facilité plusieurs facteurs.

story:
AS FEATURED IN

GET YOUR GAME DATA AUTOMATICALLY

Are you tired of fiddling with your golf GPS or electronic scorecard to keep your game up to par? What if, instead of manually entering details of your round, you could focus on playing BUT still get all the statistics from each and every shot? What if you could access this data on the course during every round?

Imagine, if the data could be sent from the course to the cloud, back and forth in real time. You could compete with you friends and see live leaderboard even if you played in different tournaments, categories or even countries! Ideas like this helped us come up with an all-in-one golf solution which we call CaddieON.

CADDIEON DESIGN PRINCIPLES

  • Create a robust solution to automate data collection from a round of golf.
  • Free the player to focus on the game.
  • Make golf more interesting, fun and social.

PUT YOUR CADDIE TO WORK

Our groundbreaking automated data collection lets players focus on their game and at the same time gives the player a unique opportunity to get detailed data of his rounds of golf.

HOW IT WORKS

  1. Place a light weight and unnoticeable tag to the top of the grip in each of your clubs. CaddieON wrist device reads the tag and knows the club you use.
  2. Once you take your swing the wrist device recognizes each shot you take. Practice swings in the air are not captured.
  3. Your smartphone records the GPS position of each stroke, so you do not need to do any disturbing data collection activities while taking a shot.
  4. The game data is sent from your smartphone to a player portal on the internet.

During the game you can easily switch between the scorecard, stroke details, rangefinder and course map views in the CaddieON mobile application.

Automated and accurate real time data collection opens a whole new world to the game of golf. Players can use this data to improve. They can relive their golf highlights; they can share each experience from the course or compare their performance with friends and other players. It's not just the wrist device or the app - It's your personal caddie without yearly payments.

HELP US REVOLUTIONIZE YOUR GOLF

Our work started over one and a half years ago with a firm belief that it can be done. We are almost there – but now we need some help. We want to engage you, your friends, your course and the whole golf community to elevate your golf experiences to a new level.

Here’s where we need your support.

MAP A COURSE

CaddieON golf course mapper

There are about 40 000 golf courses throughout the world. In order to automatically collect the statistics and help you play these courses, the course needs to be mapped. We would like to start with your course! Unfortunately we just don’t have the resources to do them all in a short time. You are the best expert to be able to map your local course. Once you’ve done it, you can enjoy the credits from your fellow golfers. Plus, receive a discount on your CaddieON wrist device kit. Complete mapping of an 18-hole course takes about 3 hours’ work and it is done with our golf course mapping tool. Check out the tool in mapper.caddieon.com. Use username demouser with password demo to browse existing courses and try how the mapping is done. We will open the mapper for drawing during January.

MAKE A PLEDGE

You can also help confirm that personal caddie is needed! Make a contribution that allows us the opportunity to actually start the manufacturing of the CaddieON wrist devices. Currently the wrist device supports Android but with your support, we can finish our work and bring the iOS app and a wrist device to the market as well.

GIVE FEEDBACK

Lastly, help us provide more value for your game. We are now introducing the unique CaddieON concept with automated data collection. Once the data is there, tons of possibilities are available! Be one of the first ones to benefit from you game data and tell us how we can serve your game better.

ABOUT CADDIEON TEAM

CaddieON was founded in Finland 2012. We have a team of 10 with 5 founding partners working full time for the project. The team has combined over 100 years of experience in bringing consumer products to the global mobile market. On top of that, we can utilize our large network of contacts to bring the CaddieON to market. Our experience shows! We have developed this versatile CaddieON concept exceptionally fast and are going forward with full speed.

We are passionate about making technology work for you simply and easily. We already have fully functional prototypes and have beta tested the product on the golf courses around the globe. At the moment we are perfecting the mechanics of the wrist device and finalizing the software in the application and player portal. We have secured components availability for the first production batch. We hold the European type approval for the wrist device and we have patents pending for the CaddieON concept.

SPREAD THE WORD

Join our efforts! Let your golfer friends know how they could enjoy their game even more. Help us spread the word of the campaign and CaddieON by using the indiegogo share tools.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:

Question: Where can I see a list of the courses?

Answer: The courses currently mapped in the system can be checked from: http://www.caddieon.com/product-information/course-list/ or by logging to http://mapper.caddieon.com with username demouser and password demo.

Question: Can a user volunteer to map a course?

Answer: Definitely and we really value that! Log in to mapper and check that the course has not been mapped already and start working on it.

Question: What is the weight of the tags that attaches to the club? Is there a change in the clubhead swing weight?

Answer: Each tag weights about 1.2 grams (0.042 ounces) , so it is really nothing.

Question: Will the retraction/replacement of the clubs (ie shaft down in to the base of the golf bag) for each shot, present any dislodgement problems, or damaging 'wear and tear' for the tags?

Answer: The tag is molded inside the plastic, so they are durable enough to take the hits in the bag and in play. We will have spare tags sold separately in case something out of normal use destroys the tag.

Question: What about practice swings? How does the device deal with them?

Answer: The practice swings in the air will not be recorded. The ones with impact to either ball or the ground will be picked up by the wrist device. If you are used to taking practice swings that touch the ground, you have the option to record only one shot from one single location to the scorecard in the CaddieON app.

Question: Do you have to touch the wrist device with the tag before every swing?

Answer: To tell the system which club you are hitting with, you bring the club tag to close proximity of the tagging icon on the band of the wrist device. The wrist device vibrates to let you know that the club has been recognized.The application remembers the last club you have tagged, so if you don't switch clubs between shots there is no need to tag the club again (Although you can tag the same club again for as many times you like). Based on the feedback from our beta testers, we are implementing reminder functionality.

Your smartphone records the GPS position of each stroke, so you do not need to do any disturbing data
collection activities while taking a shot.
The game data is sent from your smartphone to a player portal on the internet.


During the game you can easily switch between the scorecard, stroke details, rangefinder and course map views in the CaddieON mobile application.

Automated and accurate real time data collection opens a whole new world to the game of golf. Players can use this data to improve. They can relive their golf highlights; they can share each experience from the course or compare their performance with friends and other players. It's not just the wrist device or the app - It's your personal caddie without yearly payments.

HELP US REVOLUTIONIZE YOUR GOLF
Our
work started over one and a half years ago with a firm belief that it can be
done. We are almost there – but now we need some help. We want to engage you,
your friends, your course and the whole golf community to elevate your golf
experiences to a new level. 
Here’s where we need your support.
MAP A COURSE

CaddieON golf course mapper

There
are about 40 000 golf courses throughout the world. In order to automatically
collect the statistics and help you play these courses, the course needs to be
mapped. We would like to start with your course! Unfortunately we just don’t
have the resources to do them all in a short time. You are the best expert to
be able to map your local course. Once you’ve done it, you can enjoy the
credits from your fellow golfers. Plus, receive a discount on your CaddieON wrist
device kit. Complete mapping of an 18-hole course takes about 3 hours’ work and
it is done with our golf course mapping tool. Check out the tool in mapper.caddieon.com. Use username demouser
with password demo to browse existing courses and try how the mapping is done.
We will open the mapper for drawing during January. 
MAKE A PLEDGE
You
can also help confirm that personal caddie is needed! Make a contribution that
allows us the opportunity to actually start the manufacturing of the CaddieON
wrist devices. Currently the wrist device supports Android but with your support, we
can finish our work and bring the iOS app and a wrist device to the market as
well.
GIVE FEEDBACK
Lastly,
help us provide more value for your game. We are now introducing the unique
CaddieON concept with automated data collection. Once the data is there, tons
of possibilities are available! Be one of the first ones to benefit from you
game data and tell us how we can serve your game better. 

ABOUT CADDIEON TEAM

CaddieON was founded in Finland 2012. We have a team of 10 with 5 founding partners working full time for the project. The team has combined over 100 years of experience in bringing consumer products to the global mobile market. On top of that, we can utilize our large network of contacts to bring the CaddieON to market. Our experience shows! We have developed this versatile CaddieON concept exceptionally fast and are going forward with full speed.
We are passionate about making technology work for you simply and easily. We already have fully functional prototypes and have beta tested the product on the golf courses around the globe. At the moment we are perfecting the mechanics of the wrist device and finalizing the software in the application and player portal. We have secured components availability for the first production batch. We hold the European type approval for the wrist device and we have patents pending for the CaddieON concept.

SPREAD THE WORD
Join
our efforts! Let your golfer friends know how they could enjoy their game even more. Help us spread the word of
the campaign and CaddieON by using the indiegogo share tools.


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS:
Question: Where can I see a list of the courses?
Answer: The courses currently mapped in the system can be checked from:
http://www.caddieon.com/product-information/course-list/
or by logging to http://mapper.caddieon.com
with username demouser and password demo.
Question: Can a user volunteer to map a course?
Answer: Definitely and we really value that! Log in to mapper and check that the course has not been mapped already and start working on it.
Question: What is the weight of the tags that attaches to the club? Is there a change in the clubhead swing weight?
Answer: Each tag weights about 1.2 grams (0.042 ounces) , so it is really nothing.
Question: Will the retraction/replacement of the clubs (ie shaft down in to the base of the golf bag) for each shot, present any dislodgement problems, or damaging 'wear and tear' for the tags?
Answer: The tag is molded inside the plastic, so they are durable enough to take the hits in the bag and in play. We will have spare tags sold separately in case something out of normal use destroys the tag.
Question: What about practice swings? How does the device deal with them?
Answer: The practice swings in the air will not be recorded. The ones with impact to either ball or the ground will be picked up by the wrist device. If you are used to taking practice swings that touch the ground, you have the option to record only one shot from one single location to the scorecard in the CaddieON app.
Question: Do you have to touch the wrist device with the tag before every swing?
Answer: To tell the system which club you are hitting with, you bring the club tag to close proximity of the tagging icon on the band of the wrist device. The wrist device vibrates to let you know that the club has been recognized.The application remembers the last club you have tagged, so if you don't switch clubs between shots there is no need to tag the club again (Although you can tag the same club again for as many times you like). Based on the feedback from our beta testers, we are implementing reminder functionality.

story:
Short Summary

Parma Pink Flamingos (PPF) is a girl's high school rugby team located in Parma, Ohio outside of Cleveland.  PPF is an area team that has existed since 2000 and is one of the oldest high school rugby teams in the area.  Parma's motto is "Birds of a Feather, Ruck Together".  This team is not just a sports team, it's a family.

This year Parma has been invited to apply to attend the DIII National Tournament which, in itself, is a $3000+ commitment.  Parma needs to rent 2 15-passenger vans and purchased 8 hotel rooms for 2 days.  Parma's current record is 3-1-1.

Parma is led by head coach Shannon Valenti and assistant coaches Lori Hyle, Kim Fuller, and Ugotchi Madubata.

What We Need & What You Get

Parma needs approximately $3000 for transportation and hotels for the national tournament.

All access money will be helpful for paying for other tournament fees (Ohio Classics, Rock n Roll 7's, etc.), added expenses on the trip,  and towards purchasing new equipment.

The Impact

$25 pays for 1 girl to spend a night at the hotel.

$100 pays for 1 hotel room.

$150 pays for 1 van for 1 day.

$450 pays for one tank of gas.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't send money, not a problem.  Please forward this on to anyone you think would be willing to support the team!

story:
My dad, Ron Garropy had a severe stroke on Sunday, Dec 16, 2012. My mom found him on the floor in front of the door at 8:30am, we have no idea how long he had been there.  He was awake but could barely speak and could not move his left side. She was terrified and called 911.  They rushed him to Update Medical where they quickly operated and removed 2 of the 3 clots in his brain.  He still has a small hemorrhage and swelling of the brain...so they transferred him to Neuro ICU for constant monitoring...

He is only 59 and was otherwise so healthy.  We are all still in shock and heartbroken to see my dad laying in a bed, with slurred speech, and no movement on his entire left side of his body.  He does know who we are and that he is in the hospital but is not aware of what happened and cant understand why he cant get out of the bed.  He is still sleeping most of every day.

His road to recovery will be very long and arduous, but he is one of the stongest and most determined people I know...so I am confident he will surprise us all once he wakes up and can really begin rehab. They say it will take years to recover as much as he physically and mentally can- but they dont know my dad! He was so full of life and has so much life left to live...

My parents did NOT have any health insurance, so scary.  My mom is left to care for my dad, work, and take care of the bills on her own. If you can, please help ease some of her financial burdens and worries so she can spend more time focusing on my dad and getting him healthy and rehabilitated.  Please share his story and this campaign with everyone you can. And most importantly, please remember my dad and my family in your prayers.  

My dad will probably be in the hospital in Syracuse for several weeks, if you would like to bring my mom a meal, magazines, snacks, etc while she is there, please call or text me and I will help you get them to her. 256-335-7664

From the bottom of my heart, thank you.

 

Amy

story:
Who We Are

Blanca's House is a non-profit organization of volunteer healthcare professionals who donate their time to provide free, invaluable medical treatment to children and their families. Whether through surgery, medical supplies, or educational outreach, Blanca's House provides twenty-first century medicine to the underprivileged. In addition, we have many projects underway. Since last year, we have been sponsoring children here on Long Island whose deformities were so severe that the necessary procedures would have been too extensive to be performed overseas. Across Long Island and around the world, Blanca's House brings healthcare to those who need it most. Inspired by childhood memories of his mother caring for friends and family, nurse anesthetist Galo Burbano, determined to use his training to bring medical care to underprivileged children in his native Ecuador. To best serve the poor and sick of that nation, Burbano founded Blanca’s House, named for his mother.

Kevin Rosero's Story


Objective

We are in the process of building a four operating room suite in Guayaquil, Ecuador. This past July we have accomplished the first phase, refurbishing the interior and exterior of the clinic.  Having now seen what this clinic will provide for the community and the endless possibilities it will present for other visiting non-profits, as well as reducing the travel time for Blanca’s House future missions, has motivated us and hopefully our supporters will continue to contribute until our dream becomes a reality. We are coordinating our first mission to our newly refurbished clinic in February 2014.  In conjunction with acupuncture therapists from Global Clinic we would like to expand our modalities of treatment. The pursuit of Global Clinic is to provide and maintain a sustainable network of integrative, holistic medical practices to populations with limited or no access to conventional healthcare. They fulfill this directive by hosting volunteer outreaches in which quality care is administered to communities in need.  International service efforts focus primarily on locations in developing countries, targeting Guatemala, Nepal, and India in particular. Global Clinic strives to provide treatments to those who lack access to healthcare and suffer from health issues that have remained unresolved or untreated by conventional platforms of medicine free of charge to each patient. Together, we will develop education outreach and training programs with local healthcare infrastructure and care providers, including nurses, herbalists, and traditional healers. It is important to establish a sustainable healthcare presence through local community organizations, leaders, hospitals, clinics, and health centers. We will counsel patients so they may adopt healthier ways of living and help them implement practical techniques of sustaining whole health. Creating an educational platform and environment for healthcare practitioners in addition to advancing their professional development via the open interchange of knowledge, skills, and practices created by the joint efforts of all local and international volunteers.

Global Clinic is operated by practitioners and supporters of holistic and integrative medicine. Modalities of treatment incorporated into our clinical approach include, but are not limited to:
• Acupuncture and traditional Chinese medicine
• Herbal Therapy
• Massage & Bodywork
• Yoga
• Tai Chi
• Reiki
• Chi gong
• Physical Therapy
• Nutritional Counseling
Our practitioners engage a tailored and composite approach to patient care by incorporating acupuncture alongside concurrent specialties.  In doing so, we believe our patients receive a greater chance at prolonged and effective healing, and increased success in achieving their individual health goals.


What is Acupuncture? Does it work?

Yes!  But not in the way Western medicine might explain.
Acupuncture’s history dates back several thousand years to ancient China.  It is based on the idea of Qi, also known as the vital force, or energy, of life.  Acupuncturists use very fine needles to stimulate the body’s Qi and restore proper balance and flow through channels we call meridians.

This ancient practice has long been proven to treat and cure many pain afflictions and disorders, including arthritis, diabetes, anxiety, and hypertension.  Its efficacy can be explained neither by the rational mind alone nor proven through the exclusive means of modern science.  By shoring up the body’s resources and innate abilities to combat imbalances, acupuncture is considered a natural and holistic form of healthcare.

The use of acupuncture has been gaining greater momentum within the modern medicine community.  The growing number of medical doctors who possess and are pursuing acupuncture licenses in order to supplement their abilities as care providers are testament to its proven benefits and value.
 
Education & Sustainability

We believe that education and empowerment go hand in hand and also in having open and collaborative communication amongst our practitioners.  Because our healthcare approach combines acupuncture with other specialties, our healers increase their own knowledge and application.  As a result, they may treat their patients at home more effectively and improve their own health.

The bigger picture here is creating an empowered and educated community that extends beyond the lines of language and latitude.  Through practical tips to sustain whole living and direct counsel and care to those in need, we contribute to a stronger, healthier individual, and therefore, stronger and more resilient local communities.  Working together on parochial and international levels we create a supportive network that is reinforced by the growth of all participants, which includes our partners, patients, and practitioners.

Sustainability is fundamental to our success. Everyday actions include reusing whenever possible, recycling all disposable and/or recyclable materials, conserving natural resources like water and gas, composting leftovers from staff and group meals, eliminating unnecessary waste from clinics, and creating a culture of preservation and appreciation that can continue to thrive after we leave.

To further the concept, we return to where we have served, creating an interweb of familiarity, connectivity, and most of all, reliability. By building lasting relationships with leaders and care providers within the local area, we create a larger community of healers in which education and empowerment can prosper, which is essential to our mission.

How you will help!

Donations directly fund our outreach efforts. They cover operational expenses such as trade tools and supplies, vehicular rental and fuel, utilities (i.e. electric and gas) and keep current all on-site licenses and permits. They also provide basic meals and local travel for volunteers, as well as salaries for local non-volunteers (including translators and drivers). Donations also help subsidize or fully cover nightly economy accommodations during outreaches, reconnaissance efforts for future missions, and maintenance costs for various projects, such as the herb garden in Antigua, Guatemala. Surplus is reserved for future initiatives, including plans to implement educational programs, externships, and permanent sustainability centers/health clinics. And last, but certainly not least, we donate to other like-minded charities, such as the Barbara Ford Peace Project and Going Global for Girls.


Please consider donating! There are always other ways to contribute!! Spread the word to family and friends through any social media platform ! 

Indiegogo share tools makes this a breeze!  

Feel free to also visit our websites for additional information, photos, blog and future missions around the world:

www.blancashouse.com

www.theglobalclinic.org

If you would like to donate on our website, as a note you MUST list the following: Valentines Day Mission 2014 Guayaquil. This mission's coordinators Peach, Priscilla and Ben would like to thank you in advance for taking the time to familiarize yourself with our efforts and welcome you to continue following us throughout our endeavors! Every child counts, every family matters.

story:
Abundance is the Truth and it is a Story that must be Told... 

The A-Bomb is Abundance.

         2800 calories per lbs. of handheld edible energy.

             Enough to feed 1 person for a day.

                              2800 cals

                                   X

                          200 lbs. per tree

                                    =

                                   560,000 calories.

(enough to feed 200 people for 1 day or 1 person for 6 months.)

         ...and that's just 1 tree...

                             We have hundreds of trees...

We’ve have made plants to take over the world. and Hollywood, the capital of popular storytelling is at the head of the hit list.

                                                  Tactic number one -   

                                   

We plan to plant a minimum of 101 trees by the end of 2013.

                    

 

 

                                         Tactic number two -

  

You know... like actors, authors and other important artists.

We aim to A-bomb these A-listers and raise the awareness of food forestry and abundance through their activism. 

In our pursuit, we may bomb a few Philosophers, Politicians, and Priests along the way. Even the general public. No one is protected from the the avocado avogeddon. :)

All footage of the A-bombing action will be available through social media.

Check out the A-Bomb Activist incentive to JOIN THE BOMBING ACTION>>> 

Tactic number three -

        

Food Forestry is our future of sustenance, and to prove it we will plants patches of Guac Gardens wherever we can. We will establish avocado and citrus trees as the foundation for food forests that thrive and align with natures design.

In our quest, we hope to find a bad Hass place to call Home. At our future headquarters and guac garden, we will create art, clothing, and our own brand of A-bomb grenade Guac to be sold through our Surlpus Store for future funding of the movement. From here, we will study Food Forestry and strategize our plans to spread our abundance culture to infinity and beyond.

                             TACTIC NUMBER FOUR!!!!

                      GUACAMOLE FOOD CART

Everyone loves guac. Help us fund our guac cart for future sustainabilty of the movement.

                     

Here is where you come in.

Now we are growing that good green, and its worth its weight in gold, but we need the public to provide the paper so we can pack up plenty of provisions. 

We do forsee a future where more food is free, where what grows itself is seen as a gift from God and the good earth with no monetary value required to receive.

Until then, the Almighty Dollar regrettably remains the Green Giant, and to get this thing going, 

well.. we may need a few G's.

All proceeds will provide plants to people, publicity of the movement, and preparations for the next phase of the mission.

 So, whats it take to light the fuse on this world changing a-bomb?

 14,400 dollars in 40 days

 Holy guacamole thats a lot of green...

...well not really, if enough of us band together.

Spread the message. Share the word. You are already a part of the movement, and we thank you soldier.

As our special thank you, you will receive A-Bomb brand attire from the Surplus Store.

This bomb is gonna be a block buster, and its all about branding baby. The more we rep, the more we reap. 

                                       There really is enough for everyone.

These Concepts may be a little hard to wrap your head around right now, but with your help in executing our mission and spreading our message, Abundance Agriculture will lead to a

   Food-For-All

                      ...Free-For-All.

                                            ...avogeddon is upon us...

We’ve got a lot of ground to cover.... Literally.

But today we start.

Together we win.

Big trees come from small seeds.

And We have made plants to take over the world.

This is start of a symphony in three movements. 

Spread Abundance, Share Surplus, Cease Scarcity... 

      This is only the beginning...

 The Future is in our Hands...

coming soon... SHARE SURPLUS>>>

We’ve have made plants to take over the world. and Hollywood, the capital of popular storytelling is at the head of the hit list.
                                                  Tactic number one -   
                                   
We plan to plant a minimum of 101 trees by the end of 2013.
                    

 
 
                                         Tactic number two -
  
You know... like actors, authors and other important artists.
We aim to A-bomb these A-listers and raise the awareness of food forestry and abundance through their activism. 
In our pursuit, we may bomb a few Philosophers, Politicians, and Priests along the way. Even the general public. No one is protected from the the avocado avogeddon. :)
All footage of the A-bombing action will be available through social media.
Check out the A-Bomb Activist incentive to JOIN THE BOMBING ACTION>>> 
Tactic number three -
        
Food Forestry is our future of sustenance, and to prove it we will plants patches of Guac Gardens wherever we can. We will establish avocado and citrus trees as the foundation for food forests that thrive and align with natures design.
In our quest, we hope to find a bad Hass place to call Home. At our future headquarters and guac garden, we will create art, clothing, and our own brand of A-bomb grenade Guac to be sold through our Surlpus Store for future funding of the movement. From here, we will study Food Forestry and strategize our plans to spread our abundance culture to infinity and beyond.
                             TACTIC NUMBER FOUR!!!!
                      GUACAMOLE FOOD CART
Everyone loves guac. Help us fund our guac cart for future sustainabilty of the movement.
                     
Here is where you come in.
Now we are growing that good green, and its worth its weight in gold, but we need the public to provide the paper so we can pack up plenty of provisions. 
We do forsee a future where more food is free, where what grows itself is seen as a gift from God and the good earth with no monetary value required to receive.
Until then, the Almighty Dollar regrettably remains the Green Giant, and to get this thing going, 
well.. we may need a few G's.
All proceeds will provide plants to people, publicity of the movement, and preparations for the next phase of the mission.
 So, whats it take to light the fuse on this world changing a-bomb?
 14,400 dollars in 40 days
 Holy guacamole thats a lot of green...
...well not really, if enough of us band together.
Spread the message. Share the word. You are already a part of the movement, and we thank you soldier.
As our special thank you, you will receive A-Bomb brand attire from the Surplus Store.

This bomb is gonna be a block buster, and its all about branding baby. The more we rep, the more we reap. 
                                       There really is enough for everyone.
These Concepts may be a little hard to wrap your head around right now, but with your help in executing our mission and spreading our message, Abundance Agriculture will lead to a
   Food-For-All
                      ...Free-For-All.
                                            ...avogeddon is upon us...
We’ve got a lot of ground to cover.... Literally.
But today we start.
Together we win.
Big trees come from small seeds.
And We have made plants to take over the world.
This is start of a symphony in three movements. 
Spread Abundance, Share Surplus, Cease Scarcity... 
      This is only the beginning...
 The Future is in our Hands...
coming soon... SHARE SURPLUS>>>

story:
Skinny Kosher Creations LLC is based out of Woodstock, New York. Our ownership team has over 13 years of senior management experience within the weight loss industry. When you throw in that we are entrepreneurial, energetic and focused, you have an awesome foundation! Add this to our lineup of amazing products (with more coming!) in an industry that is absolutely booming, and you have, what we believe, is a recipe for great success!

How it Began:

Several years ago, our company president, Brenda Laredo and her family were driving to Disney World. Along the way, Brenda was struck by the fact that there were virtually no food options that were kosher and gluten-free. Rather than complain about it, Brenda conceptualized an array of products. Shelf stable prepared meals, desserts, wine and of course, energy bars. By the following spring, we had developed the first version of our products and we were selling out at every farmer’s market that we attended! Along the way, we listened intently to feedback from our customers. By doing so, we realized that the vegan and lactose intolerant markets were also under-served.

Fast forward to last November and the Skinny Kosher Creations team had a booth at Kosher-Fest, the world’s largest kosher certified products trade show. At Kosher-Fest, we were able to show off our kosher, gluten-free, nut free, vegan and lactose intolerant products. We were ecstatic to find that we were a huge hit and voted as one of the best new products at the show! To top it off, we were written up in multiple publications, including the Huffington Post!

As mentioned, we are cooking up many ideas that will bring about many new flavors. For our launch into the big leagues, we are excited to launch three delicious energy bars! · Choco Chip Coco ‘Tini · Choco Chip Mint ‘Tini · Choco Chip Orange ‘Tini 

We are striving to become the “game-changers” in the weight loss / energy bars industry! Our bars are nut, dairy and gluten free. We’re certified kosher, our packaging is awesome, and the taste is shockingly good! All this wrapped in a mere 130 calories!

  If we are going to be game-changers however, we’re going to need your help. We’ve already invested tens of thousands of dollars into our dream, and we need a collective push to get us over the edge! Costs for R&D, packaging and more have really upped the costs. Most importantly, a larger than expected initial interest from several distributors that will put our products in hundreds of stores have us scrambling to keep up! 

 

We wish to thank everyone ahead of time for having taken the time to look at our project, and investing in us.

Helping make our dreams come true mean more than you know :-) This would be life changing for us and our families to make our hard work, endless nights , passion and vision a reality! While many energy bars are simply chocolate bars remarketed as a healthy one, our goal is to provide you with the healthiest ,weight concious bar on the market. From funding to sharing the buzz about our products..Every little bit help!,

Again..ONE MILLION THANK YOU'S!!!

BIO

All 3 partners, Brenda, Chloe & Mike come from a corporate background. Fate brought them into the weight loss industry and over a decade later they have never looked back.

Having worked with children and adults and being part of a process that helped them change their lives was nothing short of magical. It was then that they realized that this was an industry that would forever bond them.

After years of working with the public in this field while raising their own families, they realized that there were certain areas that were lacking when on the hunt for food for their own children as well as themselves. 
"Being a vegetarian, kosher and healthy made it difficult for me to find delicious, nutritious options for myself" said co-owner Brenda Laredo. "Fast forward a few years where I soon discovered that I had developed a gluten intolerance which made finding food on the go quite challenging. Sure, I could cook things from scratch, but when you are working full time and raising a family, there were times...many times where I just needed convenient and healthy options.

When on the go, I looked for healthy energy bars to curb my hunger. If anyone has ever been to the energy bar section at their local grocer or health food store, you know how easy it is to become overwhelmed. There are high protein bars, with really high carbs, or bars with consistency of rice crispies and little flavor. You can also find bars that are great for weightlifters, or chocolate bars which are simply remarketed as an energy bar. There are tasty bars filled with Gluten, or Gluten free bars high in sugar and sodium.

Nowhere was I able to find a bar that was kosher, dairy, gluten and nut free that satisfied my hunger, was low in calories and sodium, which were good sources of protein and fiber and still delivered everything I needed. All of this while being YUMMY! By identifying that this market was under-served, Skinny Kosher Creations was born". The three of us set out to formulate weight management bars and shelf stable meals that were perfect for those looking for a delicious, healthier alternative which were natural, vegan, high protein, on the go products with different size protein and portion sizes for both our male and female line. We sold out everywhere we went. With little competition in this booming industry, we feel that we have created a line that will change the way people look at healthy weight loss food and to easily have access to convenient products on the go. Our deal was to never create products that we would not feel honest and proud to make. Products that we would happily feed to our own children".

Brenda and Patrick have been married for 22 years and raising two incredible sons aged 19 & 17. Chloe is always busy helping to develop new Skinny Kosher Creations product lines and raising her beautiful, energetic rescue puppy Dexter. Mike and his wife Tina have been married for 5 years and have an incredibly beautiful daughter Jaime who suffers from food allergies and thankfully LOVES our bars.

story:
Joshim stands next to the Padma River. 

     When I visited Bangladesh in 2008, after finishing emergency medical education and graduating from high school, I was hanging with my friends one afternoon at a local bazar drinking tea where I witnessed Joshim getting hit by a motorized rikshaw.

     I immediately rushed to Joshim as he fainted from the pain and fear and I came to realize there is no ground ambulance system in Bangladesh, a service that I had never needed before.  His dad and I took him to the government run hospital by rikhaw.  There, I recognized the horrible medical conditions that were being provided when I witnessed abandoned ambulances in front of the hospital and a decrepit and decaying structure. When we went inside, we were not able to  distinguish the medical staff from the patients and families. The most impoverished citizens of the region had to bring their own pillows, sheets, and bedding and were lying in rows on the floor.

   This medical treatment was a big shock to me after 3 months working as an EMT in Reno.  To get to adequate medical care, the people have go Dhaka by way of the Padma River, the third widest in the world. This 7 to 8 hour trek is fatal to over 70% of the injured in case of emergencies.  I had always taken the American medical system for granted, and seeing these terrible hospital conditions in my home country incited me to action. I could not just stand by after that experience and do nothing to help these people.

   From research I found that in the Shariatpur District, there is only 1 doctor to every 12,843 people in the area. That is a total of approx. 90 doctors to serve a population of about 1.2 million.  In order to help these people and give them medical care they needed, we had to build a network of nonprofit hospitals that could provide the impoverish free medical care of the high quality available. Thus came the idea and conception of Duwell Medical, the first modern quality charitable hospital in the region. Duwell Medical’s construction begun in 2010 in Naria Upzila of Shariatpur District to break the barrier between modern healthcare and developing countries. Now the hospital is almost done, but the glass is the last thing that we need help funding. With your help, we can continue our work to save lives in Bangladesh.

Brief History of Bangladesh

     Bangladesh is a new developing nation with many unique situations. It is the world’s most densely populated country one of the world’s worst medical complications. Government is not doing enough to take care of the nearly 165 million people in the state size of Wisconsin. Despite growing economy, lack of medical infrastructure is one of the biggest dilemma for the citizens.

What projects has Duwell Medical done?

Polio Vaccination:

    • Started the program in June 2012 by working with the government of Bangladesh. Main site for Naria Upzila was placed inside Duwell Medical facility.

    • 2,000 kids received vaccinations

       

Health Education:

  • Held once a month to educate the school and local kids in the area about health education. We believe education is one of the best medicine. The topic we cover is:

    • hygiene

    • anti-tobacco

    • emergency preparation

General Check-Up

    • Bi-weekly program offering general check up to the family and the kids. Normal turn around of patients is 150-200. Consulted by Medical Doctors.

      Click Here to See Youtube Video

       

What are we going to do?

With a vision of a world where everyone has access to adequate healthcare,Duwell Medical’s mission is to improve the healthcare condition worldwide. Duwell Medical is an organization that has been in existence for over the past three years, and is based out of Reno, Nevada.

        • For now, the organization’s primary focus is on the healthcare crisis in Bangladesh.

        • However Duwell Medical is making impact in the Reno, NV area by hosting awareness and health fair with future plan of opening diagnostic center in Reno.

                 

$16k-Aluminium structure on the building. 

$10k-Exterior Glass.

$2k-Transportation of labors from Dhaka to Shariatpur Distrct and machines.

$1.5k-Four full time labors contracted to install the aluminium and glass panels.

$2k-Administration cost to pay for operational cost to pay for utility and bills and office space.

$2.5k-Although Indiegogo gives us better rate for being a non-profit campaign, we will have to pay Indiegogo fees.    

From 2010 the construction of Duwell Medical in Bangladesh has been privately funded by the Khan family. Upon being a project of We Care About Kids Nevada A Non-profit Corporation, Duwell Medical is now of a non-profit chartiable organiztion, allowing us to seek support. 

Frequently Asked Question (FAQ)

How does Duwell Medical find doctors? 

In our list we more 60 docotors that can be used anytime with general check-up and other programs we host. In the future, we will have full time doctors hired and retained by Duwell Medical. There is already housing for the doctors to provide. Doctors will be hired from India, Bangladesh, and the USA. 

How will the hospital sustain itself? 

Sustainability is one of the bigggest focus in our business model. We will sustain ourself through donations, grants, sponsorship, and charge. Improvershed families will get free treatment based on their living condition. In field workers will do analysis by vising their house. Middler class and upper class families will pay a base price. There actions will be required to keep the hospital up and running and expansion. 

 

Other Ways You Can HELP

If you cannot financially contribute, you can still help, you can do that by spreading the campaign. Please take your time to encourage others to make contribution.

The more you share, the more opportunity you are giving to the impoverished souls.

story:
I'm Ryan, a health policy researcher in the UK, and I'm raising funds to purchase and send urgently needed medical supplies to JFK Medical Center in Monrovia, Liberia, where the current outbreak of the Ebola virus is causing grave harm to society and strain to the health care system.

The situation

JFK treats patients from across Liberia and West Africa and has been seeing Ebola victims alongside other area hospitals.  Unfortunately, the basic equipment used for infection control and to protect health workers is running out.  Tragically, the Chief Medical Officer and a physician's assistant at the hospital have already died and more health workers are at risk.

The ask

The chief executive of JFK, Dr Scott-McDonald has provided a list of essential supplies which are needed urgently to sustain the effort and minimize risk to health workers.  These include gloves, aprons, sanitizer, and more.  I have been in touch with her and she is glad to accept donations of any size.

The donation

I would like to use your donation to put together several boxes of supplies and send them via DHL in the next week.  Each such box costs approximately $400-500 to fill and send.

The impact

This short-term effort has the aim of bolstering the resources available to identify, treat, and care for victims of Ebola while protecting a tremendously important resource: health workers.  JFK Medical Center is a critical part of the Liberian healthcare system and it is needed at its best now.

story:
Here’s My Story

I have always been a writer… a poet… a spoken word artist… a novelist. However, it is my belief that a true artist has the ability to exercise their artistry in several genres because its an exercise of the same part of the brain. .

Growing up in the bayous of Louisana, I was a tomboy - enjoying the outdoors, climbing trees, experiencing nature. I have always been drawn to wood. The smell…the feel… In looking for an outlet for my hands, I rediscovered wood. I bought a wood-burning tool just to try my hand. I fell in love. I started out burning cigar boxes – turning them into trinket boxes, jewelry boxes and purses. I was gifting them to family and friends when I discovered that I was creating something on which people actually WANTED to spend their money. Those same friends and family wanted to gift them to their friends and family. And Diligent Hands grew beyond any measure than i could imagine for a hobby....

I even had the blessed fortune of teaching my craft to teen girls in 2006 through the City of Atlanta’s ArtsCool summer program. Gradually, I started to evolve the types of product that I produced eventually concentrating almost exclusively on purses and accessories by 2009.

The response was unbelievable. And before I knew it I was being invited to vend at events around Atlanta.  The demand for my purses and accessories lead to the opening of my online store. Before I knew it, I was shipping earrings all of the country and as far as London and Dubai! I was even showcased on SoulTrain.com as one of the TOP 5 URBAN INDIE JEWELRY DESIGNERS in June 2012.

My line's growth can be attributed almost soley to word-of-mouth and social networking. I would like to expand my market to reach a demographic that has shown an genuine interest inn my line. The 15th Annual World Natural Hair Health and Beauty Show presents me with the ABSOLUTE best opportunity to do so...

 

My Inspiration

“Accessories that make a statement… because you ARE what you wear.”

I have never been a girly girl… a woman who accessorizes. I am a wife with no wedding ring. My necklace is a tattoo of a necklace that my mother gave me before she transitioned. It reads “FAITH HOPE LOVE”.

I am not a brand whore. I buy what speaks to me and what speaks for me. I believe that every part of your life contributes to your life statement. My accessories help to make that statement. Each item is designed to speak your truth. 

The Evolution of Adornment

Custom jewelry is where art and fashion meet. Anyone can walk into a store, purchase a commercial piece of jewelry and most certainly find contentment with it. A number of my customers enjoy the option of designing their pieces and having them made to their specifications because that piece becomes a true reflection of the person. I have had my customers tell me that my pieces have power. My belief is that it is the intention that they feel. I start a piece with a purpose. I work a piece with an intention. If it says “FLY” on the back, I am pouring “FLY” energy into it the entire time I am working it. A custom piece has a higher purpose. It is the evolution of adornment.

I love the challenge of bringing my customer’s ideas to life in a way that satisfies their need for expression. I feel like I am the translator,
articulating a very intimate message for my customers.

Why Handcrafted?

I find that men, just like women, want their accessories to say something more intimate about them. My interactions with my customers show me that we are moving beyond the place of shining up and showing off our exteriors to a place of shining up and showing off our interiors – what we think… how we feel…where we stand. That weighs more than which label we’re wearing.

Because we all have something to say... The car you drive, the clothes your wear, the style of your hair, and the way you adorn yourself all come together to complete your picture. What is your life statement and are you a full-bodied representation of it? If not, you too should be ROCKING DILIGENT HANDS ACCESSORIES!

My Situation

But I am a one-woman operation... I manage production, promotion, sales, shipping, and customer service solely. I am performing a constant balancing act to produce a quality handcrafted product for both my retail and wholesale customers.  However, my love for my craft and demand for my product is my motivating factor.

Although my business has grown exponentially over the years, it has not grown to the point that an $800 vending fee is a drop in the bucket. It is actually closer to a seismic splash. I have had to bypass several large vending opportunities because the funds wwere just not available. As opposed to letting an opportunity like the 15th Annual World Natural Hair Health and Beauty Show pass by, I am reaching out...

Your contributions will: 

  • Pay for the $850 EXHIBITOR FEE
  • Purchase $150 worth of supplies for production specifically for this event 

 

Why It’s Important

Every time a Natural Hair event comes to Atlanta, I am asked if Diligent Hands Wooden Purses and Accessories is going to be on site... I want to be able to say that I will be at the 15th Annual World Natural Hair Health and Beauty Show this fall. I want an opportunity to present Diligent Hands Wooden Purses and Accessories to the very group of women that have been demanding it.

I am ready to answer that demand... I am ready to grow. And the market is supporting that growth, as well: 940 fans on FaceBook, over 1,000 hits to my site each month, several wholesale customers across the country...

In order to continue to grow this business at a steadily increasing pace, I need to expose my product (physically not just through the internet) to the marketplace.

  

Just In Case

I know that nothing is promised. Although, I have complete faith that my project will reach its funding goal, I have worked out some alternative. I am always prepared with altenative vending opportunities that are of a smaller scale. Any monies contributed will still go toward reaching my ultimate goal: exposing my product - physically getting it im front of the very audience of people who are seeking it.

  

Other Ways You Can Help.

I understand that it is not always easy to help… even when you want to. So, I am asking if you can’t contribute (and take advantage of my wonderful perks) please pass it along to your family and friends… I will appreciate it… And I guarantee they will as well! Thank you!
story_txt:
Here’s My Story
I have always been a writer… a poet… a spoken word artist… a novelist. However, it is my belief that a true artist has the ability to exercise their artistry in several genres because its an exercise of the same part of the brain. .
Growing up in the bayous of Louisana, I was a tomboy - enjoying the outdoors, climbing trees, experiencing nature. I have always been drawn to wood. The smell…the feel… In looking for an outlet for my hands, I rediscovered wood. I bought a wood-burning tool just to try my hand. I fell in love. I started out burning cigar boxes – turning them into trinket boxes, jewelry boxes and purses. I was gifting them to family and friends when I discovered that I was creating something on which people actually WANTED to spend their money. Those same friends and family wanted to gift them to their friends and family. And Diligent Hands grew beyond any measure than i could imagine for a hobby....
I even had the blessed fortune of teaching my craft to teen girls in 2006 through the City of Atlanta’s ArtsCool summer program. Gradually, I started to evolve the types of product that I produced eventually concentrating almost exclusively on purses and accessories by 2009.
The response was unbelievable. And before I knew it I was being invited to vend at events around Atlanta.  The demand for my purses and accessories lead to the opening of my online store. Before I knew it, I was shipping earrings all of the country and as far as London and Dubai! I was even showcased on SoulTrain.com as one of the TOP 5 URBAN INDIE JEWELRY DESIGNERS in June 2012.
My line's growth can be attributed almost soley to word-of-mouth and social networking. I would like to expand my market to reach a demographic that has shown an genuine interest inn my line. The 15th Annual World Natural Hair Health and Beauty Show presents me with the ABSOLUTE best opportunity to do so...
 
My Inspiration
“Accessories that make a statement… because you ARE what you wear.”
I have never been a girly girl… a woman who accessorizes. I am a wife with no wedding ring. My necklace is a tattoo of a necklace that my mother gave me before she transitioned. It reads “FAITH HOPE LOVE”.
I am not a brand whore. I buy what speaks to me and what speaks for me. I believe that every part of your life contributes to your life statement. My accessories help to make that statement. Each item is designed to speak your truth. 
The Evolution of Adornment
Custom jewelry is where art and fashion meet. Anyone can walk into a store, purchase a commercial piece of jewelry and most certainly find contentment with it. A number of my customers enjoy the option of designing their pieces and having them made to their specifications because that piece becomes a true reflection of the person. I have had my customers tell me that my pieces have power. My belief is that it is the intention that they feel. I start a piece with a purpose. I work a piece with an intention. If it says “FLY” on the back, I am pouring “FLY” energy into it the entire time I am working it. A custom piece has a higher purpose. It is the evolution of adornment.
I love the challenge of bringing my customer’s ideas to life in a way that satisfies their need for expression. I feel like I am the translator,articulating a very intimate message for my customers.
Why Handcrafted?
I find that men, just like women, want their accessories to say something more intimate about them. My interactions with my customers show me that we are moving beyond the place of shining up and showing off our exteriors to a place of shining up and showing off our interiors – what we think… how we feel…where we stand. That weighs more than which label we’re wearing.
Because we all have something to say... The car you drive, the clothes your wear, the style of your hair, and the way you adorn yourself all come together to complete your picture. What is your life statement and are you a full-bodied representation of it? If not, you too should be ROCKING DILIGENT HANDS ACCESSORIES!
My Situation
But I am a one-woman operation... I manage production, promotion, sales, shipping, and customer service solely. I am performing a constant balancing act to produce a quality handcrafted product for both my retail and wholesale customers.  However, my love for my craft and demand for my product is my motivating factor.
Although my business has grown exponentially over the years, it has not grown to the point that an $800 vending fee is a drop in the bucket. It is actually closer to a seismic splash. I have had to bypass several large vending opportunities because the funds wwere just not available. As opposed to letting an opportunity like the 15th Annual World Natural Hair Health and Beauty Show pass by, I am reaching out...
Your contributions will: 

Pay for the $850 EXHIBITOR FEE
Purchase $150 worth of supplies for production specifically for this event

Every time a Natural Hair event comes to Atlanta, I am asked if Diligent Hands Wooden Purses and Accessories is going to be on site... I want to be able to say that I will be at the 15th Annual World Natural Hair Health and Beauty Show this fall. I want an opportunity to present Diligent Hands Wooden Purses and Accessories to the very group of women that have been demanding it.

Any monies contributed will still go toward reaching my ultimate goal: exposing my product - physically getting it im front of the very audience of people who are seeking it.

story:
Stay perfectly hydrated all day long, sporting an effortless style and elegance that will encourage you to reach for a refreshing splash of delicious water whenever you are thirsty.

  •  Health in Mind: Drink with confidence. Do good for your body and the planet by staying hydrated with a reusable water bottle. With a reusable water bottle, it’s easier to drink more water and improve your overall health!
  •  Carry Your Bottle Wherever You Go: Hashy's hand-crafted leather makes it easier to hold your water bottle by hand. They would be the perfect water bottle accessory for your active, on-the-go lifestyle.
  •  Durable and Strong Leather Accessories: Water-resistant & classic saddle brown leather accessories ages naturally and beautifully. 
  •  

 

     

    Hashy's leakproof design lets you reliably transport your drink without worry of drinks or spills.

     

     

     

     

     

    Fashionable Organic Leather Carrying Strap

    Over the shoulder. Across the chest. Behind the back.

    However you want to carry the Hashy Bottle with you, our high quality leather strap makes it extremely comfortable and convenient to do so.

    The best part? The designer strap fits perfectly with the vintage look of the bottle to make the Hashy Bottle as much of a fashion accessory as an eco-friendly way to drink!

    The Bottle Wrap and Shoulder strap are made of regular oil pulll-up leather.

    We know you’re on the move, which is why we created a leather strapthat makes it easy to hold this bottle with just one hand, anywhere, anytime. 

     

     

     

    Hello, We are the 8Cups team. At 8Cups, we solve dehydration problems. By solving inconviences in drinking water, we help you become healthier. Two years ago, we brought an innovative smart water bottle to the world, and many users have praised us for being the first innovators in this market. We have helped many people to become healthier through this product. Now, we decided to challenge to make such product to help many people drink water in more convenient way. That product is Hashy Bottle. 

     

     

     

     

    FAQ 1. 

     

    FAQ 2.

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

    Hashy bottle just finished tooling and pre-production. The results were awesome, and our beta-testers love each and every one of the Hashy Bottles. We have manufactured 500+ units at the industry-leading factory, getting ready for mass-production after the crowdfunding campaign.

    We want to help you stay hydrated all day long whether you are at a gym or at the airport en route to Hawaii. You will love a Hashy Bottle as much as we love every sip out of it. Thank You

story:
Our Story

Hi, I'm Suzi Rayve.  Our Dad, Wes (Bud) Henley, was diagnosed with Parkinsons and it is severe.  He is a retired junior high school teacher who gave his all to the kids in Montana for over 30 years and loved it.  He and Mom are living in an assisted living home in Santa Maria, CA.  Unfortunately, dementia is also lurking and in order to keep the shadows away we would like to get them an Apple Imac.  Why an Apple?  Long ago, Dad had the first Apple computer ever available and knows nothing else.  He had a MacEzine and a Mac user group when I was young.  You can still read about it if you google "Bud at Big Sky Mac".

 

The Impact

 He and Mom would be able to Skype his kids and grandkids and great grandkids on the Imac.  They would be able to watch nature cameras all over the world and escape their pain and fear by visiting people and places they can no longer go physically. In short, the stimulation would keep both their brains sharp and hopefully inspire them in many ways.  I fear that if they don't get this, their mental health and stability will fail rapidly.  Dad was a highly intelligent and complex individual and to have that intelligence stolen from him by Parkinsons dementia would be devasating.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $2,000.  The Imac 21 inch goes for anywhere from $1,200. to $1,500.   The remainder would be to get it all set up, pay for Wifi so they can get on line, etc. If we don't reach our goal of $2,000., what we do get will be put into a savings account so we can add to it bit by bit until we can afford to get them the Imac.  

I have to say, the perks we are offering are fun and entertaining.  Dad taught science and was always about science!   So, the fact that his daughters are into psychic readings and tarot cards and will be using these as perks to get him the Apple that will hopefully keep him sane is wildly ironic!  We pray he will be able to understand and laugh at the irony when we tell him.  There is so little laughter in his life right now.  As perks I am offering my unique psychic gifts (handed down to us by Mom, more irony) for remote psychic readings and my sister Lori reads the Tarot.  Whether you believe in them or not isn't the idea, the idea is to have fun and enjoy!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this and spread the word.  An Apple for the teacher who really needs it!

story:
Edith's Story

Edith Garcia is a 31 year old single mother of four lovely children; two beautiful girls Kayla (14) and Brendaly (10); and the energetic boys E.J (6) and Rudy (3). Edith is known for her charismatic, caring, and trusting personality. She greeted everyone with a big smile and was forever willing to help anyone in need. Edith always has a positive effect on people; so much so that she would brighten up peopleâ€™s days with her charismatic smile. On September 2011 she moved to El Paso TX from Lubbock to be closer to her extended family. Edith, along with her young children, was ready for a new start after an unsuccessful marriage.


Unfortunately, as she was ready for a new beginning for her family and a happy start to a new year, Edith was involved in a car accident the evening of January 9th. She was on her way to pick up her children when she lost control of the vehicle; crashing into a utility pole. She suffered severe head trauma and her mandible was broken in several places.  As of January 22 she still remains in a coma and unresponsive.


Family and friends are sadly devastated; particularly her children and her elderly parents Velia and Agapito Gallegos. They all miss her so much and are praying for her recovery.


The Impact

At the moment, Edithâ€™s extensive family will care for her four children.  Edith has a long road ahead and will require a lot of care once she is discharged from the hospital. Money donated will be used to pay for expenses related to future medical bills, in-home care, and her four children. She did not have any type of insurance at the time of the accident but has since qualified for state help. We are still unsure of the financial impact on the family since it is too soon to tell.


What We Need & What You Get

Family and friends are trying their best to ensure that her kids are safe and well taken care of; but unfortunately, they will need additional economic help from the kindness of others to cover Edithâ€™s future expenses. Remember, every little thing helps so donâ€™t refrain from donating even $1. This will ensure that Edith will have all her basic needs meet. Your donation will be much appreciated by Edith's children; Kayla, Brendaly, EJ and Rudy. For each donation we will send you a thank you note, so don't forget to provide your mailing address!


Other Ways You Can Help

Pray for her recovery! We believe in the power of prayer in numbers, so tell friends, co-workers, and family about Edith's story. If you are in a situation where you can't donate then pray for Edith Gallegos Garcia instead!

story:
THANK YOU, we are AMAZED by all the support. 

BUT WE ARE NOT DONE YET! The more we raise and are able to meet our stretch goals, the more we will be able to help patients in need!

We have now unlocked several new stretch goals:


The Band is a functional armband that’s protective, comfortable and fashionable for patients living with and receiving treatment through PICC lines.

Undergoing Long-Term Medical Treatment Sucks.  We are out to make treatment easier, more comfortable and fashionable.

Care + Wear's mission is to improve the quality of life of patients undergoing long-term medical treatments.

Founded in the Spring of 2014 by three friends affected by the burden of cancer treatment, Care + Wear aspires to develop products today with the ultimate goal of creating a better tomorrow. 

Care + Wear has partnered with the American Cancer Society, the Tyler Robinson Foundation, F Cancer and Leukemia & Lymphoma Society.  We donate a portion of profits from all C+W products to these partners which focus on research, treatment and care for cancer patients and their families.   

                   

Our first product, the Band, is a functional arm band that is protective, comfortable and fashionable for patients living with and receiving treatment through PICC lines.  PICC lines (Peripherally Inserted Central Catheters) are used to administer long-term intravenous medications like chemotherapy, IV antibiotics, and TPN nutrition.



Over 6 million PICC lines are inserted globally each year and that number continues to rise.  Let’s help make their lives more comfortable.

Patients living with PICC lines face major risks and challenges:

-Infection

·  Constructed of an antimicrobial fabric and a mesh window for breathability (patent pending), the Band enables the flow of oxygen to the dressing while helping to decrease the amount of moisture around the insertion site. The antimicrobial treatment re-generates as it is being washed and prevents infection on the Band. 


-Catheter migration/malposition

·  The Band’s stretchy fabric provides a snug - but not too tight - fit on the arm, keeping the PICC line and its components in place.

-Significant re-insertion costs

·  The Band covers the entire PICC line site and its dressing, protecting the line from movement.  This reduces the chances that the PICC line will need to be re-inserted at an additional cost.

Extreme discomfort:

·  The Band secures the PICC line site and protects stitch placement reducing both physical or emotional discomfort.

The Band comes in a variety of colors and prints to blend in with the arm or serve as a practical but fashionable treatment accessory.

With your donation, you can help us manufacture and distribute the first Bands to hospitals and patients. Donate and share this campaign if you are passionate about helping patients living with PICC lines. Together we can make their lives easier.

Buy a Band. Support a Cause. 


-The Care + Wear Team

story:
Living with Chronic Kidney disease


Hi my name is Doug Melendez, i am 38 years old. I am happy, easy going guy. 

Just living my life to best i can. I was diagnosed with Chronic kidney disease in 2011. 

I am just here to see if i could raise some money to help me and my family with some expenses.  

When i found out about my disease my life came to stand by. 

My dad is willing to donate one of his kidneys for me. I really never asked him for it, but he willingly said he would do it for me. 

I just want to raise a bit of money to help myself and family with bills and other expenses. 

Since i am no longer working im living with my Dad and Grandma now. 

This  money would be mean a lot to my family, and would help to relieve some of the stress my family and myself are facing. 

Ive never been a guy to ask for anything. I am the kind of guy that thinks is better to give than to receive.  So i would like to raise the money to give to my family, to help them deal with financial troubles. 

Ive never been in this situation before, and its hard for me to ask for money. 

I am just looking to raise 500 dollars. It might not be alot to some, but for me its a lot, and i would mean soo much to me and and my family

 God bless

 Thank  you 

Doug  Melendez

 Twitter : Spanisheyes604 

Facebook: douglasm@hotmail.ca

I was diagnosed with Chronic kidney disease in 2011. I am just here to see if i could raise some money to help me and my family with some expenses.  When i found out about my disease my life came to stand by. My dad is willing to donate one of his kidneys for me. I really never asked him for it, but he willingly said he would do it for me. I just want to raise a bit of money to help myself and family with bills and other expenses. Since i am no longer working im living with my Dad and Grandma now. This  money would be mean a lot to my family, and would help to relieve some of the stress my family and myself are facing. Ive never been a guy to ask for anything. I am the kind of guy that thinks is better to give than to receive.  So i would like to raise the money to give to my family, to help them deal with financial troubles. Ive never been in this situation before, and its hard for me to ask for money. I am just looking to raise 500 dollars. It might not be alot to some, but for me its a lot, and i would mean soo much to me and and my family God bless Thank  you Doug  Melendez Twitter : Spanisheyes604 Facebook: douglasm@hotmail.ca

story:
Short version:

In a nutshell, my husband Charles served in the U.S. Navy during Desert Shield/Desert Storm and also assisted in Hurricane Andrew Cleanup. Due to his experiences, he has been diagnosed with severe PTSD, which causes high levels of stress and anxiety, a feeling of being in danger or on high alert, nightmares and other psychologically crippling symptoms which restrict him from performing certain daily tasks and attending social functions with family and friends. It has been proven that specially trained service dogs can help people with PTSD break the cycle and snap out of symptoms, which allows them to live a more normal life.

Long version:

Before my husband signed up to join the Navy in 1989, he lived a normal active life. He lettered in track and basketball, was starting goalie for his high school soccer team and played football for several years. He ran or biked five miles a day and was always on the lookout for something to do outside.

While he was in the Navy from 1989 to 1992, Desert Storm and Desert Shield happened, along with a few pretty nasty hurricanes that hit the East Coast and Florida. While he was doing a training excercise, he stretched and twisted his right knee to the point where it would have been better if he had broken all the bones instead. During his recovery, he helped out where he could including being at the air station to help unload bodies coming home from the Gulf War, and assisting in Hurricane Andrew cleanup (body retrieval). At the time it happened, he didn’t feel the effects because it was all part of what they did as sailors – protect and assist the nation in any way possible. As he was in recovery, an order was signed to release people in medical hold and he was given an honorable medical discharge for his service.

Since being out, he has tried to fit back into society as best he can, but bouts of anger, mood swings, nightmares and even flashbacks of seeing bodies have haunted him. It was not until the last few years that it was recognized as possible PTSD, and very recently when it was confirmed and he was given the diagnosis.

While he’s been going through therapy, I found out about groups starting to use dogs trained to assist soldiers and sailors dealing with PTSD. The dogs are aware of when anxiety levels rise, heartbeats start to race, and when blackouts and nightmares happen, and they nudge the person back to reality. By forcing the person to focus on the dog, not how they are feeling, it helps the person calm back down at home, while driving, at the store, at work... wherever. The dogs can also perform other tasks such as watching the person’s back, making sure the personal space boundaries are adequate and providing comfort to ease anxiety. And thanks to the recent changes in the Americans with Disabilities Act, federal law now allows people with PTSD to take their dog with them practically everywhere (except surgery and obvious locations like that).

What he needs:

Charles has done research and found the breed of PTSD service dog he thinks would work best for him (taking his size into consideration) – the Shiloh Shepherd.

Shiloh Shepherds are extremely intelligent, good-natured and powerful enough to nudge Charles and get his attention. He actually knows a breeder locally through a paint club he attends as weekly stress relief therapy, and they have matched up service dogs to people in need before. They are planning out their next litter of pups and will only charge breeding costs.

He needs help coming up with the cost of the PTSD service dog and training.

  • The breeding costs are around $1500
  • Training will be around $1000
  • Time off work without pay to attent training

If he gets more than he needs, he plans on “paying it forward” and donate the remainder toward helping other veterans get service dogs as well.
