story:
Intro

Welcome to the GlucoseWizard.com campaign. Timeline:

03/23/2015-03/30/2015 Clara had t1d debut
04/01/2015-06/23/2015 In record time, with 100% dedication, hard work and long hours the service first version is online. Financed from my own pocket. It's not smokeware, is a real product totally usable for diabetes users and for remote healthcare by clinics, totally free of charge. Already translated to English and Spanish.
24/06/2015-12/31/2015 Exhausted my own resources, I begin the crowdfunding campaign.
Diabetic community can install from google play and test the system and spread the word, individual doctors, clinics and health systems can begin using for remote healthcare of their patients and contribute to this effort.
SEE BELOW GOALS: Secure and redimension online servers, contract a team to finish development and give multilingual support.
01/01/2016- The project continues, auto financing his maintenance from ads and sponsorships

My name is Rogelio Triviño. I'm a mathematician and freelance software developer for more than 23 years. Months ago, my daughter Clara had her diabetic (t1d) debut. Today we launch the first version of the mobile and web app and the cloud service associated.

We operate under the strict Spanish data protection law and the UE laws. Our app servers are located on Sweden for data privacy as main reason. We are experts on internet security and our servers security and privacy is a key point on our proposal. We will use our financial resources to secure HIPAA compliance ASAP.

Medical data is always private, users share only with their doctors and family, giving them access trough their settings. We use medical data to predict glucose trends on other users, but in a totally anonymous way. 

GOALS: 

We have choose flexible financing to continue with the project using the available resources on this order:

1) Secure online servers and dimension to the user base.

2) Deploy the app on Apple App Store and other app markets.

3) Improve charts for a better healthcare for users and doctors.

4) Interface with glucometers, CGMs and insulin pumps for automatic data entry (a la diasend).

5) Finish development with alerts, messages and social network for mutual support, remote healthcare, recipes exchange, etc.

6) Use the medical data anonymously to create a glucose level prediction system.

7) Create a good online support system, manuals, social networks, etc.

8) Comply with all requisites for data protection (HIPPA compliant) and registered medical product (FDA and EU), and all the legal stuff.

9) Translate to other languages.

10) Improve the client app for speed.

11) Create a digestion cycle game for kids understand the insulin-glucose balance.


To reach these objectives we need 90,000 USD on this first crowdfunding effort. Then we want to maintain the service online with sponsors and ads. Please spread the word so diabetics can use the system and contribute the crowdfunding.

We monitor the donors language. With 1000 USD associated to a language, this become first priority. With 5000 USD on this language, support on that language become first priority.

If you represent a business or organization related to diabetes, please consider to become our sponsor for one year with a 5000 USD contribution. If you represent a health system or payer group and need a system like ours to remote healthcare of your diabetes population, please contact us.

Please stay in touch with developers on our google+ site or ask questions on twitter. We support English and Spanish already.

Impact

Your contribution can make our FREE service a reality, serving #diabeticmillions for an improved healthcare and quality of life worldwide, lowering healthcare costs and improving services offered.

If you can't contribute economically, please spread the word so more people can reach the service and media feature and support us. Involve your community and follow us on your social networks.

Risks and Challenges

There are similar developments going on, their business model is charge for the product to health systems and payer groups, with a lot of venture money on the table. We want to finance ourselves with this campaign, sponsorships and maybe ads. We don't have investors and we don't want millionaire returns for us, so we require a lot less financing, reached with your help.

They prioritize the design and ios deployment. We prioritize the accessibility from ANY device, with ANY internet connection, our service is worldwide from day one.


ESPAÑOL

Bienvenido a la campaña de GlucoseWizard.com. Calendario:

03/23/2015-03/30/2015 Clara tiene debut diabético tipo 1
04/01/2015-06/23/2015 En tiempo record, con dedicación exclusiva, trabajo duro y largas horas la primera versión del servicio está online. Financiada de mi propio bolsillo. No es humo, es un producto real totalmente usable por diabéticos y por clínicas para gestión remota, totalmente gratuito. Traducido ya a español e inglés.
24/06/2015-12/31/2015 Agotados mis propios recursos, comienzo la campaña de crowdfunding. 
La comunidad diabética puede instalar de google play y probar el sistema y correr la voz, doctores individuales, clínicas y sistemas de salud pueden empezar a usarla para cuidado remoto de sus pacientes y contribuir económicamente al éxito de esta campaña.
VER OBJETIVOS ABAJO: Securizar y redimensionar servidores, contratar un equipo para acabar desarrollo y dar soporte multilingüe.
01/01/2016- El proyecto continua, autofinanciándose de publicidad y patrocinadores.


Mi nombre es Rogelio Triviño. Soy matemático y desarrollador de software independiente desde hace más de 23 años. Hace unos meses, mi hija Clara tuvo su debut diabético (tipo 1). Hoy lanzamos la primera versión de la app móvil y web y el servicio web asociado.

Operamos bajo la estricta ley de protección de datos española y las leyes de la Unión Europea. Nuestros servidores de aplicación se encuentran en Suecia principalmente por privacidad de datos. Somos expertos en seguridad en internet y la seguridad y privacidad de nuestros servidores es un punto clave de nuestra propuesta. Usaremos nuestros recursos financieros para cumplir con la HIPAA americada lo antes posible.

Los datos médicos son siempre privados, los usuarios los comparten desde su configuración con sus médicos y familiares. Usamos datos médicos para predecir las curvas de glucosa de otros usuarios, pero siempre de forma totalmente anónima. 

OBJETIVOS: 

Hemos elegido financiación flexible para continuar con el proyecto usando los recursos disponibles en el siguiente orden de prioridad:

1) Securizar servidores y dimensionarlos a la base de usuarios.

2) Publicar la  app en Apple App Store y otros markets.

3) Mejorar los gráficos para un mejor cuidado por parte de usuarios y doctores.

4) Entrada automática de datos desde glucómetros, sistemas de medición continua y bombas de insulina (como diasend).

5) Concluir desarrollo con alertas, mensajes y red social para intercambio de apoyo, cuidado remoto, intercambio de recetas, etc.

6) Usar datos médicos anónimamente para crear sistema de predicción de niveles de glucosa.

7) Crear un buen sistema de soporte, tutoriales, redes sociales, etc.

8) Cumplimentar requisitos para protección de datos (HIPPA compliant) y certificación de producto sanitario (FDA y UE), y todos los requisitos legales.

9) Traducir a otros idiomas.

10) Mejorar la velocidad del cliente.

11) Crear un juego del ciclo de la digestión para que los niños entiendan el equilibrio insulina-glucosa.

Para alcanzar estos objetivos necesitamos 90.000 USD en este primer esfuerzo de financiación. Luego queremos mantener el servicio online con patrocinios y publicidad. Por favor difunda la campaña para que los diabéticos puedan usar el servicio y contribuir a la financiación.

Estaremos atentos al idioma de nuestros donantes. Con 1000 USD en un determinado lenguaje, este deviene prioridad 1 de traducción, con 5000 USD, prioridad 1 de soporte.

Por favor contacte con los desarrolladores en nuestro sitio google+ o pregúntenos en twitter. Atendemos inglés y español por el momento.

Impacto

Su contribución puede hacer realidad nuestro servicio GRATUITO, sirviendo a #diabeticmillions en todo el mundo para una mejor calidad de vida y cuidado de su salud, reduciendo costes sanitarios y mejorando la atención médica.

Si no puede contribuir económicamente, por favor corra la voz para que más gente pueda conocer nuestro servicio, y los medios puedan hablar de nosotros y respaldarnos. Involucre a su comunidad y síganos en las sus redes sociales.

Riesgos y desafíos

Hay proyectos parecidos en marcha, cuyo modelo de negocio es cobrar a los sistemas de salud y aseguradoras, con mucho capital riesgo involucrado. Nosotros nos proponemos financiarnos solo con donativos, patrocinios y publicidad si fuera necesario. No tenemos inversores ni pretendemos beneficios millonarios para nosotros, así que requerimos mucha menos financiación, que alcanzaremos con vuestra ayuda.

Ellos priman el diseño y su despliegue en ios. Nosotros primamos la accesibilidad desde cualquier dispositivo, con cualquier conexión a intenet, nuestro ámbito de servicio es mundial desde el primer día.
story_txt:
Intro Welcome to the GlucoseWizard.com campaign. Timeline:



03/23/2015-03/30/2015
Clara had t1d debut


04/01/2015-06/23/2015
In record time, with 100% dedication, hard work and long hours the service first version is online. Financed from my own pocket. It's not smokeware, is a real product totally usable for diabetes users and for remote healthcare by clinics, totally free of charge. Already translated to English and Spanish.


24/06/2015-12/31/2015
Exhausted my own resources, I begin the crowdfunding campaign. Diabetic community can install from google play and test the system and spread the word, individual doctors, clinics and health systems can begin using for remote healthcare of their patients and contribute to this effort.SEE BELOW GOALS: Secure and redimension online servers, contract a team to finish development and give multilingual support.


01/01/2016-
The project continues, auto financing his maintenance from ads and sponsorships



My name is Rogelio Triviño. I'm a mathematician and freelance software developer for more than 23 years. Months ago, my daughter Clara had her diabetic (t1d) debut. Today we launch the first version of the mobile and web app and the cloud service associated.
We operate under the strict Spanish data protection law and the UE laws. Our app servers are located on Sweden for data privacy as main reason. We are experts on internet security and our servers security and privacy is a key point on our proposal. We will use our financial resources to secure HIPAA compliance ASAP.
Medical data is always private, users share only with their doctors and family, giving them access trough their settings. We use medical data to predict glucose trends on other users, but in a totally anonymous way. 
GOALS: 
We have choose flexible financing to continue with the project using the available resources on this order:
1) Secure online servers and dimension to the user base.
2) Deploy the app on Apple App Store and other app markets.
3) Improve charts for a better healthcare for users and doctors.
4) Interface with glucometers, CGMs and insulin pumps for automatic data entry (a la diasend).

5) Finish development with alerts, messages and social network for mutual support, remote healthcare, recipes exchange, etc.6) Use the medical data anonymously to create a glucose level prediction system.
7) Create a good online support system, manuals, social networks, etc.
8) Comply with all requisites for data protection (HIPPA compliant) and registered medical product (FDA and EU), and all the legal stuff.
9) Translate to other languages.
10) Improve the client app for speed.
11) Create a digestion cycle game for kids understand the insulin-glucose balance.



To reach these
objectives we need 90,000 USD on this first crowdfunding effort. Then
we want to maintain the service online with sponsors and ads. Please
spread the word so diabetics can use the system and contribute the
crowdfunding.
We monitor the donors language. With 1000 USD associated to a language, this become first priority. With 5000 USD on this language, support on that language become first priority.
If you represent a business or organization related to diabetes, please consider to become our sponsor for one year with a 5000 USD contribution. If you represent a health system or payer group and need a system like ours to remote healthcare of your diabetes population, please contact us.
Please stay in touch
with developers on our google+ site or ask
questions on twitter. We support English and Spanish already.
Impact
Your contribution can make our FREE service a reality, serving #diabeticmillions for an improved healthcare and quality of life worldwide, lowering healthcare costs and improving services offered.
If you can't contribute economically, please spread the word so more people can reach the service and media feature and support us. Involve your community and follow us on your social networks.
Risks and Challenges
There are similar developments going on, their business model is charge for the product to health systems and payer groups, with a lot of venture money on the table. We want to finance ourselves with this campaign, sponsorships and maybe ads. We don't have investors and we don't want millionaire returns for us, so we require a lot less financing, reached with your help.
They prioritize the design and ios deployment. We prioritize the accessibility from ANY device, with ANY internet connection, our service is worldwide from day one.





ESPAÑOL

Bienvenido a la campaña de GlucoseWizard.com. Calendario:


03/23/2015-03/30/2015
Clara tiene debut diabético tipo 1


04/01/2015-06/23/2015
En tiempo record, con dedicación exclusiva, trabajo duro y largas horas la primera versión del servicio está online. Financiada de mi propio bolsillo. No es humo, es un producto real totalmente usable por diabéticos y por clínicas para gestión remota, totalmente gratuito. Traducido ya a español e inglés.


24/06/2015-12/31/2015
Agotados mis propios recursos, comienzo la campaña de crowdfunding. La comunidad diabética puede instalar de google play y probar el sistema y correr la voz, doctores individuales, clínicas y sistemas de salud pueden empezar a usarla para cuidado remoto de sus pacientes y contribuir económicamente al éxito de esta campaña.VER OBJETIVOS ABAJO: Securizar y redimensionar servidores, contratar un equipo para acabar desarrollo y dar soporte multilingüe.


01/01/2016-
El proyecto continua, autofinanciándose de publicidad y patrocinadores.



Mi nombre es Rogelio Triviño. Soy matemático y desarrollador de software independiente desde hace más de 23 años. Hace unos meses, mi hija Clara tuvo su debut diabético (tipo 1). Hoy lanzamos la primera versión de la app móvil y web y el servicio web asociado.
Operamos bajo la estricta ley de protección de datos española y las leyes de la Unión Europea. Nuestros servidores de aplicación se encuentran en Suecia principalmente por privacidad de datos. Somos expertos en seguridad en internet y la seguridad y privacidad de nuestros servidores es un punto clave de nuestra propuesta. Usaremos nuestros recursos financieros para cumplir con la HIPAA americada lo antes posible.
Los datos médicos son siempre privados, los usuarios los comparten desde su configuración con sus médicos y familiares. Usamos datos médicos para predecir las curvas de glucosa de otros usuarios, pero siempre de forma totalmente anónima. 

OBJETIVOS: 
Hemos elegido financiación flexible para continuar con el proyecto usando los recursos disponibles en el siguiente orden de prioridad:
1) Securizar servidores y dimensionarlos a la base de usuarios.
2) Publicar la  app en Apple App Store y otros markets.
3) Mejorar los gráficos para un mejor cuidado por parte de usuarios y doctores.
4) Entrada automática de datos desde glucómetros, sistemas de medición continua y bombas de insulina (como diasend).
5) Concluir desarrollo con alertas, mensajes y red social para intercambio de apoyo, cuidado remoto, intercambio de recetas, etc.6) Usar datos médicos anónimamente para crear sistema de predicción de niveles de glucosa.7) Crear un buen sistema de soporte, tutoriales, redes sociales, etc.
8) Cumplimentar requisitos para protección de datos (HIPPA compliant) y certificación de producto sanitario (FDA y UE), y todos los requisitos legales.
9) Traducir a otros idiomas.
10) Mejorar la velocidad del cliente.
11) Crear un juego del ciclo de la digestión para que los niños entiendan el equilibrio insulina-glucosa.
Para alcanzar estos
objetivos necesitamos 90.000 USD en este primer esfuerzo de
financiación. Luego queremos mantener el servicio online con
patrocinios y publicidad. Por favor difunda la campaña para que los
diabéticos puedan usar el servicio y contribuir a la financiación.
Estaremos atentos al idioma de nuestros donantes. Con 1000 USD en un determinado lenguaje, este deviene prioridad 1 de traducción, con 5000 USD, prioridad 1 de soporte.
Por favor contacte
con los desarrolladores en nuestro sitio google+ o pregúntenos
en twitter. Atendemos inglés y español por el momento.
Impacto
Su contribución puede hacer realidad nuestro servicio GRATUITO, sirviendo a #diabeticmillions en todo el mundo para una mejor calidad de vida y cuidado de su salud, reduciendo costes sanitarios y mejorando la atención médica.
Si no puede contribuir económicamente, por favor corra la voz para que más gente pueda conocer nuestro servicio, y los medios puedan hablar de nosotros y respaldarnos. Involucre a su comunidad y síganos en las sus redes sociales.

    Riesgos y desafíos

Hay proyectos parecidos en marcha, cuyo modelo de negocio es cobrar a los sistemas de salud y aseguradoras, con mucho capital riesgo involucrado. Nosotros nos proponemos financiarnos solo con donativos, patrocinios y publicidad si fuera necesario. No tenemos inversores ni pretendemos beneficios millonarios para nosotros, así que requerimos mucha menos financiación, que alcanzaremos con vuestra ayuda.Ellos priman el diseño y su despliegue en ios. Nosotros primamos la accesibilidad desde cualquier dispositivo, con cualquier conexión a intenet, nuestro ámbito de servicio es mundial desde el primer día.

story:
Heart Transplant

My name is Gustav Trenwith and I am an online developer. A very dear friend of mine, with a heart for people, has recently found out that his father requires a heart transplant, and I want to help him raise the funds to save his dad.

He is currently on the waiting list to receive a heart and it can happen at any time that the phone may ring to go to the hospital. The transplant must happen in Cape Town and after that he must remain in Cape Town for 4 months for the after care. For him and his wife to be able to get to Cape Town four hours after the phone call they need to fly there. For the four months that they have to stay there and all the cost involved in having a smooth transplant process they will need $ 5000. We believe that every little bit will make a big contribution.

For him and his wife to be able to get to Cape Town four hours after the phone call they need to fly there. For the four months that they have to stay there and all the cost involved in having a smooth transplant process they will need $ 5000. We believe that every little bit will make a big contribution.

story:
EzeeBat - Where did the idea come from?

Peter and Fiona are husband and wife founders of EzeeSport & EzeeSquash. Whilst not coaching or playing competitive squash, Peter offers his unique EzeeSquash product, which is endorsed by England Squash & Racquetball to schools. This consists of a structured squash programme played with paddle bats, which do not have handles. 

During the first 6 months of using paddle bats, Peter noticed a few flaws in the products he was using, these included children finding the paddle too heavy (300g), bearing in mind he uses a 135g adult squash racket, the adjustable straps were not secure enough resulting in the paddle flying off the child’s hand and the cost to purchase these paddles was high and came with quiet large minimum orders.

This got Peter thinking and so he researched all the paddles available on the market including a few from France & Canada.

These also had flaws in them including: children experiencing irritated skin after use, the length of one was too short resulting in the child's wrist bending (floppy wrist syndrome), the adjustable straps were not flexible enough and again these units were also just too expensive.

Peter was left with only one solution and that was to design and manufacture his own paddle.

The research started in September 2011 and with the help of a squash playing colleague and engineer Paul Brameld he started researching and planning the design of what he hoped to be a fool proof, professional and affordable paddle, The EzeeBat.

The British Department Trade & Industry offered Peter great support in approving some initial funding (£1500) to help cover some of the CAD drawing costs. They have also suggested that when the time comes to want to export this product, they could assist by providing use of British Embassy offices around the world as meeting points for potential buyers.

Fiona's uncle Rob Clark in Australia was visiting us in the UK round about this time and he as engineer has CAD Drawing facilities at his work in Melbourne, he very kindly drafted the first CAD drawing and prototype of what Peter was looking for.

We then took his work and asked a company in Leicestershire - 3Di (Michael Lannie) - to officially draw up the CAD Drawings for the EzeeBat.

Peter then put out to tender with 4 companies the manufacture and tooling for the bat as well as for the plastic molding of the outer surfaces of the EzeeBat.

Fortunately I  found a  company also in Leicestershire (one of the few owned by a lady) Michelle Cooper from JSB Plastics.

They also do molding for The Body Shop and some of the major supermarkets. She has AJ Tooling literally 50 yards from her company and they do all the tooling for her. Not only was her quotation competitive but because of her experience working with The Body Shop she has also offered to do bar coding, assembly and packaging of the EzeeBat.

Peter’s aim is to fully manufacture this product on British soil and therefore use the "Made in Britain" logo on the packaging.

The smallest (tennis) racket on the market is 17" in length. The EzeeBat will be 8.5" in length and once a child's little hand is inside the Ezeebat the following will be achieved:

  • There is no handle therefore distance to ball when making contact is minimal
  • The EzeeBat has specifically been designed so that the bat is light weight, comfortable and affordable
  • Children from as young as two years old can use the EzeeBat 
  • Children can start by hitting balloons and then they can progress to hitting a training ball attached to string and stick (watch this space as product is due to also be launched in 2014 to compliment the EzeeBat)
  • It is double sided, so children are encouraged to learn forehand and backhand strokes
  • Paddles extend over the wrist, which encourages a proper swing and avoids "floppy wrist syndrome"
  • Can be played in multiple environments:

    • In the school playground or hall
    • At the park or on the beach
    • In the lounge or back garden at home
    • On a tennis court, squash court or against a wall
  • An inclusive activity allowing children with disabilities to enjoy a positive play experience
  • The next step on the “pathway of progression” is learning the correct grip on a racquet handle 
  • EzeeBat is the perfect tool for the development of proper hand eye coordination, crossing the mid line, spacial awareness, directionality and many other essential developmental skills. 

To date there is very little available at grass roots level in terms of equipment to develop racquet skills for children 2-6 years. Peter has put in a great deal of time and effort in to investigating what the real needs are  to develop racquet sport skills at an early age. It is his dream that the Ezeebat will fill the gap in racquet development to not only create more future champions but more racquet sport players in general, globally!

Peter is using the industry leading crowd-funding platform, Indiegogo to raise money to get the first production of the EzeeBat to the retail consumer. As much global support to launch EzeeBat is needed as possible.

He would also like to give away an Ezeebat at cost for every bat sold. How? He doesn’t know yet but he would love to donate Ezeebats to the poorest of the poor nations so that everyone in the world can enjoy them.

Peter thanks you in advance for your support and looks forward to sending you a Limited Edition Ezeebat 'or 20' in thanks for your commitment to sports development for children.

story:
[ENG]

Campaign authors

Closer to winter holidays, "Oastea Fiară" - supporters of Zimbru Chișinău, together with group "Faptă Nu Vorbă" from Nisporeni, organized some social activities at Vărzărești monastery, at Rehabilitation Centre for Children and Orphanage from Tighina and also helped some old people. During these activities we found out about Dumitru, that was working at a sheepfold in Nisporeni.

Dumitru Calinin Alexandru

The boy was born in February 1990 in Grigoriopol, Moldova. Currently he has no ID, so no medical insurance. His parents divorced, after this his father died and no news about this older brothers. He lived at an orphanage, then was working in different villages. A sheepfold owner gave him a house to live and a job. One day he got shot in the abdomen. He was treated in Nisporeni hospital, but he needed a more difficult surgery in Chisinau. He returned home and his situation got worse. His girlfriend left him. He was sometimes feeded by an old neighbour. With local authorities's help, he was urgently brought to hospital. 

Now he needs a surgery to replace a piece of bone that his body does not recognize. It will be replaced with a metal part. Also his large intestine was hardly destoyed after the accident and can not be rebuilt. There also has to be solved the problem with fecal elimination.

The amount need for surgery is around 2000-3000$. Next week we will find out the final amount to be paid for the surgery. Currently we gathered 150$ for Dumitru to be hospitalized.

You can donate any amount you want paying by PayPal or credit card. Every cent counts.

For any other info you can email us at: helpdumitru@gmail.com

Let's save a life!

OF & FnV


[ROM]

Inițiatorii campaniei

 În ajunul sărbătorilor de iarnă, Oastea Fiară - grupul organizat de suporteri al echipei Zimbru Chișinău, împreună cu grupul de acțiune Faptă Nu Vorbă din orașul Nisporeni, au organizat câteva acțiuni sociale la mănăstirea Vărzărești, la Centrul de reabilitare pentru Copii și Casa de copii din Tighina și în câteva gospodării ale bătrânilor. În cadrul acestor acțiuni s-a aflat despre cazul lui Dumitru, care lucra la o stână din Nisporeni.

Dumitru Calinin Alexandru

Băiatul s-a născut în februarie 1990 în raionul Grigoriopol. La moment acest nu are nici un act de identitate, respectiv nici poliță de asigurare medicală. Părinții au divorțat, tatăl a decedat, frații nu se cunoaște unde sunt. A stat la internat, apoi a lucrat prin alte sate cu ziua, până a ajuns să lucreze la o stână și locuia într-o casă a stăpânului stânei. Dupa ce a suferit un accident, fiind împușcat în burtă, concubina la părăsit. A fost tratat la spitalul din Nisporeni, dar este nevoie de o operație mai complexă la Chișinău. Noi l-am găsit într-o stare critică, fiind uneori hrănit de o bătrânică vecină. Cu ajutorul autorităților locale a fost internat de urgență unde a primit îngrijire medicală. 

Este nevoie de o operație pentru a fi înlocuită o parte de os cu o bucată de metal, fiindcă bucata de os e percepută de organism ca corp străin și nu e alimentată corespunzător. La fel intestinul gros a fost secționat grav și nu poate fi refăcut. Print-o fisură creată se va rezolva problema cu eliminarea maselor fecale.

Suma preliminară pentru intervenția chirurgicală este de 2000-3000 dolari. În următoarele zile vom afla de la medic mai exact. Cu eforturile proprii au fost adunați în jur de 150 dolari pentru spitalizarea lui Dumitru. 

Puteți dona prin intermediul acestei campanii orice suma dorită cu achitarea prin PayPal sau prin card bancar.

Puteți transmite sume de bani contactând telefonic pe Alex (+37369308663) sau Adrian.

Pentru orice altă solicatare: helpdumitru@gmail.com

Să salvăm o viață!

Crăciun fericit!

OF & FnV

story:
Nicholas J. Melillo was a vibrant, active, loving, kind man who grew up very
lonely, losing his mother when he was 12 years old.  He joined the army when
he was 20 years old earning the rank of Staff Sergeant and fought in the
Korean war.  He met and married his wife Melina in 1974 and lived a peaceful
life as a maintenance man in the Port Chester school system until he
retired.  In 2007 he was diagnosed with Dementia/Alzheimer's.  He was
bedridden in 2011 after suffering 2 strokes which led to seizures that have
left him paralyzed from the neck down.  He now lays in his bed unable to
function and totally reliant on Melina.  

Melina Melillo grew up the oldest of 8 children, who at a very young age was
responsible for taking care of whatever sibling needed help.  She is a good
Christian woman and has been a loving wife to Nicholas for over 40 years.
Melina did not want her husband to go into a nursing home so she decided to
try and keep him home as long as possible.  



In the beginning, Melina received aid from the Veterans and Hospice.  Due to
the longevity of his disease, the benefits ran out for Nicholas and Melina
was left to take care of him on her own with minimal help from aids.  Melina
is now 91 years old and frail due to the years of taking care of Nicholas.
She recently fracture her hand and is now in a cast which further limits her
ability to care for her husband.  She needs help desperately and cannot even
drive herself to the doctor and food store, she has to hire someone to do
that for her.  She has severely depleted her funds and has exhausted all
avenues of supplemented care.

Please consider helping this decorated veteran and his 91 year old wife who
does not want to put her husband into a nursing home but would like him to
spend his last days at home.

Your help is so greatly appreciated.

$85,000 will pay for the salary of two aids to help Melina care for Nick until he decides not to fight the good fight for God and Country. The VA averages $40k per year for an aid at 10 hours per week.  Melina has been offered two private aids for twice the time and half the salary for the next two and a half years although she has already exhausted her savings due to Nicholas' condition.  

Any monies received over the funding request will go the Parkinson's and Alzheimer's research. Thank you so much for your consideration.

Please pass this along.
story_txt:
Nicholas J. Melillo was a vibrant, active, loving, kind man who grew up verylonely, losing his mother when he was 12 years old.  He joined the army whenhe was 20 years old earning the rank of Staff Sergeant and fought in theKorean war.  He met and married his wife Melina in 1974 and lived a peacefullife as a maintenance man in the Port Chester school system until heretired.  In 2007 he was diagnosed with Dementia/Alzheimer's.  He wasbedridden in 2011 after suffering 2 strokes which led to seizures that haveleft him paralyzed from the neck down.  He now lays in his bed unable tofunction and totally reliant on Melina.  Melina Melillo grew up the oldest of 8 children, who at a very young age wasresponsible for taking care of whatever sibling needed help.  She is a goodChristian woman and has been a loving wife to Nicholas for over 40 years.Melina did not want her husband to go into a nursing home so she decided totry and keep him home as long as possible.  
In the beginning, Melina received aid from the Veterans and Hospice.  Due tothe longevity of his disease, the benefits ran out for Nicholas and Melinawas left to take care of him on her own with minimal help from aids.  Melinais now 91 years old and frail due to the years of taking care of Nicholas.She recently fracture her hand and is now in a cast which further limits herability to care for her husband.  She needs help desperately and cannot evendrive herself to the doctor and food store, she has to hire someone to dothat for her.  She has severely depleted her funds and has exhausted allavenues of supplemented care.Please consider helping this decorated veteran and his 91 year old wife whodoes not want to put her husband into a nursing home but would like him tospend his last days at home.Your help is so greatly appreciated.$85,000 will pay for the salary of two aids to help Melina care for Nick until he decides not to fight the good fight for God and Country. The VA averages $40k per year for an aid at 10 hours per week.  Melina has been offered two private aids for twice the time and half the salary for the next two and a half years although she has already exhausted her savings due to Nicholas' condition.  Any monies received over the funding request will go the Parkinson's and Alzheimer's research. Thank you so much for your consideration.Please pass this along.

story:
Pam's Journey

Pam Jojnowicz is a 20 -year old young woman from Winnipeg, Manitoba. She's incredibly caring, smart and loves making her friends laugh. Her lifelong dream is to help as many people as she can. 

Four years ago, Pam began having difficulty walking and started having intense migraines. Eventually, her legs gave out and she was unable to walk for more than a few feet. Her poor health forced her to drop out of university. After being diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis in 2010, Pam's family and friends raised money for the Liberation Treatment for MS in Katowice, Poland. When she got to Poland, she and her family were heartbroken to find out she wasn't eligible for the Liberation Treatment. 

Soon, her health deteriorated even further - intense head pressure, neuropathic pain, stomach pain, insomnia and even loss of vision in her right eye are just some of the symptoms - and she still could barely walk. As time went on, her family did more research into MS and began questioning whether or not MS was the correct diagnosis.  Pam started to wonder if she had Lyme Disease.

-Lyme Disease is caused by a bacterial infection that people can get from the bite of an infected blacklegged (deer) tick. Southern Manitoba has the highest population of blacklegged ticks in the world. It's VERY common for it to go undiagnosed or  be misdiagnosed as MS. For people like Pam, this means going through endless treatments, spending thousands of dollars and suffering day and night as the disease progresses.- (http://www.gov.mb.ca/health/lyme/)


For a long time, every doctor Pam went to in Winnipeg refused to test her for Lyme Disease. MS and Lyme Disease have very similar symptoms; it's crucial to properly diagnose early on. They insisted she had MS, going so far as prescribing her steroids, twice. This forced Pam to start looking for answers and a cure abroad. 


In Spring 2013, Pam went to the Living Foods Institute in Atlanta with her mom in search of answers. There she met a woman with almost identical symptoms - and she had Lyme Disease. This further confirmed Pam's suspicions about her diagnosis. When she was tested in Canada for Lyme Disease, her tests came back both positive and negative. These results were extremely discouraging and confusing.  Pam and her family were forced to look for answers abroad once again. In the Summer of 2013, Pam went to the a Lyme Disease specialist, Dr Piotr Kurkiewicz, in Warsaw Poland. The specialist tested her twice, just to be sure.

Both tests came back positive. Three trips abroad, years of suffering, dealing with doctors who wouldn't confirm -or even test for- Lyme, and thousands of dollars later, it was official. Pam has Lyme Disease that's been progressing for years. 

Testing for Lyme disease in Manitoba is completely unreliable. This doesn't make sense because it's a common disease that's deadly when it goes untreated. Overseas, Lyme Disease is less common and treated with great urgency, unlike here in Canada. Although she is now on antibiotics from Poland, they are not working. Pam is truly on the brink of death. If she's not treated soon, chances are she won't see her 21st birthday.

Treatment

We are raising money to pay for a treatment to save Pam's life. The Sponaugle Wellness Institute in Florida offers treatment for Lyme Disease in its advanced stages.  It offers one-on-one treatment for people whose organs are all but destroyed by Lyme Disease.

The treatment is incredibly costly, averaging at over 3000 USD per week. The illness is so advanced, she will need stay at Sponaugle for at least 3 months. Her family will also have to pay for any additional testing she requires.

Your Help

 You can save Pam's life by donating. The Jojnowicz family is in great need of help, any donation will help. The treatment will save the life of a beloved daughter, sister, aunt and friend. Help Pam get her life back!


http://sponauglewellness.com/wellness-programs/lyme-disease/lyme-treatment-protocol/

story:
CAN WE MAKE IT TO $5,000?!?

The goal of $1,000 was reached this week - a true testament of the love for this AWESOME family.  There is still more that we can do. There will be gas to buy to transport Mary back and forth from Rochester.  There will be specialized supplements and alternative treatments that are not covered by insurance. (Mary has Medicare and a supplemental insurance, thankfully) Unfortunately the fight against cancer, regardless of insurance, is expensive. Sid, Beth and Marc will inevitably miss work to care for her and to spend as many precious moments together as possible. 

Because I know that the Batemans would never ask for anything from anyone, WE can do that for them. They have enough to worry about. So, lets band together in love and support to help as much as we can. The goal on the page cannot be updated. My hope is that you will help by spreading the word about Mary's journey, giving what you can, and most importantly, by praying. TOGETHER WE WILL BEAT THIS!

story:
Sadly “ACL Race Series Engine Bearing Company” announced the Sale of ACL Race Engine Bearings due to financial troubles and miss management.

We are determent to try to save this company from closure as these are the best Engine Bearings money can buy and known worldwide for their toughness and quality.

ACL Race Series Bearings:

High performance driving demands that you use the best parts. So rely on ACL's Race Series Products to perform to the exacting race standards you expect. They provide the dependability it takes to hold up under higher RPM conditions. The unique combination of design, metallurgy and engineering come together to deliver what drivers expect from high performance parts.

ACL CORPORATE INFORMATION History

ACL traces its past to 1922 when Geoff Russell began manufacturing engine parts for Australia's emerging automotive industry. This business became the foundation for Repco Ltd.
The famous 'Repco Brabham'

The ACL Group started as a management buyout company when it acquired a group of businesses from Repco Ltd in 1986. The name "Automotive Components Limited" and the Trade mark "ACL" were first used by a former listed public company of that name in 1951. The "original" ACL was acquired by Repco in 1965. The Group is an amalgamation of 27 businesses over a period of 88 years. The ACL Group now has sales of $50m per annum and employs 170 people.

Please help us saving this worldwide recognized for best Quality performance bearing company!

Thank you,

story:
Next October 3rd, Damián Blaum will attempt to swim almost 33km, between Catalina Island and the Southern California mainland.  And on October 8th, he will swim from San Francisco to Alcatraz and back to San Francisco.

The Catalina swim presents significant challenges: cold water, lots of marine life that could include sharks, night swimming, and Damián will attempt to beat the global record that dates from the 70’s. He will also attempt to beat the current Alcatraz record.

He needs 7000 USD to cover his and his trainer's travel costs from Barcelona as well as his channel swim registration.

Once Damian covers his travel and swimming costs, he will start a second campaign to raise money for cancer research.  

Thank you in advance for your contribution!
